Review: there may not be critic alive who harbors as much affection for shlock monster movies as do delighted in the sneakysmart entertainment of ron underwoods bigundergroundworm yarn tremors even giggled at last years criticallysavaged bigunderwatersnake yarn anaconda something about these films causes me lower my inhibitions and return the saturday afternoons of my youth spent in the company of ghidrah the creature from the black lagoon and the blob deep rising bigunderseaserpent yarn does not quite pass the test sure enough all the modern monster movie ingredients are in place conspicuously multiethnicmultinational collection of bait excuse me characters an isolated location here derelict cruise ship in the south china sea some comic relief few cgienhanced grossouts and at least one big explosion there are toocheesytobeaccidental elements like sleazy shipping magnate anthony heald who also appears have doctorate in marine biology or slinky international jewel thief famke janssen whose white cotton tank top hides heart of gold as it happens deep rising is noteworthy primarily for the mechanical manner in it spits out all those ingredients terrorist crew led squintyeyed mercenary hanover wes studi and piloted squintyeyed boat captain finnegan treat williams shows up loot the cruise ship the sea monsters show up eat the mercenary crew few survivors make it the closing credits and up go the lights it is hard work up much enthusiasm for this sort of joyless filmmaking especially when monster moview should make you laugh every time it makes you scream here the laughs are provided almost entirely kevin oconnor generally amusing as the crews fraidycat mechanic writerdirector stephen sommers seems most concerned creating tone of actionhorror menace something overpopulated goredrenched skeletons something where the gunfire and special effects are taken bit too seriously deep rising is missing that one unmistakable cue that we are expected have ridiculous good time not hide our eyes case it point comparing deep rising its recent cousin anaconda in deep rising one of the creatures victims is regurgitated back into view partially digested and still alive he shrieks in horror at his freakish appearance and pain in moment bit too disturbing be laughable in anaconda we also see regurgitated victim partially digested and still alive he looks at another character and winks make no mistake deep rising has anaconda beat all heck when it comes technical proficiency and pacing it is also gloomy uninspired and not nearly enough fun do not ask much of my monster movies but do ask that they act like monster movies you do not have show me fantastically impressive massive beast tentacles aflailing just show me the massive beast burping and will figure you get the point

renee zellweger stars as sonia young jewish wife and mother frustrated the constraints of her hasidic community in brooklyn her husband glenn fitzgerald is religious scholar whose allinadayswork attitude on sex fails tame the fire she feels within as so she confesses the rebbe after hearing her fiery confession the rebbe suddenly gets frisky his pleasantly surprised wifeand dies the next morning sensing her frustration her husbands brother christopher eccleston gives her job in his jewelry brokering business in exchange for raw passionless sex that just fans sonias stillburning flame on the job sonia befriends ramon allen payne cool blast of hunky puerto rican water who does his own jewelry designs when not working as grunt in an upscale jewelry store can firetaming be far be that far behind for the eversmoldering sonia just about everything in writerdirector boaz yakins rings false starting the improbably cast zellweger who does an adequate enough acting job but simply looks too waspy for the role better fit would have been julianna margulies who outshines zellweger as sonias takenocrap sisterinlaw some of sonias baby steps toward liberation such as indulging in nonkosher egg roll in chinatown come off as silly yakin attempts spice up the proceedings touch of magical realismin the form of the recurring presence of sonias longdead brothers ghostmake the story feel even more trite than it already is did not know what expect it is like something you chase for so long but then you do not know how react when you get it still do not know how react michael jordan on winning his first nba championship in or my thoughts after meeting him on november

therere so many things criticize about do not know where start recommendation turn off your brain do not be like me decreasing the rating everyday because think about it too much comet is about strike earth causing catastrophe similar the extinction level event l that wiped out the dinosaurs what follows is the story of presidents bid think for the good of his people rising reporter the love story of two teenagers one of whom discovered the comet and team of astronauts on the ship messiah save the world firstly there is nothing outstandingly inferior about the making of the nor is there anything outstandingly good about it but the plot holes make the corny and stupid be honest was more moved the trailer than the itself is not saying much mimi leders followup the peacemaker is equally incompetent all the big stars wasted perhaps am just annoyed that the release of the peacemaker in the us overshadowed far superior thriller the assignment it is very obvious that the title not only represents the big boom that will result from the collision but also connotes the heavy impact on human lives however the simply fails on that note the effects are wornout the substandard screenplay limited the acting and the director continued her sad run in terms of goodfilmmaking credentials she is still making good money though a leonis unfortunate character the news reporter is the foundation of the story and of the cast but the suffers from too many characters that do not need be explored robert duvalls aging astronaut is lifeless and morgan freemans president is restricted well righteous president means he is not interesting at all leonis character is the only appealing one and is played reasonable conviction but rather peculiar showing when reporting for msnbc but was definitely undervalued the director and screenwriters warning spoilers included but lot of it is irrelevant and predictable anyway plot holes plot holes plot holes now l is threatening exterminate more than of the human race and they send eight puny little nuclear bombs up there where is the logic leder could have at least made it plausible and then it turns out that only few percent of the world population actually perish and those less selfish ones the ones that stayed at home were the victims the was almost mocking them telling them they had died for nothing also fail see how two teenagers carrying baby would be the first climb up the mountainhill even motorbike for headstart it is unlikely that the dust will take just two years settle but that does not really matter building caves was strategy mentioned in dr strangelove proposed that people lived underground for one hundred or so years now that is more practical use for caves what is the point of living in caves there is no unlike dr strangelove any radioactivity outside restrict exposure how do plants grow if humans have the technology keep plants alive in caves there is no reason why they cannot do it in the open the president disclosed that other countries have been preparing their own caves obviously this means that the other countries were informed long time ago and you cannot be serious say that nobody leaked the news the media in an important mission like that of the messiah for that matter any mission it is impossible that is not sufficient fuel for an extra couple of hundred metres needless say tens of kilometres this is not deep impact it is frivolous cheap impact but even all that some overacting and rating it is still watchable just do not think about it okay

do not let this movie fool you into believing the romantic noirs of william shakespeare no one will truly understand the heart and soul of this man except through his work and this movie makes vain attempt at that any moves glamorise his life has an annoying tendency do will only subtract from his achievement rather than expound on his greatness this movie about his life although well written puts too much makeup on man whose life was probably more pork and potatoes rather than lobster and champagne oh well let us fantasise onwards an assume that he was bit of flirtatious playwrite who falls in love beautiful woman gwyneth paltrow and from her inspiration several plays develop romeo and juliet and the twelfth night it is easier for me believe that he had wet dream and that is how all his plays develop but please spare me all of this unnecessary melodrama but guess my version probably would not draw crowd or make dollar on screen so is there any justification in romanticising the man shakespeare when all we need do is read his work in order find his soul think not as for the oscars were they deserved this movie think not in many aspects private ryan and life is beautiful were far superior movies but one should never assume that this should be criteria for winning an oscar as time and again for reasons unexplained an undeserving movie will win the accolade another sore point is the fact that gwyneth won the best female lead over more polished cate but guess if you go on enough about your grandfather dying and your nephew being hospitalised people will start feeling sorry for you

it is good thing most animated scifi movies come from japan because titan e is proof that does not have clue how do it do not know what this is supposed be about from what can tell it is about young man named kale who is one of the last survivors of earth in the early st century who unknowingly possesses the key saving and regenerating what is left of the human race that is fine premise for an actionpacked scifi animated movie but there is no payoff the story takes the main characters all over the galaxy in their search for legendary ship that the evil dredge aliens want destroy for no apparent reason so in the process we get lot of spaceship fights fistfights blaster fights and more doublecrosses than you can shake stick at there is so much pointless scifi banter it is too much take the galaxy here is total ripoff of the star wars universe the creators do not bother filling in the basic details makes the story confusing the characters unmotivated and superficial and the plot just plain boring despite the fantastic animation and special effects it is just not an interesting movie

in the year captain leo davidson mark wahlberg boogie nights is training his chimp pericles pilot pod from the usaf oberon space station when an electromagnetic storm is encountered and pericles pod is lost davidson sets out unauthorized and lands thousands of years in the future on the planet of the apes maybe if th century fox had set the proverbial chimps in front of typewriters they would have gotten better results than this adaptation of the pierre boulle novel william broyles jr cast away and lawrence konner mark rosenthal mighty joe young director tim burtons unique look and style are nowhere be found in this silly pointless remake davidson no sooner lands than he finds himself being swarmed savages running in terror whom he wisely joins however he is rounded up the lot of them the apes rule this plant and handed over slave trader limbo paul giamatti duets ari helena bonham carter fight club daughter of the illustrious senator sandar david warner titanic and simian bleeding heart believes humans should live apes on equal standing an unpopular notion she takes liking leo who she deems unusual general thade tim roth lucky numbers is of the opposite opinion wishing for declaration of martial law that will allow him annihilate the race he is sweet on ari it is relatively easy see where this new story is going from the onset yet its ultimate revelation has gaping logic holes the much ballyhooed surprise ending is nonsensical let down an attempt at love triangle conveyed ari and the human daena estella warren driven giving each other back off looks over leo fails because he never develops relationship either of them the lone sex scene is some hilarious foreplay between elder orangutan senator nado glenn shadix and his trophy wife nova burtons squeeze lisa marie guffaws will also likely greet charlton hestons cameo as thades father the one ape harboring firearm who sputters some very familiar lines before dying the only real success of the planet of the apes is rick bakers makeup and even that is an iffy affair no attempt was made change the human whiteness of the actors eyes real distraction amidst some otherwise impressive work roth warner and michael clarke duncan as thades right hand man attar are given the most impressive makeovers giamatti looks more like skull than an ape and the female apes are too humanized be given sexual appeal tim roth delivers the most impressive acting job getting the body language right his nasty chimpanzee character leaps about most spectacularly when mounting his steed but evens he is undone some obvious wire work bonham carter delivers goodly range of emotion from behind stiff prosthetic but is undone in turn the silliness of the writing most of the has set bound look no amount of mist can cover the apes city resembles dank complex of tree houses the apes military costumes colleen atwood sleepy hollow as well as their field tents are reminiscent of eiko ishiokas work on coppolas dracula that oriental flavor is also found in danny elfmans tribal percussive score planet of the apes was the last blockbuster hope for the summer of dismal movie season that is going the dogs

writing screenplay for thriller is hard harder than pouring concrete under the texas sun harder than building bridge over troubled waters and incidentally whole heck of lot harder than writing movie review thrillers are all variations on theme you have smart resourceful and powerful bad guy who has goal he has meet you have noble and brave good guy who has protect the innocent kill the bad guy and not get killed himself in the process the trick of thriller writing is doing all of this in an interesting and novel manner this simple formula can lead classic movies like north northwest high noon or silence of the lambs or big summer blockbusters like men in black the fugitive or air force one or it can lead utter dreck like masterminds event horizon kull the conqueror is anyone else getting depressed here point is it is not enough follow the formula you have got throw in something extra something good and new and better than the last version something surprise and move all of us people who buy the tickets and the popcorn and the happy meals this is hard thing do but it is absolutely necessary in every way without that something extra whether it is great plot or wellwritten screenplay or great special effects or great locations or great casting or great performances or great big hungry dinosaurs the movie fails that is why the jackal all its starpower all its budget all its hype gets big fat bruce willis is the bad guy the jackal legendary killer for hire richard gere is the good guy former ira assassin vendetta against the jackal the jackal is trying kill someone gere is trying stop him will gere be able stop the assassination in time and kill the jackal will give you three guesses and the first two do not count there are no surprises awaiting the audience in the jackal no moment when you say yourself wonder what happens next the script for the jackal is not ripped straight from todays headlines it is ripped off straight from an episode of millennium throughout the movie we learn what the jackals plans are and how he intends accomplish them no surprise the fun of movie like this should come from richard gere figuring out what the jackals plan is and developing clever plan foil the bad guy instead we get two count em two scenes where gere is sitting in an fbi conference room somewhere and instantly divines the jackals plan just as if he is frank black or more likely just as if he is been handed copy of the script and we never get more than superficial clue as why gere has had this flash of insight it is like geres character is psychic but neither he nor the fbi or the screenwriters seem know it and just like in millennium the bad guy has an overwhelming need go after the people the good guy cares about whether or not they are important what he is trying do or not what is more in the last half of the movie the jackal supposedly supersmart professional terrorist who never makes mistake comes down major case of the stupids as for the performances bruce willis manages get through the whole movie without wisecrack is major achievement but not enough reason see the movie his disguises are good but not as good or as interesting as val kilmers in the saint richard gere is made talk the entire movie in an irish accent detracts from his otherwise lifeless and dull performance sidney poitier is probably the most disappointing element in overwhelmingly disappointing movie not that his performance is bad or anything it is not but it is sad that will not use this talented actor in any part other than an fbi agent shoot kill sneakers writing good plot and good screenplay like said is hard but it can be done it was not done here it is our job as consumers reward good screenplays and denounce bad and uninteresting ones do not go see this movie you will only encourage the producers make more just like it instead stay home and rent day of the jackal or in the line of fire or fire safety video for crying out loud anything other than the jackal lives up its name gnawing the dead bones of other better movies

all right all right we get the point despite all similarities the bestselling story speechless is not based on the romance between presidential campaign rivals james carville and mary matalin in fact the script was in development well before still the comparisons are inevitable until one realizes critical difference no it is not that the speechless twosome are speech writers not campaign managers it is that carville and matalins story is actually interesting speechless is limp poorly structured wouldbe romantic comedy speechless is set during new mexico senatorial campaign where kevin vallick michael keaton and julia mann geena davis meet and get romantic one night when neither one can sleep what neither one realizes is that they are on opposite sides of the campaign kevin is sitcom writer brought in punch up the republican candidates speeches while julia is the chief speech writer for the democratic candidate at first each one believes that the other has an ulterior motive for the relationship but eventually they let down their guard and become closer but there are plent of obstacles in the way including julias studreporter fiance christopher reeve and series of stunts continue prove that alls fair in love and politics the standard formula for movie like speechless would have the two principles starting out as antagonists and realizing only at the end that they are crazy about each other screenwriter robert king completely subverts expectations throwing kevin and julia into each others arms in the first fifteen minutes then developing the antagonism it is noble attempt shake things up but unfortunately it just does not work part of the fun of watching sparring in romantic comedy comes from recognizing the chemistry even before the characters do but in speechless they already know they are attracted each other and we are left waiting for the campaign end so they will admit that they love each other already there is such herkyjerky feel the constant bickering and making up that even kings sharp dialogue cannot prevent speechless from becoming repetitive after about half an hour inconsistency is also the defining characteristic of the performances of geena davis and michael keaton and those performances most of their scenes together the problems begin their initial courtship does virtually nothing establish julias character and merely establishes that kevin is wiseass davis is radiantly beautiful and keaton is generally entertaining but these characters are so plastic that nothing that happens them seems matter one bit in couple of scenes like quiet moment sitting at fountain they actually achieve some measure of connection for the most part however they are just actors spouting lines you keep waiting for little spark and it never happens perhaps most disappointing is that king and director ron underwood completely waste their premise removing all the punch from speechlesss politics the setting seems perfect for high energy battle of the sexes partisanship thrown into the mix but that is never the tone that underwood is going for he wants warm fuzzy romance compatible marc shaimans fluteandwind musical score and the campaign should have defined the conflict between kevin and julia fades into the background it might as well have been story about rival grocers and every single character is about as uninspired as he or she could possibly be was about the only reviewer in the civilized world who seemed enjoy robert kings previous screenplay the dana carvey flop clean slate so had some hopes for speechless but while there is wit in the words this is script was probably much better on paper on screen it is still paper thin

teenagers have lot of power in every year countless films will be made targeting that audience in particular and rely on the entire teenage population turn out on friday and saturday nights wallets in hand the formula is very simple you make big name young actor or actress sex appeal you add high school environment that features everyone from prom queens math club nerds and then very simple relationship conflict that can be worked out in minutes the typical teenage attention span the response is enormous as this part of the population will waste its money on almost any set in an environment they can relate and most importantly they dont care judge films quality so any piece of trash will due that is just what never been kissed the latest from director raja gosnell is trash josie geller drew barrymore is the youngest copy editor in the history of the chicago sun times she has her own personal assistant unlimited supplies and her own office but she is very much dismayed her position in life there is nothing she wants more than be reporter and go out into the field where she can play more active role in the chicago media so when an assignment is quite literally thrown at her out of nowhere she jumps at it elation constantly smothering josie in the work place is her friend anita molly shannon and her amicable superior gus john reilly the two of them are both stricken horror upon hearing the news of her first assignment as they both deem her be an office worker and not reporter however since this is aimed at teenage audience little patience for character conflict this otherwise interesting scenario is resolved within two minutes and josie is headed for the field obviously the field assignment involves high school specifically she is become an undercover reporter at high school enrolling in the senior class and becoming one of them dont think that need even begin explain all the impossibilities of this situation ever occurring so wont the movie develops into josie trying find the life that she never led in high school interwoven flashback scenes show us just how much of dork she truly was and she appears be heading down that road again fortunately for this lame production other characters do appear that make some of these high school scenes both humorous and remotely interesting they include the predictable love stories between both student jeremy jordan and teacher michael vartan show that josie is really two people in one body also her younger brother and opposite rob david arquette comes into her new found life and even causes rare scene that is mildly provocative the humor found in this is actually quite amusing typical for teenage films it is chalk full of sexual innuendoes and condom humor one scene in particular features certain classroom activity involving bananas and latex that is absolutely hysterical most of the other jokes are straight forward high school humor that anyone who has ever been high school can appreciate and will enjoy but those still dont recover for the total lack of quality in this movie following this trend of high school movie rules comes the general acting it is even worse than the trend of overplaying scenario from in this case drew barrymore is absolutely painful watch she is required play her character on two levels having some very black and white transitions and although some scenes are written be particular shades of gray she seems hold that color throughout all of her screen time at one point she is alone an obvious love interest on ferris wheel and is expected him on an adult level since he is one her teacher but she never seems get out of the gray area and in doing so she makes mockery out of his otherwise good performance following barrymore is the pitiful molly shannon saturday night live she seems be limited playing an ecstatic character that no one can relate and draws the attention of an audience as simply unrealistic it is these qualities that prevent the aforementioned condom scene from being one of the few decent luckily there is one great performance emerge out of this otherwise bleak david arquette scream takes home the prize for being able stand out in an ensemble performance that is absolutely pathetic and not have his brilliant acting ruined and as central character he gets take on his own miniplot is one of the few well done parts of never been kissed in dazzling cherryonthesundae type piece of work he does an absolutely hilarious tom cruise impression from the hit risky business never been kissed is mediocre at best the predictable plot has become so overplayed in that it is sickening watch time and again and this is no exception the acting is just as bad but there is the one positive presence of david arquette add some light unfortunately the bottom line is that the movie will be success because teenagers will pay see any trash

walken stars as mobster who is kidnapped and held for ransom four bratty rich kids it seems that woman has also been kidnappedshe is the sister of one of them t henry thomas and the girlfriend of another flannery and the asking price is million said snots are unable cough up alone they even cut off walkens finger show they mean business because they are desperate save the womans life suicide kings is terrible walken aside there is not single appealing cast member ofallon creates characters that are functional types without any resonance in an amusingly unironic scene walken plays poker the foursome and describes each of their personalities teeit is as if he was reading the summary sheet for casting director the plot is another issue entirely ofallon is someone whom am betting has seen reservoir dogs and the usual suspects too many times for not only does his story veer off on bizarre tangents from whence they never return do we really need the scene where dennis leary beats up an abusive father toaster is entirely unrelated both the story and learys character or the numerous anecdotal sequences but the central plot itself is serpentine mess filled crosses and double crosses and triple crosses the fourth big revelationtwist had completely tuned out wondering what on earth attracted these actors the material recently peer fellow young filmmaker informed me that he had an idea for movie about four guys the mob and the fbi it occurred me then what is wrong indies like suicide kings suspect ofallon has never met mobster is not rich man does not deliver endless clever monologues his friends about his favourite types of boots in short these guys are just riffing on other movies and in doing that making the same over and over and over again tarantino found his niche and now hundreds of genxers movie cameras are trying find tarantinos niche instead of carving their own reviewed at the toronto international festival

from writer and director darren stein comes jawbreaker the poorly told tale of what can happen when an innocent birthday prank goes wrong at reagan high four girls are sitting on top of the world courtney shane played rose mcgowan holds the title of meanest most disrespectful soul in the school everyone hates her but everyone envies her due her popularity courtney is the leader of her clique also includes julie played rebecca gayheart liz purr played charlotte roldan and marcie played julie benz are the other three in the group it is lizs seventeenth birthday and julie courtney and marcie concur that they will play seemingly innocent prank on her but the prank results in the death of liz just like stupid teens in any teen directed such as this one the foursome decide cover up the death make it look like murder committed someone else and also just like in other teen directed movies one of the four do not agree hiding it this time that character being julie and finally just like in other teen movies there is witness outside the group trying hide the truth this time that character being fern mayo judy greer who is subject many cracks from courtneys group as well as the entire school from here jawbreaker turns into predictable tale of revenge bad morals and at least trying do the right thing not only is the script weak on whole the acting is horrid thanks large amount of the main cast judy greer is undeniably awful as her one dimensional annoying character as she overacts every line she has also on the bad side of acting is julie benz almost falling the annoying factor that greer delivers on the positive side of acting rose mcgowan performs well here but does not match her wickedly clever performance as tatum in scream mcgowans role is annoying but this only adds the she is wickedly mean and even though she wellwritten character you downright hate her faring even better than mcgowan is rebecca gayheart who is always exceptionally believable as her roles when the script feeds her one or two dimensional character she turns it into three always putting strong emotion and power into her roles gayheart is not given as much do here as she was in urban legend but you can still get strong taste of her acting skills in jawbreaker jawbreaker drifts and mianders different sub plots throughout hardly throwing anything for the viewer get absorbed in we get way off of the topic of the jawbreaker incident and get into things that do not have anything do the actual the beginning and ending are strong it is just the middle that needs lot of help during the body of the movie it is undeniably repetitive never progressing towards conclusion nothing grab the viewers interest is around and the same extremely annoying song plays over and over again jawbreaker tries get off on the same time of humor used in the clueless but falls flat the few gags that actually work die off quickly and die off bang all in all horrible disappointment the bottom line the tagline reads even the sweetest candies are sour as death inside yes that is too true no matter how good this may have looked it fails deliver

well there goes another one sadly this like other movies this year was not good this one being almost as bad as the omega code but not quite from the opening credits had good feeling this would be bad and well guess was right bad excuses for acting horrible screenplay and straightout bad direction the bachelor is terribly unfunny movie that does not work on any levels accept that fact that rene zellwegar who does give good performance the two cameos brooke shields and mariah carey are also good brooke being the best the movie is troubled from the start because chris odonnell is hugely miscast and gives one of the worst performances date here is the stupid plot chris odonnell plays jimmie shelton man who has just broken up his girlfriend he meets anne rene zellwegar they instantly hit it off and are together for three years jimmie decides that he wants bring their relationship little bit up he really does not realize that anne thinks he wants marry her what he wants never did catch so he proposes in really bad way and she shoots him down and is very mad he of course tries apologize but nothing seems help any then his grandfather dies and he learns that he has left jimmie million dollars as long as he marries before the next day at pm now jimmie must find anne and try marry her get the money and because he loves her or get married someone else get the money itself leading an unfunny and predictable ending that leaves bad taste in our mouths ok so maybe this could be one of the dumbest cliched silliest romantic comedy date that has no real big laughs even the supporting roles of artie lange hal holbrook and ed anser are not even good the plot was good idea but the script would have have been written in less than five minutes and five year old the choppy dialogue and bad directing do not help things any even though chris odonnell gave an ok performance in the two batman movies he does not give even remotely good or funny performance here and wanted boo and throw my pop at the screen get rid of him rene zelweggar is different story and gave charming sweet and likable performance as usual and really was the only thing that saved this confused movie from being total huge washout her sister played marley shelton is also good and the two have good chemistry onscreen brooke shields showed up in funny little performance as bigheaded mogul who after while became routine and old one really cannot help but think that we have seen this stuff before it is not like this is an original idea and in the end everyone knows what is going happen due do its cliches and typicalness the bachelor works on no good levels and in fact does not work at all ed anser and hal holbrook were wasted in terrible roles and mariah carey can not act save her soul and this could be the only of her movie career dispite her terrific music career chris odonnell is not as bad an actor as casper van dien but that is not saying great deal he seems held back and really does not get into his character much and after even the first minutes gets annoying and old artie lange just me seems like he is trying another chris farley and was completely unfunny and unnerving why the filmmakers would want waste such cast in such bad movie such bad acting and dialogue is question only they will know maybe they thought it would become hit or critical success and sometimes do not agree other critics on movies even from the trailers for this they made it look bad and showed all the mildly funny parts its based on the silent seven chances am sure is very better than this mess even though some may think of this as good date movie most who see this will want pull out thier hair and scream for thier money back besides being terrible movie the bachelor is well terrible movie it has nothing worth recommending therefore really cannot recommend this movie did not have good time and laughed only three times the running time of the movie is minutes is wayyyy over time and needs be shortened at least thirty minutes parts of it seems go on forever and parts of seem not last enough time being one of the worst movies of the year we can be sure that hope they will not make anymore stupid unfunny romantic comedies and if they do they give up on filmmakers

my inner flag was at halfmast last year when nick at nite pulled dragnet reruns off the air sure would seen them all at least once but could always count on at least few inadvertent laughs from ultraserious jack webb when there was nothing else on tv even though dragnet is out of circulation at the moment we webb antifans still have the i s propaganda piece for the military that is almost as hilarious as the famous blue boy episode of dragnet for anyone like me who got laughs out of webbs rapidfire speeches and straightfaced seriousness think of the i as what would happen if sgt joe friday ever enlisted because he plays exactly the same character here nononsense old fart who looks disdain at the younger generation and loves give long winded melodramatic speeches on any topic in this election year am more convinced than ever that webb and bob dole were separated at birth the movie opens in characteristic fashion as one recruit after another knocks on webbs office door and enters he gives each one different series of cranky criticisms before the credits come up the produced and directed jack webb card pretty much goes without saying this is his movie all the way and after the first twenty minutes of him chewing out his recruits for no reason was wondering if there would even be plot certainly would have been entertained an hour and half of trademark webb rants but the i gives us more much more webbs mission is make man out of private owens the local screwup the captain gives webb three days convert owens into marine material or the captain will personally cut the lace off his panties and ship him out myself whether the lace panties part refers webb or owens remains unanswered this of course gives webb an excuse focus all his crotchety energy on making owens life living hell for those of you who have not been indoctrinated into the pleasures of webb watching heres reprint of typical monologue of his cannot duplicate his hilarious delivery on paper but the words should at least partially convey what am talking about now you listen me youngster someday you will wake up fighting on beach and you will pray god somebody does not get killed because of your foolishness have got headline for you every time you make one of those little mistakes of yours you are gonna turn around and will be standing right there could not write down all the reprintable dialogue from the i nearly all of it belongs in the bad movie hall of fame but tried include some of the more noteworthy lines like one from the scene where webb unwinds from hard days work going the local bar where he orders tomato juice he meets woman who coincidentally also orders tomato juice but walks away from typicallystimulating conversation webb flirt his archrival another marine i webb marches over the table gets up in her face and says just what kind of dame do you think you are bogart he as not the other i gets one of the few memorable nonwebb lines when he confesses the girl he is damn good i guess am just little jealous join the club we are all jealous of jack webbs way women is showcased even more amusingly in later scene as webb finds his way the womans place frank detorris bill murray single dad who lives on beer and junk food no apparent understanding of sanitation or hygiene much the dismay of his preteen daughter shane elena franklin when he uses the second rule retrieve hard boiled egg from chimps cage at the zoo and downs it he introduces lethal bacteria into his system inside his skin the city of frank is in turmoil thanks the votepandering of mayor phlegmming voice of william shatner so it is up one frank pd white blood cell voice of chris rock save the day in peter and bobby farrellys osmosis jones the city of frank is brightly animated animation directed piet kroon and tom sito cellular municipality where osmosis jones is typical rogue cop looking for another chance he is inadvertently teamed up drix voice of david hyde pierce tvs frasier cold capsule hours worth of painkillers dispense this quarrelling duo are about go on fantastic voyage in order hunt down thrax voice of laurence fishburne the virus intent on shutting down frank while the animation is certainly colorful look at osmosis jones story is hackneyed one the story cries out for puny puns but we only get occasional sprinklings of wit or bodily humor drix graduated phi beta capsule he departs on bus headed for bladder neither the hero or villain is particularly interesting thrax looks like an animated predator although hyde pierce is delightful sidekick adults can desperately keep their eyes peeled for small amusements the animators dot along the landscape meanwhile back in live action land bill murray is reduced nothing more than walking grossout joke there is no particular enjoyment be found watching him vomit on molly shannon she plays shanes teacher mrs boyd or hoisting his ingrown toenail onto restaurant table one must wonder how the climatic flatlining of childs father will play the family audience as well rest assured the whole enchilada is wrapped up fart joke while far less offensive than the farrellys last effort me myself and irene that at least spiked some comic highs jim carreys hijinx osmosis jones will probably be ok for the kids but the farrellys playing for the family audience is like watching marilyn manson croon phil collins tune

woof too bad that leap of faith was the title of comedy starring steve martin and debra winger because that is what is required watch this incredulous howler starring bruce willis asof all thingsa psychologist not since the reagan administration has there been an acting stretch of such magnitude alas mickey rourke we hardly knew ye story opens campy kickwillis is treating patient who abruptly steps out of the window take the best flying leap since charles durning dove in the hudsucker proxy she goes splat he goes ugh and his character spends the rest of the colorblind really the good doctor then moves sunny a where he rooms an old college chum scott bakula therapist who is getting death threats from someone in his monday evening group buddy bites it in the second reel no surprise there and willis agrees take over both the group and the death threats for his troubles as therapy man willis gets share some cutfromnc love scenes the lovers jane march while dodging nails cars and rattlesnakes whyd it have be snakes color of night is the worst movie of the year period forget north clifford or heaven help us even on deadly ground here is movie misfire so audaciously awful that you cannot help but wonder how the actors all kept straight faces while filming for starters the group is collection of mixed nuts better suited bob newhart than bruce willis these are realistic portrayals of the mentally unhealthy playing prissy obsessivecompulsive cuckoos nest alumni brad dourif alone may set the psychology profession back ten years the plots wreck laughable dialogue pointless pov shifts and the one big secret solvable in the first fifteen minutes director richard rush who once helmed freebie and the bean does not seem mind unfazed the nincompoop plot and cuckoo there is only one presidential election every four years but it seems like every few months we get another presidential conspiracy movie painted as _the_ thriller of the year in we have had absolute power air force one shadow conspiracy and murder at this one is about as lame duck as old gerald ford trying bring us complex plot of coverup and intrigue but copping out over and over again rehashes of action flick standbys heres what happens this time it is night at the white house secretary is having sex some unidentified guy cute butt the next day she is dead and hotshot detective wesley snipes is called in how do we know he is hotshot we have seen the traditional action flick opener the clever hostage negotiation scene it is not so clever this time consisting of snipes disarming suicidal exgovernment employee holding gun his head in the middle of the street snipes is off the white house where he finds the secret service head the shiny bald head of daniel benzali will not cooperate him at all in fact if not for the intervention of national security adviser alan alda snipes would not have been allowed in the white house at all alda helps snipes out further assigning sexy secret service agent diane lane act as his liaison very dangerous liaison well not really just wanted say that almost immediately suspect is found an eccentric night janitor seen flirting the deceased on one of the security videos snipes does not buy it and launches into an independent investigation of his own one that reveals planted evidence and romantic involvement the presidents son snipes partner an always wisecracking dennis miller calls him up every once in awhile more news and lane who at first does not believe snipes eventually and predictably comes around and risks her ass break into social security storage and break out some classified information for the first hour or so murder at looks like it could be going somewhere interesting sure we have sit through the lame opening sequence and plenty more lame scenes after that but the whole murder in the white house thing makes for an interesting premise that is never quite delivered upon snipes and lane do not make for bad action team but nothing work they are just cogs in the bad movie machine dennis miller might as well not even be in the movie they waste his talents more in murder at than they did in bordello of blood and that is saying lot when you get the last halfhour the movie has descended metaphorically and literally into wet sewer busting out the old breakintothebuilding underground climax and when they finally reveal who killed the woman and why you will wish you never sat through this movie at all the in the movies title does not represent an address it represents the number of satisfied customers worldwide serving the world for nearly th of century

michael robbins hardball is quite the cinematic achievement in about two hours we get glancing examination of ghetto life funeral heartfelt eulogy speeches about never giving up cache of cute kids including fat one asthma hardluck gambler who finds salvation in good woman and climactic big game where the underdogs prove have bigger bite than anyone ever imagined all that is needed is guy getting hit in the nuts and food fight have the first solely based on cinematic clich i cannot wait see the deleted scenes when it comes out on dvd obviously hardball is strikeout of movie that never gets the bat anywhere near the ball it stars keanu reeves as the aforementioned gambler who seems owe every bookie in chicago an amount of money that rivals the gross national product of guam out of solutions he begs his successful corporate friend the always welcome mike mcglone lend him instead mcglone offers reeves the chance help him coach youth baseball team from the projects for nice weekly stipend reeves who wants keep his fingers accepts the offer but discovers mcglone is only too happy let him handle the team entirely the drowsyvoiced protagonist must teach the sassy inner city kids the baseball basics in life of absentee parents and merciless gangs and maybe just maybe they will play in the big championship game one of the glorious surprises in the screenplay john gatins summer catch adapted from daniel coyles nonfiction book is that there are not any the movie coasts from heartfelt moment heartfelt moment like zombie that would not be so bad if the characters had an ounce of subtlety or humanity them most of the kids time is spent yelling at each other talking in slang and acting surprised there is little that is naturally amusing about them as they all seem know the cameras are rolling the worst of the lot is toughtalking younger player dewayne warren whose sole purpose as the movie unfolds is being an emotional pawn tactic so utterly despicable cannot find the right words express myself the adults also do not fare well reeves is impressively uninspiring as the downonhisluck loser the character is poorly written but reeves gives another charismafree performance every time he speaks he sounds like he just got up from long nap and is gradually waking up kids are supposed rally around this guy diane lane who costars as reeves obligatory love interest remains glowing screen presence see my dog skip for better proof it is too bad that her role here consists of uttering lines like these kids trust you and they do not trust anyone then there is b sweeney as an evil rival coach and john hawkes as reeves scummy betting buddy and other unoriginal characters you have seen before and hope never see again wanted hardball be good robbins varsity blues was funny and alternately taut tale of texas high school football that had ali larter smothered in whipped cream and jon voight sneering at everything that moved have not seen robbins goofy ready rumble in its entirety but am intrigued that macho man randy savage and martin landau can exist in the same movie without there being serious worldwide repercussions robbins obviously needs go back his forte making sports movies for guys and not cutesy cuddly pap such as hardball also manages annoy and insult the audience heres hoping that happens in the immediate future

you know something christmas is not about presents it is about overhyped holiday films lots of merchandising and product tieins at least that would seem be the message of the grinch has been advertised since last christmas and whose logo is currently plastered all over stores expects us ignore this cynical greed as the movie scolds us about losing the true spirit of the season you know the plot there is this evil furry green guy called the grinch jim carrey who lives on mountain overlooking whoville down below all the whos are preparing for their whobilation but the grinch is determined steal their christmas the movie is of course liveaction version of the beloved childrens book was previously adapted into tv special looney tunes animator chuck jones it is rare that big budget release is shamed thirtyyearold halfhour cartoon but that is the case when jones version is compared ron howards the tv grinch hit all the right notes boris karloffs soft deep narration thurl ravenscroft singing mr grinch max the dog weighed down the gigantic antler tied his head and the grinchs wide toothless grin contrast the movie hits one sour note after another first there are the numerous bad choices that jeffrey price and peter seaman made in padding out the short book into minute movie young wideeyed cindy lou who taylor momsen is depressed about the misplaced priorities of her parents bill irwin and molly shannon during the holiday season she begins sympathize the grinch who turns out be surprisingly sympathetic cindy lou discovers that the grinch turned tearfully away from whoville in grammar school when he was publicly humiliated while expressing his love for the prettiest girl in the class martha may whovier played as an adult christine baranski are we expected like the grinch hate the whos and want him steal christmas the grinch is not even the villain here that role is filled the corrupt mayor of whoville jeffrey tambor who was the grinchs rival for marthas affection not only are the characters needlessly complex but the oncesimple plot becomes so convoluted that the actual theft of christmas seems like an afterthought the casting choices are not any better than the screenwriting decisions jim carrey seems woefully miscast while his face is so supple that the rubber makeup seems superfluous carrey brings nothing else the role his accent keeps changing assume he was shooting for karloff but he ends up sounding like weird slurry of richard nixon sean connery and cartman from south park not knowing what else do during his many scenes alone in the grinchs home carrey falls back on his standup comedy and clowns around ace venturastyle needless say his wisecracking antics do not quite fit the character of the grinch who is an embittered loner filled hate little taylor momsen brings little role of cindy lou except big eyes and cute smile she would have been fine if cindy lou was limited her original purpose in the seuss story finding santa in her living room stealing the tree however the expanded script makes cindy as important as the grinch and momsen is not up the challenge bottom line when you are stealing christmas movies leave this one behind

in the mids following the splendid debut in hugh hudsons greystoke and relative success of first highlander it looked like christopher lamberts acting career might go somewhere but it was not meant be became obvious following highlander ii in this decade christopher lambert became associated films low budgets and even lower quality very often such films were science fiction meant that the fans of that genre learned the hard way what evade anything starring christopher lambert whether it was because of real lack of talent terrible miscasting or simple bad luck is not important the end result was almost always horrible the same can be said for fortress science fiction directed stuart gordon director who created cult following his horror gorefests like reanimator and from beyond the movie is set in for some undisclosed reason usa introduced strict population control and couples are barred from having more than one child jake christopher lambert and karen brennick lori laughlin broke that law and are caught authorities on the border sentenced years in prison they are both thrown into fortress privately owned correctional facility equiped stateoftheart futuristic technology and run computer called zed although equiped gismos that regulate every aspect of inmates lives and make any escape impossible prison authorities often use violence jake survives many ordeals and earns respect of some inmates would help him when he begins planing the escape such escape should become necessity because the warden poe kurtwood smith begins showing unhealthy interest in karen after rather intriguing beginning and some interesting special effects that depict the futuristic settings of prison this soon starts sinking into mediocrity the reason is in the screenplay that quickly degenerates into whole series of prison movie clich and situations that are painfully predictable the time brennick begins his escape from fortress those situations not only begin look predictable but utterly implausible too of course never tried explain why the country that lacks resources support its present population happens spend bucketloads of money on ultraexpensive supertechnology sole intention of keeping alive most useless and dangerous members of the society the initially interesting plot is done even more wrong stereotyped characters played not too interested or talented actors lori laughlin although physically attractive shows the acting ability of sequoia kurtwood smith as prison warden is rather uninspired capable of solid yet forgettable performance lamberts performance is also good but even the bigger talent could not help this destined end in oblivion

susan grangers review of the musketeer universal pictures launches another assault on classic literature this million adaptation of alexandre dumass novel that is strong on action but weak on drama fusing hong kong martial arts th century swordplay the story chronicles the adventures of the dashing dartagnan justin chambers as he leaves his village of gascogne headed for paris join king louis xiiis elite guard the royal musketeers and search for the man who killed his parents years earlier this puts him in conflict the formidable febre tim roth vicious henchman for conniving cardinal richelieu stephen rea the traditional musketeer trio aramis nick moran athos jan gregor kremp and porthos steve speirs do not offer much help so he turns the feisty francesca mena suvari chambermaid the queen of france catherine deneuve scripter gene quintano and directorcinematographer peter hyams are primarily interested in the derringdo as evidenced choreographer xinxin xiongs elaborate but not original stunts including fastpaced stagecoach chase tavern brawl on rolling barrels highwire acrobatics the combatants dangling from ropes and ladderfight sequence filmed in southern france the scenery sets and costumes are spectacular but the lighting is too dark and editing is filled choppy restless mtvish cuts as the swashbuckling dartagnan bland calvin klein model justin chambers buckles where he should be swashing totally lacking onscreen charisma not mention acting skill mena suvari so impressive in american beauty seems like contemporary interloper in the royal court on the granger movie gauge of the musketeer is cinematic but shallow all for one and one for all not this time round

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned at the end of the day those reflecting upon the debacle that is the avengers would do well take note that warning clouds loomed on the horizon for the project well before warner bros made the contentious decision abandon preview press screenings and scrapped plans for gala premiere this highlyanticipated rendition of the cult television show was originally slotted for an early june opening where it would have gone headtohead against the rival studios heavy hitters its eventual demotion less potent midaugust opening was an obvious early indication of the studios lack of confidence the picture and good reason this is joyless exercise of held together barely coherent plot and lacking any semblance of excitement thrills or wit remarkable in its banality and brutally uninvolving the avengers is catastrophic mess immediately invites comparisons last years case study in style over substance joel schumachers muchloathed batman robin indeed both films even feature appalling ridiculous sequences find central characters dressed up in fuzzy oversized costumes uma thurman who takes on the salacious role of the catsuitclad karatechopping emma peel immortalized diana rigg was the only bright spot in the aforementioned schumacher disaster imbuing her poison ivy dose of sassiness and sly wit that gave audiences something smile at amidst the cinematic carnage unfortunately the same cannot be said here where she and cohort ralph fiennes our new john steed taking over for patrick macnee demonstrate no appreciable chemistry whatsoever fatally crippling the picture as they volley fizzling repartee back and forth and trade doubleentendres all the enthusiasm of two actors painfully aware that they are on board sinking ship at this rate usuallysplendid actor mr fiennes may never make the transition from arthouse apollo mainstream leading man his tepid turn here will make as much of an inroad as his commendably seedy performance in the regrettablyneglected kathyrn bigelow strange days the duo look the part and admittedly the avengers is more than most heavily dependent upon style but they are no fun watch and found myself growing increasingly distant and annoyed the lack of spark between the two cheekily ironic characters as they navigated through the pictures caperesque plot when not checking my wristwatch or shifting restlessly in my seat began alleviate the boredom considering how this all might have played out had the filmmakers chose go instead that erstwhile emma as our mrs peel no not kate beckinsale although the notion now intrigues me but gwyneth paltrow who was originally in the running for the part and can veritably handle spoton english accent if nothing else it would at least be highly entertaining for the incongruous sight of the vaguely twiggish young actress kicking butt the story such as it is involves the everbemused tandem of steed and peel combating the malevolent sir august de wynter sean connery an eccentric aristocrat threatening the safety of the nation his climatecontrolling contraption they also sip lot of tea overlooking some goofy cloning nonsense and quirky hijinx involving our protagonists superiors it sounds far better than it plays and is rendered almost indecipherable blatant postproduction tinkering it is clearly evident that the picture has been cut shreds the avengers was never about gripping drama and our heroes accordingly never take villainous sir august very seriously but given the lack of cohesion in the plot and the lack of menace conveyed the buffoonish maniac it is all decidedly uncompelling mr connery who is onscreen barely long enough register an impression approaches the role like man fulfilling contractual obligation simultaneously chewing the scenery while unable hide his disinterest at least it all looks good this is genuinely handsome production fine costume design anthony powell and crisply shot roger pratt in particular the gleaming production design stuart craig commands attention adeptly drawing elements both old and new in order depict this great britain there are handful of striking visual moments in the including an attack swarm of giant robotic bees and nice shot of steed and peel finding way walk on water but the is so unremittingly dull that even these instances fail stir interest or raise pulse rates the time the films climax had arrived my interest was not the sight of steed and sir august slugging it out amidst crashing waves and thundering rain but the quickest escape route from the theatre not coincidentally the enticing bits of visual bravura were the shots assembled into the movies remarkable trailer savvy piece of work ironically is infinitely more appealing that the feature itself the first promo made the rounds in early spring is probably my favourite studio trailer so far this year it is everything that the avengers is not saucy clever engaging and entertaining crushing disappointment the is one of the worst outings of the year too drearily awful be savoured as gleefully bad too polished overlook its deficiencies there may be upcoming pictures that are even more lifeless than the avengers but sure hope not

stallone attempts act in this cop drama the is set in neighbourhood pratically built kietal who is nephew played michael rappaport is involved in car crash and killing of two black youths keital dosent really want get involved in anything gets rid of rappaport and stallone and de niro try work out what the hell is going on this should be brilliant it sounds like great plot the actors are first grade and the supporting cast is good aswell and stallone is attempting deliver good performance however it cannot hold up although the acting is fantastic even stallone is not bad the directing and story is dull and long winded some scenes go on for too long nothing really happening in them in fact the only scenes that do work are action scenes suspect stallone was trying avoid in this serious means dull the dialogue is warbling and basically just repeats the same points over and over no matter who is delivering them the plot has potential is wasted again just being cliched after while in fact the only thing that does keep the going is kietal and de niro both delivering their usual good performances however stallone although not given much say gives good performance however it is not all that bad as said above the action scenes are well done theres also very good ending uses the cinemas sound system well in fact the last minutes of this hour are one of the best endings of if only the rest of the was as good as the ending cop land then turns out not be power house but rather dull and not every exciting hugely disappointing and cannot really recommend it

the first species was moderatelysuccessful science fiction yarn that diverted audiences some nifty special effects few well paced action sequences and frequent views of modelturnedactress natasha henstridge sans clothing however it was definitely not movie that cried out for sequel and considering the quality of species it is obvious that mgm should have stopped while they were ahead the only thing that distinguishes species is how awful it is if you throw away the plot is characterized blatant disregard for intelligence logic coherence and consistency species actually has few things recommend it select audience of course that audience is primarily comprised of teenage boys who at least in theory should not be able get into an rated and connoisseurs of bad movies there is enough blood gore simulated sex and bare flesh in species prevent it from ever becoming boring this is grade exploitation flick that is ripe for the mystery science theater treatment somewhere someplace recall hearing species described as erotic would love know who used that adjective for this movie because he or she has peculiar notion of eroticism sure there is lot of sex and nudity but it is almost always accompanied the ripping open of womans abdomen as an alien baby claws its way free splattering blood and gore in all directions anyone turned on that is not someone would care be sitting next in theater suppose the main attraction in species is natasha henstridge and get the obvious question out of the way yes she does remove her top but only once and only briefly although the character she played in the original species is dead government scientists still have the dna and out of what can only be described as suicidal impulse they decide create another clone this creature dubbed eve its creator dr laura baker played marg helgenberger reprising her role is genetically engineered be kinder and more docile meanwhile man has finally set foot on mars team of three led patrick ross justin lazard has traveled the red planet but when they return earth they bring something them ross has become halfhumanhalfalien hybrid and he is soon mating like crazy collecting the bloodsoaked children that are the result of each sex session his intention is obviously world domination standing in his way is that indomitable soldier of fortune from the first preston lennox michael madsen and one of patricks fellow astronauts dennis gamble mykelti williamson but when patrick learns about eve female of his kind there is no damping his ardor am not sure what the budget for species was but significant portion of it must have gone into paying handsome salaries several recognizable actors as opposed being diverted into the special effects michael madsen and marg helgenberger both back for second round are clearly on hand do as little as they can grab the money and run ditto for james cromwell who plays patricks father underused is too kind word describe his involvement invisible would be more like it george dzundza gets do little scenery chewing as an angrybutinept general meanwhile justin lazards performance as patrick is so flat that he makes natasha henstridges limited abilities look good comparison the only one in the whole production any energy is mykelti williamson who is cast in the part of the wisecracking black sidekick complete cheesy special effects bare breasts around every narrative corner and dialogue capable of producing howls of laughter species has been dumped into the marketplace without advance screenings for critics director peter medak journeyman maker significant list of mediocre movies on his resume has added another forgettable title but at least he appears have had fun doing it is more than can be said of anyone trying take this even scintilla of seriousness do recommend the movie absolutely not but will admit that species is dopey enough that it did not try my patience the degree that some pseudointellectual bad movies do heres hoping there is no species

a number of critics have decided that it is open season on freddie prize jr slamming the young actor as an utterly talentless pretty boy on career cruise control in soundalike disposable teen fluff like head over heels boys and girls down you and she is all that while the prinze oeuvre is hard defend his talent is not first saw him in the independent dark comedy the house of yes where he gave subtle impressive performance as the younger brother in one of americas freakiest families prinze has the acting chops he just needs take few supporting roles in some grownup movies show the nonbelievers that he has what it takes summer catch certainly will not help his case inoffensive but utterly generic the baseballrelated romantic comedy does little more than kill time the story deals the love affair between tenley jessica biel wealthy cape cod girl and ryan prinze local boy from working class family who dreams of becoming bigtime baseball star ryans preoccupation his new honeybunny drives her elitist father bruce davison crazy and endangers his position as pitcher cape cod summer league team it is wonder the kid has any time pitch as his time is occupied making out tenley fighting her dad bonding his own dad fred ward who deserves better than this fighting his brother jason gedrick and carousing at neighborhood bar his teammates the filmmakers desperately want make quirky characterheavy baseball movie like bull durham but have not got clue how get there and so they glide from one clich the next for minutes the only bit of originality comes from marc blucas in minor role as centerfielder from texas in an early barroom scene blucas best known as demonfighting riley finn from buffy the vampire slayer hears young woman compliment guy on his ass then turns teammate matthew lillard and states he does have nice ass bubble butt when lillard gives him an are you insane look blucas calmly says it is nothing sexual then goes on evaluate the hindends of some other players including lillards speaking of asses prinze does not bare his in the movie the actor has no nudity clause in his contract so two stuntbutts were employed for couple of seminude shots blucas whose character secretly dates large woman throughout the story gets another unique moment late in the sick of hearing teammates make fat chick jokes he climbs on top of table and loudly declares his love of amplysized ladies while his speech still ends up objectifying women it remains nice change of pace in numbingly ordinary movie trivial tidbit summer catch marks scooby doo summit marc blucas appears in jay and silent bob strike back as fred from the scooby doo gang while freddie prinze jr plays the same character in the upcoming big budget version of the old cartoon

everybody in this films thinking of alicia no this is not documentary on those of us after we first saw the cryin video this is one of those erotic thrillers but not like one starring shannon whirry or shannon tweed first off there is zero sex almost no nudity and it is not as wellplotted as one of those tweed flicks well anyway the plot alicia plays well the babysitter who is taking care of some kids one night while the parents t walsh and lee garlington go out party the trying be like one of those introspective erotic thrillers shows every characters thoughts except alicias the thing is alicias in most of them in most cases and the thoughts are not too kosher first off there is her boyfriend jeremy london who gave one of the alltime lousy performances in mallrats and is only notch better here who is dorky kid who hangs out kind of bully played nicky katt from suburbia who shows he is got that quiet creepiness down pat once again they decide they want crash her babysitting job looking for the typical babysitting hankypanky somethine like that the intercuts between the subplots alicia babysitting nicky and jeremy the party and each characters thoughts we get see jeremy and
