star wars episode the phantom menace director george lucas cast liam neeson ewan mcgregor natalie portman jake lloyd ian mcdiarmid samuel jackson oliver ford davies terence stamp pernilla august frank oz ahmed best kenny baker anthony daniels screenplay george lucas producers rick mccallum runtime min us distribution th century fox rated pg mild violence thematic elements copyright nathaniel atcheson fellow critic once stated his belief that reviewer should not speak of himself in his own review have attempted obey this rule in recent months but do so would be impossible in this case the fact is nearly every person who goes see the phantom menace brings baggage in them the original star wars trilogy means so much so many people for me they calibrated my creativity as child they are masterful original works of art that mix moving stories what were astonishing special effects at the time and they still hold up pretty darn well am too young have seen star wars in the theater during its original release but that does not make me any less dedicated it on the contrary the star wars trilogy and the empire strikes back in particular are three items on very short list of why love movies when heard that george lucas would be making the first trilogy in the ninefilm series got exited when first saw screenshots from the well over year ago embarked on yearlong drool of anticipation and when the first previews were released last thanksgiving was ready see the but then there was the hype the insane marketing campaign and lucasfilms secretive snobbery over the picture in the last weeks before the picture opened while multitudes of fans waited outside of theaters and stood in the boiling sun days in advance just be the first ones in the theater was tired of hearing about it was tired of seeing cardboard cutouts of the characters whenever went kfc or taco bell just wanted see the movie reader do not misunderstand did not have an antihype reaction the hype was unavoidable understand and accept the hype it is just what happens when the prequel the most widely beloved films of all time get released five minutes into the phantom menace knew there was problem who are these jedi knights asked why are they churning out stale dialogue machinegun rapidity why are not these characters being developed before their adventures why is there special effects shot in nearly every frame of the entire these were just some of my questions early on later asked where is the magic of the first three films and why am looking at my watch every fifteen minutes the end of the was tired maddened and depressed george lucas has funneled his own wonderful movies into pointless mindless summer blockbuster the phantom menace is no star wars take away the title and the jedi talk and the force and you are left what is easily one of the most vacuous special effects movies of all time it is an embarrassment looked desperately for scene in character is explored or new theme is examined or special effects shot is not used there are few of each but they are all token attempts the fact is george lucas has created what is simultaneously an abysmally bad excuse for movie and pretty good showcase for digital effects this is not what wanted see did not want leave the phantom menace headache and bitter taste in my mouth but did the story centers mostly around quigon jinn liam neeson looking lost and confused and his apprentice obiwan kenobi ewan mcgregor who scarcely has line in the and their attempts liberate the people of the planet naboo naboo is the victim of bureaucratic war the trade federation their contact on naboo is queen amidala natalie portman the teenage ruler who truly cares for her people after picking up jar jar binks completely cgi character voiced ahmed best they head tatooine where they meet young anakin skywalker jake lloyd and his mother pernilla august quigon knows that the force is strong young anakin and so the jedi knights take the boy them on their journeys the bad guys are darth maul and darth sidious neither of whom have enough lines register as characters there is not anything particularly wrong this story when looking at it in synopsis form the way lucas has handled it however it unsatisfactory first of all we do not learn one single thing about quigon jinn not one thing what was his life like before this well imagine he did not have one that is why he feels like plot device this probably explains why neeson looks so hopeless in the role and why he is recently retired from do not blame him honestly obiwan character was really looking forward learning more about is even less interesting mcgregor has just few lines so anyone hoping see the engaging young actor in great performance is urged look elsewhere since these two men are the focus of the phantom menace lucas has served us big emotional void as the centerpiece of his movie things start pick up when our characters reach tatooine young anakin is perhaps the only truly fleshedout character in the and lloyd does thoughtful job the role was also hugely impressed the sand speeder scene rarely is an action sequence so fast and so exciting and when anakin says goodbye his mother found it moving also fairly good is portman and she manages give little depth character where no depth has been written jar jar binks is one of the most annoying characters have ever had endure but he is more interesting than most of the humans as soon as the relativelybrief segment on tatooine is over it is back the mindnumbing special effects and depthless action scenes have seen many movies that qualify as special effects extravaganzas but the phantom menace is the first one have seen that had me sick of the special effects fifteen minutes into the movie the reason is obvious george lucas has no restraint cannot say that did not find the effects original because did the final battle between darth maul obiwan and quigon is visually exceptional as is most of the but also found the effects deadening and tiresome my breaking point was near the end of the picture as anakin is getting questioned yoda and the other jedi masters in the background we see hundreds of digital spaceships flying around through digital sky and wanted that go away cannot we have one stinking scene that is not bursting at the seems special effects shot got so sick of looking at the cgi characters and spaceships and planets and backgrounds that really just wanted go outside and look at physical landscape for few hours and then there is the question of magic what was lost in the sixteen years between the phantom menace and return of the jedi have feeling that lucas was so focused on how his movie looked that he forgot entirely the way it should feel john williams familiar score is no help nor is lucas direction think it comes right down characters there are none here longed for the magnetic presence of han luke and leia but got no such thing and what about the ridiculous expectations mine were not that high simply wanted that showed me the roots of the films that grew up loving story that had few characters and few great special effects instead got two hours and fifteen minutes of lifeless and imaginative computer graphics show do not hate the phantom menace as much as resent it would like forget that it exists and yet cannot it is here stay can only hope that episodes ii and iii have something of substance in them because if they do not then lucas will have pulled off the impossible task of destroying his own indestructible series

the lives of older people in the twilight of their years attempting come grips their shared histories and possible futures is fascinating topic finding an allstar cast for such is stroke of genius combining all that threetime oscarwinning director robert benton of kramer vs kramer and creating decidedly mediocre movie is the stuff of disappointment in yet another noir mystery set in how many of these have we seen during the past few years the atmosphere is moody the actors enjoyable watch and the story goes nowhere over harry ross paul newman is washed up copturnedprivate eyeturned man friday trying figure out how live what remains of his life he is screwed up things pretty well had wife and daughter now am drunk and is at crossroads couple of years ago he traveled mexico bring back mel reese witherspoon the underage daughter of jack gene hackman and catherine susan sarandon ames and now lives them the ames are former movie stars past their prime and the three have become fast friends one gets the impression that ross is just hanging out waiting for something wake him up fill his time he does odd jobs for jack and falls in love catherine jack is in even worse shape than harry he is dying of cancer only year live things do turn more exciting when jack asks harry drop off sealed manila envelope for him instead of the routine errand that ross expects he walks into barrage of bullets from the gun of another excop who is himself full of bloody holes this unsettling event gives the former detective project throw himself into and launches an investigation that revolves around the mysterious disappearance of catherines first husband years before through series of very complex and convoluted plot devices that involve murder blackmail guns mels mexico traveling partner and his parole officer rosss former cop buddies exlover and wouldbe sidekick the tale finally ends up exactly where everyone expects it it is noir tradition that the story twists and turns down side roads for an unexpected finale but here the journey meanders towards an ending that no one cares about the only surprises are exactly whose face fits role in the scenario the time they show you it does not matter the storyline gets goofier and goofier exemplified in rosss relationship rubin giancarlo esposito partner wannabe these scenes are obviously designed be comic relief however they are neither rubin and ross have some past relationship but either it is not explained or did not care enough at that point remember running joke about where harry was supposedly shot while in mexico is probably meant mirror his questions about whether he is still able perform it is also not funny does not connect and keeps on showing up long after it has run its course on the positive side it is often enjoyable watch the seasoned actors on the screen the three leads all have welldeserved academy awards and turn in accomplished if not extraordinary jobs newman is grand actor but does not seem quite suited the dark style he is bit too clean and understated come across as desperate and down and out hackman also lowkey is believable but lacks sparkle sarandon comes across well as an sultry older babe although she is onedimensional the actors do what they can lame dialog but they cannot pull the out of the hole it is dug for itself james garner who plays rosss old buddy excop raymond hope is always treat but even he halfheartedly struggles through lines like am glad they did not shoot your pecker off the best part of the is the look at old friends how their relationships change over the years and the difficult choices they must make the genuinely easy and casual interactions among the actors hint that being on the set was much more interesting than what ended up on the screen the does not run very long before the audience realizes that it is hopeless the only reason for watching is the actors it reminds me of disaster movies such as towering inferno where the star power is supposed make everyone ignore the films problems in better world there would have been secondrate actors in this secondrate movie and the ones here would have been saved for something better of course we do not live in that better world but you could make yours little nicer choosing different movie

arye cross and courteney cox star as pair of bostonians who meet in bar go the movies fall in love move in together etc review well if you have not seen when harry met sally or he said she said or if you do not watch love war on television you might think this is the most inventive come along in ages however if you have seen any of these than you have seen most of this this of course does not mean its bad some of it is amusing but overall just had ask what is the point arye cross is the stereotypical single male who falls in love kevin pollack is the stereotypical femalefearing best friend who make lot of rather sexist and vulgar jokes most if were not very funny couteney cox is the stereotypical careerminded woman who falls in love julie brown is the stereotypical bizarre best friend of said woman notice the frequent use of the word stereotypical this uses lot of formula the plot is basically known from the opening credits so what is good about the movie well as said there are few amusing moments surprisingly julie brown who usually find just plain goofy was the best thing in the also there are several very funny sequences involving analysis of the human mating ritual gee this is really short not much say about the really it is just kind of there watching it on video might not be complete waste of time but would not recommend hiring baby sitter or spending lot of money see it at the theatre

_soldier_ is hands down one of the worst movies person could ever have sit through that does not have jean claude van damme in it could liken it the scifi cheese that was the productofchoice back in the early but that would be too much of compliment if there is movie theater in hell this is playing there hours day the story such that there is revolves around todd kurt russell an automaton of man who has been raised from birth be merciless soldier in nottoodistant ultraconservative future is there any other kind after years of desensitization at military academy full of other boys just like him todd becomes ground fighter in series of wars all over the galaxy who the enemies in these wars are is never revealed but the few glimpses of todd in battle show that it does not matter because innocent hostages are wiped out as indifferently as the bad guys after ten minutes of this nihilistic trash yes folks there is more we see todd as buff scarred adult now so accustomed the carnage that no confrontation at all causes him break sweat there is new wrinkle though todd and his brethren are declared obsolete and new batch of soldiers takes their place after losing sanctioned battle _dragon_s jason scott lee the seemingly dead todd is dumped flying icecube tray well that is what is looked like on remote garbage planet if you predict that todd meets bunch of outcast settlers on this planet and that they band together fight bunch of bad guys coming destroy them you are way ahead of the game the renegade society on this trash heap is so clich you halfexpect tina turner and master blaster come strolling into frame any minute it is surprising that _soldier_ is the brainchild of _blade runner_ cowriter david webb peoples unlike that mindtwisting classic this contains just barely enough dialogue fill about three doublespaced pages add into the mix the _mortal kombat_s paul anderson inept direction and it is easy see how _soldier_ turned out so bad and the special effects remember the flying steam irons in hardware wars gary busey is in this movie nuff said _soldier_ is proof that still has plenty of bad ideas sitting in its script vaults that this sad made it the silver screen should encourage plenty of aspiring screenwriters out there that there is hope after all now if you will excuse me have go weep for the future

it is sad state of affairs when the back box blurb is more exciting than the movie contained within it such is the case for the paul mayersberg _the last samurai_ though the blurb alludes jungle filled political intrigue uneasy alliances and murderous enemies at every turn the story of the movie is actually quite simple and prosaic middleaged japanese businessman named endo played john fujioka and his assistant both of whom have samurai aspirations travel africa in search of his ancestor who went bring buddhism africa he hires the services of downattheheels vietnam veteran pilot johnny congo the redoubtable lance henriksen and his girlfriend arabella holzbog and travels the camp of an armsmerchantcumsafarihost cumislamicmissionary john saxon and his wife lisa eilbacher they are all kidnapped an african revolutionary guerilla witchdoctor aspirations conceal prearranged arms deal subsequently falls through congo escapes finds endos ancestors sword and comes back guns blazing free the rest of them and endo kills the revolutionary the sword the end _the last samurai_ is one of those movies that is neither bad enough nor good enough be enjoyable it is merely _there_ the murky plot is filled subtexts that are never elaborated subplots that are never explained and many scenes that make very little sense at all the is shot through all the tired old inscrutable japanese samurai and zen stereotypes that are be expected from an american movie it is quite slowpaced only bit of action near the end and the final duel between endo and the terrorist is quite anticlimactic most of the acting is fair the possible exception of congos girlfriend lance henriksen is his usual scenechewing self and is one of few possible reasons anyone might conceivably have for seeing this movie the only other bright spot is the sweeping african scenery paid for this from the discount rack at best buy and halfway suspect overpaid for it if you are in the mood for samurai read clavell novel or watch kurusawa movie skip _the last samurai_ unless you are diehard henriksen fan

birthdays often cause individuals access their lives are we doing what we want be doing what happened our dreams the new millennium our collective big birthday just around the corner some people are sensing certain dissatisfaction their existence the old standbys of traditional religion and science are not doing it for many anymore and they are looking for something else we will be seeing more and more films metaphysical theme over the next few years ricky hayman jeff goldblum is having career crisis the programming director for the good buy home shopping network he is going be fired unless sales increase dramatically new producer kate newell kelly preston is supposed whip things into shape when the two are fixing flat they almost run down new age pilgrim murphy wanders onto the television set and connects the viewers telling them that they do not really want all that commercial crap in some unexplained manner this causes sales sour ricky is saved the movie tries be too much at once and fails at it all it is not an overthetop comedy or heartwarming message of humanity it _is_ mishmosh of poorly directed scenes made even worse insipid dialog am willing put up preaching from but the messages here are old hat you should take time smell the roses selling your soul for cash is bad idea golly am glad saw the movie never would have thought of these the opportunity poke fun at the goofy products is mostly missed when takes chainsaw the set there is an obvious chance for murphy be hilarious it does not happen the bits are so subdued and overlylong that there is only hint of laughter from the audience murphy has changed his roles in recent years and not for the better there are hints of promise in this one the only time the picks up even little is when his shavedheaded character in the long flowing white caftan shows up on screen the others are horrendous goldblum has episodes of brilliance in his career but here he seems have been replaced lifeless pod from his invasion of the body snatchers his relationship kate makes no sense they move from antagonism love somewhere off screen preston is as uninteresting as she could possibly be somewhere hidden deep inside of this is about ten minutes of value an attempt satirize stupid television we get selfparody instead

m the sequel mission impossible is james bond wannabe but it fails even come close that in wit humor and entertainment value it tries be spyromance movie but without any suspense the just looks like it is an extended commercial for dudes who think they look cool in throwaway sunglasses it is that prefers techie gadgets anything human the coolest thing about this movie was all the holes it had in its story and the most trite thing about the movie was the usage of doves throughout as peace symbols the plays as if it was wet fantasy dream about techie violence except for the choreographed action sequences the was dull for threequarters of its time filled too many dead spots in its story garner concern about its wooden characters or the superficial romance that developed as for the action scenes they might look good those who are converts violence in their films but their advertisement for sadistic responses is nothing short of mindless cartoon violence makes it very difficult sit back and applaud without feeling put off the gratuitous cruelty seen i opens and closes fastpaced action scenes but it is hard get past the middle part just drags on in banal dialogue the looks as if it had been invaded computer virus at that point the only thing that kept me awake was the horrible music composed hans zimmer that became very loud at any of the films supposedly momentous action scenes and seemed make an uninteresting scene even more noticeable in the wrong way it is megabuck adapted from popular hightech gadgetry tv series but its artistic success is an impossible task accomplish because it hired the wrong director and actors star in it and it failed produce story that had any substance john woo broken arrow faceoff is good at doing car chases choreographed fights midair flips and kungfu kicks slomo shots of two guns blazing and of fire explosions but he just cannot seem handle dialogue and suspense the star of the and coproducer tom cruise and his romantic interest thandie newton are miscast cruise is no james bond and looks more like yuppie than superhero in his stylish long hair and innocuous smile as he tries carry off this macho role while thandie is not an actionfilm girl and seems like fish outofwater in this one their romance did not work not only was it tepid and not sexy but it was not convincing the opens dizzying speed perhaps the hope that befuddled audience is its best bet for success we will be in three different locations instantaneously sydney the american southwest and seville first we are in sydney australia where scientist muffled russian accent dr nekhorvich rade mentions that he created deadly killer virus called chimera and an antidote for it he also mentions that every hero needs worthy villain explains the films mythic theme as we enter the world of comic book myths on good and evil the one who played the villain dougray scott does so in onedimensional gruff tone did not distinguish him in that role at least if the got the villain part right it might have had some fun this nonsense soon the diabolical scientist is on plane talking someone he trusts called dimitri but then the plane is taken over terrorists who set it on automatic pilot and crash it into the rocky mountains before they crash the plane and parachute out of it the one who was posing as dimitri turns out be sean ambrose scott rogue member of the imf is cialike clone he steals the package the antidote peels off latex mask is replica of the hero of the story ethan hunt cruise who had posed as dimitri the scientist before and had thereby gained his trust sean and his group of terrorists carry out this attack because they plan virus plague on the world and then sell the victims the antidote at marked up prices we already saw the gimmick of peeling masks used in faceoff and in the original mission impossible as convoluted plot as that had it was still superior this sequel woo has run this peeling mask routine into the ground as it is used so often in this both sides so much so that it blurs any ethical character differences between good guy or villain it makes it seem as if anyone could be another character distorts the reality of the and makes it impossible for the make much sense next we are in mountain range in the american southwest and ethan is on vacation hanging his fingertips while climbing and looking cool when helicopter his boss anthony hopkins aboard delivers via rocket launcher pair of talking sunglasses hunt learns his next mission is retrieve the chimera package and he is allowed pick two regular imf agents help billy baird john polson and luther stickell ving rhames luther running highgadget computer but he also must get jewel thief named nyah hall thandie join his team he is told as an incentive recruit her all her criminal charges will be dropped hopkins then signs off the tag line this message will selfdestruct in five seconds actually the departure of hopkins it was this disposable that actually selfdestructed at this point in seville hunt recruits nyah into the team in the middle of jewel heist and subsequent car chase where he nearly runs her audi sports car over the side of mountain road he also falls for her when this was only supposed be business deal and learns that she is valuable because her exboyfriend was sean ambrose and that he still wants ck her the imf team then inject location tracer chip into her spot sean so she can go ck him as she leads them his hideout in the seaside of australia in he shares his sneering villainous cohort the south african hugh stamp richard roxburgh robert towne the screenwriter who contributed the first mission who is noted for doing chinatown writes colorless pedestrian script one that fails even be funny in camp way the terrorists who aim rule the world are interested in owning percent in biotech company and in getting stock options as they plan infect sydney the virus and have their company sell the antidote insuring that they will make billions on the stock ethan comes the rescue of the world and of nyah his only conflict being who is more important save first ethan does this rescue against all odds as he finds way penetrate security tight biotech company fight it out sean and the other terrorists and rescue nyah who injected herself the virus hinder seans getting it as the only way transport the virus is through another person or from the vaccine needle ethan rescues her doing stunt riding on motorcycle using kickboxing winning shootout throwing full john wayne supply of grenades at the terrorists making some more use out of that peeling mask bit and being completely fearless and larger than life while he kicks everyones ass if was only entertained this could have lived it but this was so badly made that it was like watching highlight of basketball game seeing only the slamdunks but the game itself being excluded from the telecast in any case this is criticproof and will in all probability do well in the box office as it was made appeal all the demographics who find commercial ventures like this one easy buy into

exuniversal soldier luc has battle group of newermodel engineered fighters gone bad the review jeanclaude van damme has oneliner early on in universal soldier the return his latest attempt remain relevant that sums up this entire movie he says been there done that no critic could possibly sum up van dammes recent choices any better while other ageing action stars have wisely moved into other genres schwarzenegger makes as many family comedies as he does action films van damme stubbornly persists in sticking what used work for him martial arts and guns this unwillingness or perhaps inability move into new genres has caused van damme enter the straight video world legionnaire never seeing the inside of multiplex he joins fellow martial artistaction star steven seagal as they watch their careers rapidly fizzle away universal soldier the return is truly poor the plot is complete copy of several action films from this decade specifically terminator judgement day and the similarly named soldier soldiers kurt russell was an older model supersoldier sent off retirement when circumstances forced him battle his successors for the good of planet schwarzeneggers terminator in tried save john connor from newer model killing machine the and jeanclaude former universal soldier has save the planet from the rampage of group of you guessed it newer model soldiers considering the poor box office performance of soldier it is amazing that this project was ever given the goahead luc devereaux van damme was the sole remaining universal soldier or unisol for short until he was returned normal if muscular human form in this sequel technically the fourth in the series following two straighttovideo duds that were ignored here plotwise luc is now human trainerconsultant of sorts for the unisol program working dylan cotner xander berkeley who interestingly also appeared in the unisol program has engineered tougher fiercer fighting force the help of supercomputer seth unfortunately upon hearing that the program has been axed the government seth takes control of his soldiers killing everyone in the building except for luc his partner maggie his daughter hillary and erin reporter trapped inside the rest of the involves luc trying keep them all alive while beating up group of nearindestructible soldiers most notably romeo popular wrestler goldberg there are lots of fights gun battles lame plot developments and noticeable lack of plausibility there are so many clich in this that it is almost painful watch luc gets saddled the task of saving erin the reporter early on and in the course of single night they go from bickering falling for each other kissing erin is patheticallywritten character people are getting brutally gunned down all around her and yet not only does this not seem frighten her but she finds time remind luc that she is not leaving without her story whatever other laughable moments include luc going strip club get internet access what and a group of rangers who after having been given good advice luc tells them that their weapons are useless and shows them specific gun should work better choose go into battle their useless weapons anyway guess who wins the battle not one single scene in universal soldier the return has any originality it when fuelled don davis loud driving music score the films many fights become almost passable but mostly are full of the same ol jeanclaude moves director mic rodgers former stunt coordinator keeps the action coming at rapid pace only few token serious moments be found his past work is evident in the many moments when characters are thrown through windows tossed off of buildings or sent flying through the air thanks an explosion if only jeanclaude were not getting so old and slow compared younger martial arts actors like jet li rodgers could probably have made decent action place the blame squarely at van dammes feet however is an injustice am not sure that anyone not even robert deniro or edward norton could make writers william malone and john fasanos script sound good one particularly painful scene is when erin asks luc how he is so sure that the aforementioned strip club will have internet access he cringes looks down and mutters uh uhm they all do saw it on minutes eh he he he the scripts and indeed the entire films only saving grace is goldberg he chews up every scene he is in obviously enjoying his role immensely he even gives the few laughs as he mutters things like really do not like that guy every time he fails kill luc sadly his presence is not enough turn universal soldier the return into anything better than belowaverage action that truly deserves have joined its fellow sequels going straighttovideo

the plot of big mommas house is martin lawrence in fat suit and dress that is not just the highconcept premise it is the fullyrealized allencompassing plot such an emphasis is not unheardof in the world of summer entertainment one need merely look back last summer when the plot of big daddy was adam sandler being an incompetent surrogate parent the trap inherent in such an approach is that the highconcept plot idea better be pretty wellrealized or rest on the shoulders of an extremely talented performer because you can bet there will be nothing else worth second of your time not developed character not provocative theme not witty twist you will get plus minutes of martin lawrence in fat suit and dress nothing more nothing less those who find martin lawrence more than an occasionally amusing screen presence may have shot at enjoying the onenote dud that is big mommas house others will simply stare mouth agape at its sheer unapologetic laziness lawrence plays fbi agent malcolm turner an undercover expert on stakeout assignment his partner john paul giamatti dangerous convicted bank robber and murderer lester vesco terrence howard has escaped from prison and the feds think he is headed for his former girlfriend and presumedbutneverproved accomplice sherry nia long sherry however has fled her son trent jascha washington possibly visit her grandmother hattie mae ella mitchell better known as big momma indeed sherry appears be on her way but big momma is headed out of town without knowing sherry is coming that leaves master of disguise malcolm go under very heavy cover as big momma and find out what sherry knows big mommas houses bloodlines are certainly traceable mrs doubtfire director raja gosnell edited that and the makeup effects were similarly created greg cannom but there is just as strong whiff of tootsie in the main characters attempt use his alternate identity get closer woman unfortunately big mommas house makes ridiculous decision neither of those other films made instead of having the protagonist pose as completely manufactured character unfamiliar anyone elses it places malcolm in the position of playing friend and family member several other characters suspension of disbelief in big mommas house requires you believe every other person in the is blind andor stupid since no one notices that one big momma looks or sounds absolutely nothing like the other of course laughs trumps logic every time and big mommas house probably still would have worked in spite of its utter disdain for common sense if it had just managed be funny and it misses its best possible opportunity for some great farce ignoring the simple fact that the real big momma is set up as foultempered beast while malcolm has be nurturing in order get the information he wants out of sherry unfortunately no one involved appears have the faintest idea how deal the comic gold mine involved in one real person pretending be another very different real person so they fall back on an endless parade of sight gags malcolm reacting violently big mommas explosive diarrhea attack malcolmasmomma schooling pair of cocky teens in basketball malcolm trying avoid detection as various prostheses give way at inopportune moments malcolm delivering baby because big momma is the town midwife one of the few sequences that works martin lawrence can be likeable enough at times but there is no reason care whit about his budding romance sherry because malcolm is never an independently significant character he is just big momma without the makeup on will not waste time commenting on how ineptly the setup of the escaped convict is employed since it was clearly waste of time the filmmakers there are few token scenes of lester looming as threatening figure but he is ultimately distraction in that is really about its central visual incongruity and the accompanying lascivious glances at nia longs posterior am never prepared underestimate how appealing that idea may be other people several million of them apparently found adam sandler as an incompetent surrogate parent appealing but know that when filmmaker tries throw concept at me and pretend that it is an entire duck out of the way the gross implausibility of big mommas house might have been tolerable if it was seasoned more big cleverlyconstructed laughs its lack of big laughs might have been tolerable if its characters were at all relevant big mommas house is ridiculous _and_ not funny it is just sad exercise in the jaded presumption that any scene should be considered wacky and hilarious if it involves martin lawrence in fat suit and dress

starring william baldwin cindy crawford steven berkoff all right the first problem that fair game has is the casting of supermodel cindy crawford in the lead role not that cindy does that bad it is just that anyone who watches this knows from moment one that that little bit of casting was not done because of cindys extraordinary acting skills but for her extraordinary ability look drop dead gorgeous in any situation and in fair game most situations tend find cindy either soaking wet or very hot and sweaty but am sure that that is just coincidence no doubt that these situations were essential the plot and the fact that cindy looks great wet well that is just happy coincidence sure william baldwin is not bad actor unfortunately he just does not demonstrate it at all in this movie am not sure if that is because most of his lines were just so hokey or if he was trying make cindys acting look good if it was the latter it worked cindy does surprisingly good job here in her first movie is not say that she does not have room for improvement although be fair cindy her lines were kinda cheesy in places so right about now you are no doubt asking yourself what sort of movie does cindy crawford arguably the most beautiful woman on the planet chose for her foray into the world of cinema well am glad you asked that question cindy plays lawyer who some convoluted plot twists becomes target for former elite kgb agents why woud they target someone as likable as cindy you ask the end of the movie you will not care the story is so contrived it is not funny anyway after cindy gets blown out of the window of her house without getting so much as scratch might add she is placed into protective police custody under the watchful eve of william baldwin who is character max kilpatric police detective seems possess the skills of some sort of fighting machine my guess is that the writers have seen way too many of steven seagals early films the point is that the idea of the crawford and baldwins characters of the run from these killer russians is not all that bad of an idea it is just everything around that basic idea kinda stinks out loud the supporting cast members are nothing more that over acted stereotypes if was baldwin would hope this disappears as for crawford she may indeed have some acting ability unfortunately any she does have is obscured writing that goes beyond bad this movie was obviously written cindy in mind since the writers spend most of their time finding ways capitalize off of her looks it is too bad they had not spent more time on half decent plot since ms crawford is more than capable of looking just fine all herself thank you very much unless you are huge fan of either baldwin or crawford this is movie that will only disappoint you

is alternatively sick gross funny and then sickly soppy bill murray plays frank cross t executive horrible personality he is evil secretary actors crew everyone except the vs stations boss of course played the late robert mitchum however he is then visited very dead exec who warns cross that he will be visited three ghosts past present and future who is called the ghost of yet come for some reason sure enough they arrive show cross how much of s b he is and he changes his way however throughout this simple plot we have got suffer outlandish special effects poor comedy and an very very mean performance from bill murray frank cross is not funny mean he is just mean he also is not very good at emotional scenes and totally destroys the last ten minutes of the an utterly desperate speech saying how great christmas is and how he has changed however the supporting cast are ok good performances from mitchum allen who plays his girlfriend and john glover who plays crosss partner the ghost of christmas past is not that bad either sadly though the audience has suffer minutes of home alone style violence from the ghost of christmas present played carol kane whoever thought smacking that kane smacking murray in the head toaster was funny should be fired straight away and the audience also has suffer bobcat goldthwait the guy the annoying voice in police academy if remeber correctly who thankfully dosent say much the script is horrendous michael odonaghue churns out terrible bad taste jokes guess is the whole point really then changes direction completely synopsis maniac crazed virulent microphage slaughters more than twenty people including street gang and heavilyarmed troops small knife even handgun however he cannot take out the two cops who are after him despite having shot one of them total of seven times comments the most notable aspect of adrenalin fear the rush is that it marks striking career move for natasha henstridge not only does she manage keep all her clothes on her trademark in earlier films such as species and maximum risk was strip naked as often as possible but she actually puts on even more clothes as the progresses this will probably disappoint many henstridge fans but welcome the change because henstridge is an attractive capable actress who deserves less exploitative roles though admit it does not show in this mess henstridge just like every other actor in the delivers wooden performance in this monumental turkey the cast also includes christopher lambert who has appeared in the highlander and mortal kombat films how on earth this movie got two bigname stars appear in it is beyond me adrenalin fear the rush is set in boston ten years in the future boston has changed dramatically in those ten years it is now home bunch of interred foreigners and policed cops who drive around in small cars policia printed on their doors some guy has really bad virus and he is killing people because of it so the brave good guys lambert and henstridge go after him that is it minutes never seemed so long this is drawnout chase scene through dimlylit abandoned buildings turned into an entire movie the plot development is nil we learn absolutely nothing about lamberts character and very little about henstridges character the dialogue is littered unnecessary obscenities and concerns mindnumbingly idiotic arguments over who will go down the next dark corridortunnelairduct next and who will carry the flashlight subplot does exist involving henstridges characters illegal attempt get her son out of boston in her opening monologue monologue sounds as though henstridge was reading from cue cards we learn that she has gone great lengths secure fake passport for her son twenty minutes into the wondered if the movie would have been better if it focused on this plot in defining scene of the movie however changed my mind this fake passport drops the ground lamberts cop immediately recognizes it as fraud from six feet away must not have been good fake this emphasizes another fault the things just defy common sense lamberts cop for instance is shot seven times yet he is still able talk and slide about adrenalin fear the rush ends in trite manner that does not seem even fit the mood that the filmmakers were trying for found myself rather bored this will disappoint both scifihorror fans and fans of henstridge and lambert do not fear the rush fear the movie watch something else

postchasing amy slew of lovetriangle movies this month we have kissing fool costarring amys own lee and april brings us the object of my affection may as well be titled chasing allan for it is the story of woman who falls in love her gay roommate be absolutely six degrees of kevin bacon about it that stars schwimmers friend jennifer aniston if only kevin smith could write them all schwimmer stars as womanizing chicago sportscaster max who falls in love his best friend jay lee book editor samantha avital mere twentyfour hours after meeting her they are soon engaged and max because of his own raging libido grows suspicious of samanthas fidelity he convinces jay flirt samantha during the development of his book test her the trouble is jay might be secretly in love her stretch this flat sitcom premise feature length the plot is framed climactic wedding at bonnie hunt recounts the triangular talethe events leading up the nuptialsto an annoying fat man and his silly girlfriend hunt has the best comic timing of anyone in the schwimmer can spin bad dialogue into mildly humorous dialogue and lee poor lee is miscast so hysterically funny in chasing amy here he is forced repress his comic instincts swear yell talk about oral sex the scripts idea of character trait is stress that jay is sensitive man and then show him drinking pepto bismol when he is stewing over his girl trouble as for avital an israeli actress she is warm and sweet but we do not know anything about her character other than that it takes her an incredibly long time realize the most obvious things she also too closely resembles the stunningly beautiful kari wuhrer who plays schwimmers assistant and personal temptress turning that particular subplot into an unintentional riff on vertigo there are handful smattering of good scenes in kissing fool enjoyed moment in comedy club during jay gets up and asks has anyone here ever hated their girlfriend so much you wanted kill her over and over until he is booted off stage there are also few obviously improvised lines that are fresher than anything that is on the page kissing fool is never as clever as the thursday night jokemachine friends that spawned schwimmers movie career so save yourself eight dollars and watch three episodes of that series back back

yet another brainless teen flick this one is about surprise drugs and sex stars katie holmes and sarah polly could not look more bored their characters are cardboard cutouts of every cliched teenager out there one thing you need know is really hated this movie everything about it annoyed the hell out of me the acting and script the plot and ending the director of the fluke hit swingers could have very well directed bunch of noname actors and had watchabe the big stars of go pretty much drown the project of any originality felt like was watching dawsons creek episode although the still would have stayed at red despite its cast the surprise ending was sooo predictable since when is male characters sudden outing of the closet considered surprise in anymore go is dawsons creek varsity blues she is all that go home and watch something else

set in harlem during the great depression rival gangster families go war over control of the numbers an illegal gambling lottery runners take bets from potential lottery winners and deliver them private locations for drawings the undisputed leader of the harlem numbers is the madame queen cicely tyson who is challenged dutch schulz tim roth ruthless hoodlum turning against the queen dutch defies his partner the infamous lucky luciano andy garcia who wishes respect the queen and keep the peace the queens army strengthens when an acquaintance ellsworth bumpy johnson lawrence fishburne is released from prison and becomes bodyguard for her he proves himself worthy in short time as he thwarts an assassination attempt on himself and the queen and later takes control of the queens army when she is jailed for tax evasion bumpys reign is not as restrained and subdued as the queen and he declares all out war on dutch bloody gang warfare ensues bumpy faces many obstacles during his reign his new army questions his methods his girlfriend vanessa williams and the queen disagree his violent solutions most importantly in his eyes dutch has become more formidable foe than he imagined and seeks help from lucky luciano assassinate him there have been so many movies dealing organized crime that it must be hard write an original story dealing it this movie is not original at all in fact was angered how many similarities there was between this and arguably the best gangster movie of all time the godfather if you are going borrow ideas from another movie and not give credit why not borrow from lesser known movie say millers crossing how could the credited screenwriter chris brancato not give credit mario puzo himself here are just some of the major similarities stopped counting at crooked cop assaults blood relative of the leader gang extracts revenge on crooked cop wife or girlfriend questions her partners murderous activities and leaves him high ranking officer betrays the leader blood relative of the leader murdered war erupting between the families highranking officer disapproves of the leader in front of other family members new leader runs family differently from previous leader large meeting all families involved the setup in this movie is done rather well enjoyed the portrayal of the network of runners sprinting through the streets collecting bets for the queens lottery this was the way of life in harlem and most people involved the queen did so because it was the only way support their families and put food on the table number running was the only way for the harlem population find work also enjoyed the interaction between the angry violent dutch and the calm patient lucky after about the minute mark all of the similarities the godfather start appearing one after the other and in short order it was huge distraction and an insult my intelligence who was the screenwriter kidding here some of the individual performances were well done andy garcia was very convincing as lucky unfortunately his screen time is reduced supporting role tim roth effectively plays the cocky villain much like his roles in the cook the thief his wife and her lover and rob roy the good performances and convincing setup during the first third of the movie do not make up for the lackluster story that follows couple of coincidences is one thing over dozen is an insult directed bill duke ellsworth bumpy johnson lawrence fishburne dutch schultz tim roth lucky luciano andy garcia the queen cicely tyson francine hughes vanessa williams illinois gordon chi mcbride written randy turgeon january

at first glance thought that the sword and the sorceror had promise its plotline goes like this the evil king cromwell desiring take over the world resurrects an evil ancient sorceror xusia for power he attacks the kingdom of ehdan and kills young prince talons parents given triplebladed sword can shoot bad guys like gun his dying father talon vows for revenge eleven years later when he is established his own army the mercaneries he vows take back his kingdom along the way he meets up alana whose village is attacked drunken guards and her brother is kidnapped cromwell talon vows help and after series of minor escapades eventually ends up rescuing alanas brother and several other prisoners only be captured himself in other words put on cross be crucified fortunately he frees himself rescues alana from marrying cromwell defeats xusia and then cromwell all his triple bladed sword during the final battle the blade breaks but talon finishes cromwell off using hidden dagger in the blade then everything ends happily unfortunately the sword and the sorcerer is not even half as good as it sounds what would have been great is completely destroyed uneven plot jumping bad acting and gruesomely gory bloody scenes never once does the story seem connect together it just jumps around repeatedly this problem is extremely noticeable in the opening scene where cromwell resurrects xusia after telling him that he needs his help he leads the warlock out into daylight but then stabs him and sends him careening off cliff afterwards wait minute did not the plotline say that he needs the help of xusia in order invade ehdan he cannot do military force if that is the case why does he dispose of xusia after resurrecting him and why does he manage take over ehdan anyway these questions are just never no never answered in the another example is that one moment we see talon fighting for his life another moment we see him just about be crucified during alanas wedding cromwell and finally at the end instead of settling down alana he just tells her wait and then he just rides off in addition the extremely bloody scenes this uneven plot jumping completely destroys what would have been great fantasy adventure even some attempts make it exciting few fire scenes battle scenes do not work it just completely fails altogether miserably the only good thing about this is its musical score contributed david whittaker who had an extremely short music composing career the score is boomy and adventurous powerful and billion times better than this is my suggestion steer the hell away from this bloody mess and buy the soundtrack album instead if you can find it ironically though before the films credits roll there is message indicating that sequel tales of the ancient empire would follow my relief and delight it never got into production because the sword and the sorcerer laid an egg at the box office grossing only million critics were right on in slamming the sword and the sorcerer all right leonard maltin rightfully called it second rate in scripting and acting and ataglance reviews called it confusing stupid unimaginative unengaging bloodfilled bore totally agree these reviews all right and hope that this piece of will be forgotten about there are far better fantasy movies than the sword and the sorcerer hope you get good laugh out of this review but am not laughing in fact my insults do not even come close the gruesome sickness that this gave me throughout its minute running time

this movie stinks although it is professionally crafted and there are some decent performances the plot is so bad it drags the into the abyss knew was in for trouble when during the opening establishment shots we see detailed closeup of warrant officer paul brenners john travolta military identification card and it is the wrong color this might seem like minor detail but anyone who has spent anytime the military knows that active duty identification cards are green and dependant cards are yellow and what about the senior military officer whose uniform shirt is so wrinkled he looks like he is recruit on his first day of training or what about when brenner tells suspect that because he is in the military he does not have the right not answer his questions even though these rights were central military law well before the miranda decision how hard is it get someone familiar the military check these facts now details like this could be overlooked if the underlying story held up but this story is so full of holes it is painful sit through for example at the beginning of the paul brenner an undercover army investigator gets into gun and knife battle at his offpost houseboat and windsup killing an arms dealer he had been investigating the local police investigating the death are openly hostile the military and they discover that brenner has been lying them about the killing but instead of arresting him or at least take him into custody for further questioning they release him duh ultimately brenner gets assigned investigate the murder and possible rape of the commanding generals daughter young captain also assigned the post when brenner finds graphic sex tapes featuring the generals daughter does he use them generate suspect list and begin grilling suspects no his instinct is suppress them because they might be potentially embarrassing eventually brenner discovers that this murder is related violent gang rape at west point eight years earlier will not even go into the totally unbelievable rationale for the armys suppression of this horrendous crime will just mention one final flaw brenner is investigating crime that occurred in georgia the rape occurred in west point is in new york he is under very tight and totally implausible hour deadline solve this case he needs discuss the rape psychiatrist at west point does he phone the doctor no he travels via some unexplained very fast transport new york question the psychiatrist in person and then he returns georgia again the miracle transport without once worrying about the impact any of this will have on his deadline you have been warned stay away from this one

it was not scary these are the first words that came mind after it was over when movie is called _vampires_ not scary are not words that should be associated it but that was not my only gripe john carpenter is name associated cuttingedge cinema as in the intense scares of _halloween_ _the thing_ and _the prince of darkness_ or the offbeat action of _they live_ and _escape from new york_ unfortunately the only thing that is cutting edge about _vampires_ is the level of boredom the movie is able reach an anemic plot and notquitekosher special effects _john carpenters vampires_ has barely enough substance slake the thirst of even the least discerning genre fan the is at first concerned group of roaming vampire slayers led james woods of all people like some sort of holy ateam they even have their own soupedup van the bunch invade and wipe out nest of vampires in new mexico shack their method is amusingly innovative the bloodsuckers are reeled out harpoons so they can flare up in the sun like matchsticks commemorate their victory the loutish band decorates motel room hookers and parties the night away their celebration is shortlived however as master vampire named valek ambushes and singlehandedly destroys most of the team woods jack crow and buddy montoya daniel baldwin escape their lives along woman named katrina sheryl lee although the woman has been bitten montoya and crow decide keep katrina for her psychic link the master vampire the rest of the movie is concerned the boys hunt for valek thomas ian griffith freaky marilyn mansontype who is on mission that dates back years along the way they pick up priest named guiteau tim guinee character who serves pretty much the same purpose as the jittery cpl upham in _saving private ryan_ some stuff happens in the middle of the movie but cannot remember most of it because often found twitching hair in the corner of the frame more interesting than what was happening on screen _vampires_ finally starts pick up about minutes into the mix as crow guiteau and montoya assault an abandoned prisonturned vampire nest only then does the begin even resemble carpenter flick but it is too little too late we get the inevitable final confrontation but it seems tacked on and rather anticlimactic come on we are dealing _the_ master vampire here interestingly last summers vampire actioner _blade_ was derived from comic book and _vampires_ from novel yet the latter seems more steeped in campy cheesiness than the former more deliberate superhero flick woods jack crow spouts glib offthecuff oneliners and strolls away from exploding buildings that ohsocool stride and his motive for killing vampires take wild guess hint ______ killed his _____ when he was just _____ at least _blade_ had decent action and slick stylishness _vampires_ lacks even cheap thrills mask its gossamerthin plot make up for this the movie resorts other shocks such as its generally condescending attitude towards women crow slaps them around for the fun of it and an overplayed contempt for religion crow teases guiteau incessantly about whether his vow of celibacy has made him prone getting woodies it can be argued that maybe wanted too much from this movie if not scary and gory wanted tense relentless and exhausting _john carpenters vampires_ is none of these can only recommended it for the hardcore carpenter fan for the rest of you looking for good scare beware _vampires_ is no teeth

perhaps best remembered as the recently departed news anchor on saturday night live who always started the segment this is the fake news norm macdonald at times could elicit some laughter blurting out semioffensive phrases in his raspy voice coated condescending attitude his shtick was marked crassness in this movie for example when his girlfriend says that she is kicking him out because he is been fired from different jobs over the last months he tries calm the situation saying maybe you will feel better after we have some dirty sex this kind of humor can only go so far but certainly cannot go the distance in fulllength feature dirty work is nothing more than sophomoric comedy about two best friends who grow up only physically emotionally they have never outgrown their pubescent years is somewhat amusingly explored in beginning flashback although having no apparent real world skills the one thing that these two have always been adept at is getting back at people if the meter maid was unjust in giving you ticket then dump bunch of unpopped kernels of corn onto the engine block and watch the car burst apart mitch norm macdonald and sam artie lange need come up in period of two weeks so that sams dad jack warden can have heart operation their idea is start revengeforhire business where they will do your dirty work in the funniest scene and possibly the only funny scene of the movie they take advantage of live television shoot at nearby used car lot their presence is established but when lessthanhonorable real estate developer hires them and then reneges on the payment the two go work exact their sordid brand of revenge default dirty work should treat us some outrageous revenge plots but it delivers jerky boys level material except for the bit at the used car lot and possibly another episode that involves frat brothers the dirty work is uninspired and becomes about as funny as prank phone call already weak on material it further spirals itself towards the video store having jack warden constantly blurt out that he has an unsatisfied libido and needs broads and also includes very unfunny chevy chase as bumbling doctor gambling addiction but what is really painfully evident is that norm macdonald has no versatility as an actor relying on his trademark of speaking into his personal recorder and saying note self note self learn fight he says after getting beat up note self there is always beer he says after hitting rock bottom etc we feel like we are just watching an elongated rehash of his notsoglorious days on saturday night live much like the television show for minutes we get one or two funny bits the rest of the story is just dead space

summer movies are nature dumb affairs that are usually made for some quick enjoyment and make money wild wild west the latest will smith affair follows much the same formula except that it is dumber and less enjoying than most summer movies will smith plays jim west black sheriff nice line in sunglasses he is called president grant kline go on mission find out why top government scientists are disappearing west is paired up scientist artemus gordon kline again and the two track the missing scientists legless mastermind named dr loveless branagh zany moustache before pile on the many negatives in this sorry affair will give it chance the positives there is nice credit sequence the production design bo welch is pleasing the eye and the special effects are decent enough there is also pleasant soundtrack buried deep in the dross are one or two amusing jokes and salma hayek pops up as the female interest is always nice see apart from these factors though nothing else in wild wild west works firstly there is little chemistry between smith and kline who appears be in it purely for the money one would expect zingers passing between the two none arise both of them plod through the below standard plot knowing that there is pay cheque waiting at the end not even kenneth branagh provides much entertainment although he is over the top the material does not present much opportunity for branagh be truly crazy therefore he just comes across as loud as obnoxious the only enjoyable performance comes from the sexy salma hayek who is given so little screen time it is embarrassing she appears be in the merely show off her body and be ogled at kline and smith her character also changes at whim fit the mechanics of the script and there is no sense of realism about the character the humour in the is also very off will smith put little spin his daft lines in men in black here not even smith could save the humour on display the script largely boils down insults that are not very funny and oneliners that barely raise smirk it is also somewhat racist although it does not intend be one scene jim west trying wisecrack his way out of lynching and actually says slavery is good save himself it is not funny scene and the whole thing comes off rather uncomfortably the also makes the tragic mistake that man in this case kline in dress is automatically unfunny it is not but the wild wild west makes this joke even more painful watch through pure ineptness there is also problems the plot jim west and artemus gordon get caught up in all kinds of sticky situations but the way they get out of them are always unsatisfying and rely purely on luck rather than audience pleasing skill plot elements are introduced into the and then thrown away just as quickly the main piece of the story foot mechanical steam driven spider devised loveless looks rather impressive but there is no particular reason why it should be built why not loveless build great big tank instead of an ungainly fragile piece of machinery that is just begging be blown up director barry sonnenfeld always has breezy look them some nice camera tricks but even this is missing from this stilted affair wild wild west could have benefited from sonnenfelds whacked out style of directing but not much of it is evident making this drag out even more it is sad thing when _four_ credited screenwriters talented director and willing star cannot make work and eventually wild wild west collapses under it is sexist mildly racist unfunny weight

what were they thinking nostalgia for the seventies is bad enough but do we really need an eighties robbie hart adam sandler used want be rock and roll star but in he is singing at weddings and having good time romantic at heart he loves weddings and is just about get married his highschool sweetie when she leaves him waiting at the altar his tune changes love stinks he meets waitress julia drew barrymore who is engaged junkbonds salesman and you know that they are going get together in fact you know everything that is going happen during this movie sandler is somewhat adequate in his leading man role but there is no spark barrymore does not seem be able convey anything other than pretty face nothing behind it beauty but no attitude both characters are just there bit parts steve buscemi and jon lovitz steal the show the eighties are shoved in our face references deloreans madonna dallas ivana and donald burt and loni and miami vice get old fast the filmmakers must have realized that there was not much entertainment the story and thought they could dazzle the audience humorous period allusions they are not funny and it does not work change on all fronts accelerating more and more nostalgia appears have great appeal but do not you think we could have more than years before we yearn for the past maybe we can look forward next year waxing nostalgically about el nino michael redman has written this column for over years and he knows that nostalgia is not what it used be

and just when you thought joblo was getting little soft around the corners not rating anything lower than your standard this movie sucks along comes this cinematic atrocity and he is forced take out his secret weapon and spray it stench so thick even the bravest moviegoer would think twice about seeing this waste of time yes despite being third sequel successful original movie the latest
