as the twin surfer dudes stew and phil deedle lay bandaged and unconscious in the hospital phil comes first and chooses the coolest way wake his brother yanking out his iv he uses it like water pistol soak his brothers face this bit of lame physical humor is typical of disneys meet the deedles movie more be endured that watched stopped looking at my wife during the screening since every time did she would start sticking her finger in her throat and she is right it is that bad directed without any imagination steve boyum whose long background in is mainly in stunts and in second unit direction the limps along at best boyum attempts keep the pace moving staging stunts stunts and more stunts amazingly for someone his background he seems incapable of finding any fresh ones and we have car go off the road five different times maybe more but who is counting and then there is the script james herzfeld whose only other tapeheads from decade ago was so awful that it is considered cult classic meet the deedles however is painfully bad rather than laughably bad it will probably be in and out of the theaters like tornado and is in no danger of becoming classic anything herzfeld treats us gratingly abysmal dialog that includes your geysers geezer and would like put deedle in her haystack as the movie opens the twins who at one point describe themselves modestly as walking kodak moment are celebrating their th birthday as they ride parasail high above the waters of waikiki truant officer pursues them on his jet ski as heirs the fabulous fortune of the deedle empire the boys are sent their father camp broken spirit at yellowstone transform the two laidback beach bums into men as they arrive in their wetsuits in yellowstone they have got their surfboards skateboards and hawaiian drink machine the size of an armoire their camp has gone out of business but they are mistaken for new park rangers the rest of the movie has them fighting the parks overpopulation of prairie dogs as well as deranged exranger played dennis hopper who is out stop old faithful before its billionth birthday celebration scheduled for later in the week hopper who has made some wonderful movies carried away being recent favorite does have propensity for choosing some truly odoriferous material this is not his worst acting but meet the deedles is arguably the worst movie he is ever been in steve van wormer and paul walker as stew and phil give lifeless performances the only actor in the movie any demonstrable talent is cute little prairie dog named petey even the cinematography david hennings is so prosaic that it manages make yellowstone look dull add insult injury hennings is fond of inappropriate closeups only serve remind us of the inanity of the dialog put tenfoot pair of lips on the screen and you naturally pay extra attention what is said although boyum says in the notes that he is proud that his is appropriate for families one wonders how many skateboarders will attempt the movies stunt of lying on your back on skateboard while negotiating busy and twisting mountain road they make it look like so much fun that am sure many will try some variation of the stunt how could this possibly be worst asks phil just when you suspect it cannot the movie takes turn further downhill its low point may have you looking for an airline barf bag after phils girlfriend digs up big mount of moist soil they suck in long worm like the two dog lovers eating spaghetti in lady and the tramp their lips finally meet in kiss as they pull back their faces are full of the dirt that encased the worm they have just ingested meet the deedles runs about an hour and half it is rated pg for little bathroom humor and would be acceptable for kids around and up my son jeffrey and his friend nickolas both almost gave the show they both thought the scenes petey were among their favorites nickolas also mentioned the scene in the circus bear drives jeep and jeffrey especially liked the one in the circus elephant was referred as dumbo

bicentennial man is family without any external motive the exception of providing the minimum dose of entertainment chris columbus the director who gave you mrs doubtfire plays on sentimental strings and mushy dialogue make his point based on the short story isaac asimov it is supposed be science fiction story about robot who wants be human as you can imagine is very difficult starting in not too distant future the concentrates on wealthy family that buys an android help them the house and children soon this robot called andrew robin williams shows abilities that makes his owner mr martin sam neill very curious andrew is interested in art and music he enjoys making clocks clearly shows that he has genuine emotions it shows out that because of small failure in the electrical circuits and positronic brain andrew has accidentally gained soul this makes him unique and his evil creators worried then mr martin decides teach andrew all the things he was not programmed do soon andrew wants leave the house in pursuit of freedom destiny and love this can be described as disney version of blade runner that still shines as the biggest gem in the crown of science fiction ever since that the subject of humanity still stands as one big controversy what makes us human the thoughts the emotions is it possible become human at what point can we say robot now you are one of us these are very tough questions that require serious and thurral approach it is obvious that columbus did not take them very seriously when you think about it this is not really meditating on the question when is robot no longer machine but human being but tells story about racial discrimination and lack of understanding andrew is so complex and emotional from the very beginning that the audience immediately accepts him as human being and only the society has troubles it in other words it is as far from reality as from the academy awards further more there are other annoying problems this day no serious filmmaker has dared speculate about the future in more than years from now this has not been done for obvious reasons because the filmmakers are well aware of the fact that they lack the knowledge and imagination perform such difficult task columbus is the first have crossed that line the result is as you might imagine primitive unrealistic and incredibly disappointing effort the world is simply frozen in time neither the society fashion culture or values have changed over years mom is still working at the kitchen doing the dishes when you think back the late th century and then compare it the world we live in today you will see slightly bigger difference am not saying that everything should change it is unlikely that the human rights will change but it is even more unlikely that there will not be any progress in science technology and fashion suppose it is possible watch this as some sort of bizarre fairytale but it is really hard robin williams is hidden behind and speaking in robotic way as always he does decent job as does sam neill but it does not really matter it is the sentimentality and length that turns this picture into tiresome experience pretty much like last years meet joe black this is primitive and unresolved story is presented splendor and professionalism that it does not deserve great actors and talented crew have worked hard achieve something that will be instantly forgotten when isaac asimov wrote this story the future seemed far away and magical everything seemed possible now is the future of asimovs time and we know that it is not as magical and perfect as it seemed long time ago for the same reasons that the young generation of today can not be amazed julius vernes leagues under the sea so cannot we accept this story as potential reality let us hope that next years i will be more rewarding

in the continuation of warner brothers franchise joel schumacher has successfully killed this cash cow what makes this such grand disappointment is the tremendous line up of talented people involved the avika goldsmans screenplay is such cluttered mess that there is no suspense built from one scene another this coming on the heals of such marvelously written project as the client is such shock that it gives rise thoughts that the latter was fluke situations are developed and executed no thought of reason other that get the characters from one point another this is most glaringly brought point the appearance of alicia silverstones batgirl who just happens be alfreds niece the story of dr victor freeze is told almost completely in dialogue as an afterthought while working on cure for tragic decease contracted his wife dr freeze is injured during cryogenic procedure and becomes man who can only survive in sub zero environment now of course he has become terrorist intent on turning the world into frozen planet where only he can live now the logic of that little subplot escapes me if mr freeze wanted find cure for his wife and bring her back from the brink of death why would he want have her live in world no warmth this is indeed cold hearted man the development of poison ivy is no less contradictory she wants breed form of plant life that can defend itself like an animal she joins mr freeze in his plan start new ice age destroying all animal life therefore giving her plant creations no reason have the defense mechanism she had been trying breed into them the characters have no logic batman of course is no longer the dark knight of the earlier films now that he has an adoptive son in burt ward robin bruce wayne is trying be father figure constantly spouting out homilies about family and relationships while at the same time not really having any george clooney tries in vain keep from rolling his eyes while reciting the dialogue given him say that his performance is workmanlike is be generous his best performances are still on r bruce wayne has the most unromantic evening his girlfriend played elle macpherson that it brings into question bruces latent homosexuality there is no spark and no passion as there was for nicole kidmans psychologist in batman forever between bruce and anyone other than alfred and even that relationship is very reserved robin comes off less charismatic that in the last in the series now he is just spoiled kid in batman forever burt ward wanted be batmans partner and friend now robin is suffering from ego deficiency robins attraction for poison ivy is not believable except for boy around the age of his later flirtation batgirl smacks of incest even though they are not related in traditional sense chris odonnell once considered rising star successfully burns up on reentry this performance his robin needs nothing more than good spanking the less said about alicia silverstones performance the better this talented young actress reads her lines all the aplomb of dubbing actor for godzilla she was cast strictly for her commercial value and she knew it this brings us the villains arnold scharzenegger walks through his part all the concern of someone waiting for payday the most rediculous scene is during mr freezes imprisonment the guards are at least foot taller that arnold and yet fall at his hand in one of the most unbelievable fights scenes caught on it is almost as ludicrous as seeing michael jackson as gang member umu thurman struts and coos her way through her part showing growing discomfort her sex symbol status her poison ivy has all the come hither sex appeal of may west in sextette the only performances worthy of notice are pat hingle and michael gough these two seasoned veterans carry their scenes dignity sorely lacking from the rest of the without going through the intricacies of the plot there is one question that always comes mind this series except for the first batman and that is how do these super villains manage hire so many thugs only abandon them at the final reel mr freeze is introduced team of hockey playing hoodlums that seem have stepped out of an old kiss music video every villain even the minor ones have have look no one can be an individual day glow paint on their face or some sort of elaborate costume this warner brothers has succeeded in retrograding the series back it is tv incarnation the only thing missing from the action scenes are the superimposed titles detailing the pows gwaaaas and clangs associated the old series you almost wonder if william dozier producer of the tv series is collecting royalties from this the special effects john dykstra and production design barbara ling are the primary stars of this and it is case of extravagance in the pursuit of nothing every set from ivys lair the batcave freezes hideout is set enough neon and fiberglass keep the epa in paperwork for years come there is no one realistic set or set piece in the everything is set for maximum exposure the special effects have that strange cartoon look that most rushed cgi effects have there are homage thrown in dykstra and his team gene warren and his work on the time machine the growing plant scene but these scenes are so wroth glaring color and art that they are almost obscured joel schumacher has directed the no flair camera angles are poorly chosen rehashing set ups from the old tv series master shots pepper the action scenes destroying any flow of kinetic quality they may have had mr schumacher is good director one just has look back on the films the lost boys cousins an underrated and the client know that but batman and robin comes off as mated made for tv movie the has no style of individuality it is the cinematic equivalent jello pretty look at but empty it is unfortunate that this even it is surprisingly strong box office has succeeded in doing what warners thought tim burton would do the franchise kill it joel schumachers batman robin is loud colorful action packed and ultimately boring stars

long ago films were constructed of strong dialogue original characters memorable plot points and solid acting one of the best examples that now completely ignore these qualities is found in the new where the heart is this opus about the power of love and the redemption of family follows the tragic and mean tragic life of novalee nation natalie portman hitting the road her hick guitarplaying boyfriend in rustedout gm novalee dreams of the blue skies of bakersfield and sipping chocolate milk beneath plastic umbrella her unborn baby due in month stopping off at nearby walmart for quick rest novalees boyfriend decides take off and leaves her there novalee then decides secretly hole up in the walmart because she is not the brightest bulb in the stagelights wacky librarian keith david comes her rescue when she goes into labor one night while she is camped in the outdoors section of the store then the she moves in family befriends everyone in town including ashley judds character who has five kids and still can work parttime as nurse fights off religious freaks survives tornado breaks the heart of the wacky librarian that saved her receives an inheritance builds martha stewartesque house becomes an awardwinning photographer and manages always look like she stepped out of cosmo shoot all while not once doing anything her kid this is terrible the directing is awful it seems director matt williams had an index card six angles written on it and used every one of them over and over and over again we get pathetic and ugly acting natalie portman who can do good work disjointed pacing of key scenes and time structure so confusing that it would throw steve prefontaine off subplot that actually validates the actions of the boyfriend who abandoned novalee in the walmart parking lot an embarrassing display of emotions the characters making the audience ill taking two great comedic screenwriters babaloo mandel and lowell ganz and forcing them write drama on par oprahs book club altogether it has the feeling of being trapped at home watching very bad television miniseries and wishing it end only the remote is broken however the main problem the is that it never answers the most poignant question brought up where is the heart no one ever seems find it in this piece of junk

stars armand assante mike hammer barbara carrera dr charlotte bennett laurene landon velda alan king charles kalecki geoffrey lewis joe butler paul sorvino detective pat chambers judson scott charles hendricks barry snider romero julia barr norma childs mpaa rating review in the updating of mickey spillanes novel the jury hardboiled detective mike hammer is vietnam vet who drives shiny bronze trans am dresses like don johnson in miami vice less pastels and has sworn off alcohol however he still smokes his lucky strikes detests all forms of authority and kills at whim beyond that the updated retains little or no resemblance the original pulpy pageturner spillane probably the most infamous and often reviled of all mystery writers the movie starts off bang howler of an opening credits sequence that is cheap steal from the james bond series complete cheesy graphics and an overbearing jazz score bill conti rocky after that the movie and the book begin the same the murder of jack williams frederick downs onearmed detective and hammers best friend hammer declares that he will seek vengeance for jacks death and the help of his devoted secretary the blond and shapely velda laurene landon and the alternately friendly antagonistic police chief pat chambers paul sorvino he is immediately on the killers trail here the movie splits completely from the book and dives into convoluted and improbable tale of government conspiracy and mind control tactics involving the mafia the cia one of hammers vietnam vet buddies and kinky sex clinic many of the same characters from the book appear in the movie but they take on slightly different roles for instance charles kalecki alan king numbers runner and narcotics dealer in the book turns into suave mob boss and more importantly hammers suspicious love interest charlotte bennett barbara carrera morphs from runofthemill psychiatrist into the coordinator and founder of the sex clinic the jury is one of several cinematic renditions of spillanes books including version was made in but this differs from those earlier versions in one major way it includes all of the sex and violence spillane wrote about that could never be given screen treatment due hollywoods production code although this takes the version of the jury closer the core of the original subject matter it is in this aspect that the received the most criticism because it took this new license extremes that many argued surpassed what was in the book rest assured the movie not only includes great deal of nudity but it is thoroughly violent especially toward women it features one woman having her neck slashed set of twins forced strip before being stabbed death psychotic sexual deviant programmed the cia judson scott and another woman shot pointblank in the belly hammer himself no one would deny that spillanes writing has definite misogynistic nature but the movie seems take it step further giving it such glorious screen treatment its constant equation of sex and violence much of is played the intention of being erotic is quite unsettling it is no surprise that the movie like the book fades black dead woman on the floor the jury had troubled production and was not wellsupported the studio that made it is one explanation why it did not do well in theaters and many people have forgotten that it was ever made the script was written larry cohen who is best known for his creatively cheesy but nonetheless effective monster movies like it is alive and its two sequels and the stuff cohen wrote the script thinking he was going helm the project as well but he was yanked from the directors chair after only weeks worth of shooting because he was already over budget he was quickly replaced richard heffron who has worked for the last three decades on handful of undistinguished movies and dozens of television projects heffron was obviously brought in not for his talent but because he could make the movie rapidly and efficiently it shows in the final product cohen had personal interest in the updated version of hammer but heffron has none he shot the movie quickly and clumsily and although some scenes ring true most of them are flat trite and invariably dull the movie features numerous car chases shootouts and stunts but heffrons background in television is the dominant tone despite the graphic violence and fullfrontal nudity the jury takes on the air of madefortv quickie no real punch or depth but the problems in the jury run deeper than the technical the central fault in this updating is mike hammer whose character was lost in the shuffle while updating from the fifties the eighties because spillane wrote all his hammer mysteries in the first person hammers character is central the tale because all the events are filtered through his persona we never really get that impression in the movie there is no firstperson voiceover narration and some scenes do not have hammer in them at all consequently great deal of the texture of spillanes storytelling is lost the period updating turns out be detrimentally bad idea because much of hammers moral code is thrown the wind despite his characterization as hardnosed violent misogynistic killer hammer always stuck fervently his own moral code the title itself the jury refers his antiestablishment notion of being his own law unlike private eyes who seek out the bad guys and then turn them over the police hammer both pursues the criminal and exacts the punishment in this way he can be seen as above the law but he still adheres strictly her own personal code of conduct his own morality the movie forgoes that aspect of his character and hammer comes off not only as amoral in societys terms but in any terms especially his own if anything hammer always had his professionalism but the movie does away that in the first three minutes showing him rolling in the sack the wife of client who had paid him find out if that wife was being unfaithful maybe the scene was intended for laughs but it only cheapens hammers character and is all accounts lousy way start the movie the blame for hammers character cannot be laid on assantes shoulders because despite some unnecessary marlon brandonlike mumbling he delivers fine performance spillane never once described hammers physical attributes in any of the dozen books in he appeared so any actor could conceivably portray him of course because of the lack of written description those who have read spillanes books will have strong personal notion of what hammer looks like and therefore almost any screen incarnation will somehow fall short of expectations spillane who played the character himself in the girl hunters is generally considered the best of the hammers the rest of actors are most unnoteworthy the exceptions of alan king and paul sorvino everyone who appeared in the jury were upandcomers who basically went nowhere many of them ended up working in television like carrera who had short stint on dallas in the mideighties only adds the madefortv atmosphere of the maybe someday someone will manage get the right elements together and make an effective rendition of spillane book but this is certainly not it

nostalgia for the continues as we see revival of one of the decades greatest achievements the marijuana comedy however half baked does not quite run all its brain cells and will make you appreciate the questionable talents of cheech and chong all the more the plot follows the misadventures of four neerdowell stoners there is the groups unofficial leader thurgood david chappelle scarface guillermo diaz brian jim breuer and kenny harland williams kenny gets into trouble when while on munchie run feeds his snack foods diabetic police horse when the animal keels over he finds himself accused of killing police officer and facing bail his friends promise raise money for bail bond but have no idea how that is until thurgood stumbles upon stash of pharmaceutical marijuana being tested at the company where he works as janitor soon the three guys are dealing dope raise funds while avoiding the cops and rival dealer sampson simpson clarence williams iii for comedy the is pretty humorless not that it does not try it is just that the comic setups are obvious and the payoffs nearly all fall flat the four leads are nearly all playing the same character only williams stands out while still performing on the level of his humorfree comedy rocket man but that is because he is imprisoned throughout most of the giving much needed change of pace but mostly swapping one set of obvious gags for another help out the is packed full of cameos steven wright tommy chong janeane garofalo willie nelson snoop doggy dogg and jon stewart all make appearances at one point or another none of them work beyond the simple hey that is _____ level in fact the funniest work in the comes from chappelle not as his bland pothead lead but in his second role as potobsessed rapper sir smokealot granted it is pretty much onejoke role and there are not ton of laughs but this needs every one it can scrape up top it off and in move contrasting the tone of the rest of the thurgood is given love interest mary jane rachel true her role is that of the public service announcement inform us why doing drugs including pot is wrong her character seems fabricated merely as defense the your promotes the use of drugs camp the would have been better off sticking the rebel tone it so eagerly tries claim yet in the end it does not really matter watching the clean and sober you are bound recognize how truly awful it is

anna and the king is at least the fourth adaptation of margaret landons fact based novel the king and and it is big expensive and soulless though goodlooking its lavish sets fancy costumes and luscious cinematography can do little compensate for the emotional wasteland that is peter krikes and steve meersons script so much money was spent on pretty pictures that they forgot actually make the movie interesting this is jodie fosters first movie since the jawdroppingly brilliant contact came out more than two years ago and it is not the best choice show off her acting chops she is trapped in the stoic role of anna leonowens the uptight widowed british schoolteacher who comes siam now thailand her son instruct the kings chow yunfat son in the ways of the west because the ways of england are the ways of the world the king likes her so much he puts her in charge of educating the whole royal family kids more in the way impressive no the eldest prince is none too happy about this father have offended you in some way why do you punish me imperialist schoolteacher but soon gets know anna and her stern motherwholovesyou personality better and comes like her meanwhile siam comes under attack from the neighboring british colony of burma the king and his close advisors suspect that this is britains doing arouses suspicion in siam putting anna in an uncomfortable position she is not sure what make of this and seems herself suspect british involvement in the crisis but works diffuse the kings prejudices he though selfrighteous as ever cannot help but be influenced the eloquent anna and they slowly quietly develop affections for each other there is scene in the middle of anna and the king where one of the kings younger daughters dies it is your classic deathbed scene the girls mournful eyes staring at her father who tries only semi successfully maintain his composure anna then comes in and cries bit the sequence was there for purpose evoke strong emotional response from the viewer am usually sucker for such scenes and yet this time was just sitting there my emotions untouched this remains true through all of the movie remains emotionally barren we never develop connections the characters never given reason care this ludicrously long epic was directed andy tennant whose last was ever after one of my favorites of do not doubt tennants ability put together decent movie but anna and the king aside from being psychologically inept is also technologically deficient the sets and scenery are gorgeous but the camerawork does nothing convey its grandeur even terrence malick managed do more flora and fauna in his otherwise abysmal the thin red line than tennant can muster from million worth of props and shoot in malaysia we feel like the camera is restricted its immediate point of view there are no wide tracking shots or sweeping zooms fill us largerthanlife awe liked both foster and yunfat who give entertaining if not terribly involving performances in the two lead roles fosters generally stoic persona serves her well here as she is playing reserved formal and rather underdeveloped character yunfat is especially effective perfectly conveying the king of siams sangfroid permeated violent outbursts what does anna and the king in is its inability involve the viewer in its characters and situations the cast is great the director is talented and the budget is lavish but this illadvised remake of the classic rogers and hammerstein movie is unable utilize any of those things form compelling whole this is an emotionless costume epic

robin hood men in tights is another melbrooksproduced in the classic tradition of movies like blazing saddles and young frankenstein mel brooks is well known for his comic look at regular life his fast paced dialogue and sharp wit unfortunately robin hood men in tights has none of the easy going humor of blazing saddles none of the fun acting of young frankenstein is devoid of the charm of spaceballs and is even lacking the good solid dialogue of history of the world it is in short one of the worst movies have seen mel brooks or anybody else produce the plot borrows heavily from the wellreceived kevin costner movie of last year robin hood prince of thieves this is not surprising in and of itself and could have been used great comic effect mainly parodying scenes from the orginal movie mel brooks does not take advantage of this however and uses the launch several ideas into the air none of connect and none of are explained later on the movies scenes could be shuffled around in any order and one would be hard pressed notice cary elwes of princess bride fame plays robin of loxley man who was captured in the crusades fighting king richard he escapes and joining man named achoo am sure you can see the obvious joke fights in england reclaim his name and the throne for richard has been captured evil prince john played funny comic richard lewis he also tries for the love of maid marian and attempts overthrow the evil sheriff of rottingham good adventure plot that is sadly unused elwes and lewis are both excellent comics but the dialogue in the movie is simply excruciating neither actor has any good words work and the lines simply are not funny nor believable perhaps the worst example of this is when the group of merry men encounter man playing macaulay culkin clone from the hit movie home alone this particular scene is so out of place and so badly acted and followed so many other scenes of equal miserable ideas that really felt like leaving the theatre much of the audience continued look at their watches throughout and some left the theatre chuckles were few and far between and they mostly dealt visual jokes such as an old beaten up horse from rentawreck then from any dialogue whatsoever scenes that could have been classics such as the archery contest are ruined poor acting perhaps the largest problem the movie is that it is simply offensive the basic plot that robin has received key that will unlock the chastity belt of maid marian is not witty nor funny mel brooks as circumcisiongiving rabbi is also offensive me and others in the audience not all jewish either the movie simply tries hard trying be funny and and large fails the addition of blind man who stumbles around falling off cliffs walking into ledges and being general buffoon could have had some humorous potential but is also made terribly offensive the only reason see this movie is the surprise actor at the end who plays king richard he is well worth waiting for if you can stand an hour and half of unfunny dialogue excruciating visual humor old puns ancient jokes and bad acting if you cannot do not even bother watching this miserable

his successful books and movies michael crichton is doing well early successes westworld and coma and recent films such as jurassic park his films have been entertaining however he seems taken wrong turn somewhere sphere this million mess good director barry levison disclosure is dull long winded and huge disappointment considering the huge budget the all star cast and story crichton sphere is majorly disappointing the opens norman goodman hoffman psychologist who thinks he is visiting an airplane crash console the survivors however when he arrives he his told supervisor barnes peter coyote that he is actually investigating an spacecraft along goodman is mathematician harry adams jackson biologist beth halperin stone and ted fielding liev schrieber they investigate the spaceship find massive sphere inside meet an alien intelligence called jerry and basically weird crap happens unfortunately something went wrong along the way sphere the starts off entertaining enough but throughout this very long movie it just gets sillier and sillier the jaunts along from scene scene never fully explaining what is going on the actors and directing do not help either hoffman is on autopilot and almost seems embarrassed throughout the movie churning out dull lines and probably wondering what the hell he is doing in this movie stone is useless displaying no emotion and fails convince the audience that she has any feelings for hoffman the only person who seems be having fun in this movie is jackson who is funny as the mathematician who slowly goes crazy and entering the sphere but he is hardly in it and the end of the he is just as dull as hoffman and stone the same goes for peter coyote who hams it up as the officer but is then killed off halfway through the director barry levinson who directed the better crichton adaptation disclosure messes up the drama and the action the drama scenes are quite frankly boring and the action scenes suffer from overkill levison throwing the camera all over the place much like the godawful speed the writing does not help much either although crichton is great plots he is terrible dialogue and practically every line in sphere is dud the speech is too simple was hoping it would be bit more intelligent practically every line is just stating the obvious none of it is smart also where the hell did the budget go the sphere itself is impressive and there is few nice special effect shots but where the million went is anyones guess there is giant squid attack in the picture but not once does the audience see the squid even though the has massive budget assume the picture was trying build up tension not showing the squid and if handled correctly it probably would but the whole scene is done badly and was just hoping we could see the stupid squid finally the has no idea what genre be levison cannot handle his own plot it leaps from hokey scifi horror and finally the shiningevent horizon psychological thriller and of course the is very much like the abyss although in it is defense crichton did write sphere before the abyss was released and is far superior this rubbish it is not all that bad though the plot is all right there is few jump scenes although nothing very scary and there is the occasionally interesting bit but overall sphere is big waste of some fine talent lot of money and potentially good movie not really worth seeing overall rating review david wilcock

director luis mandokis last was the superb serious drama when man loves woman but his luck has ultimately run out his latest picture message in bottle is the worst type of romance movie that tugs so relentlessly and violently at the heartstrings that it miraculously manages dry out your eyes rather than tear them up everything that occurs can be telegraphed way in advance since this same type of story has been done many times beforeand much betterso there is an absence of suspense and the ultimately moves at such very very deliberate pace as if it is trying make great meaningful statements and plot developments that it just becomes tedious bore sit through message in bottle begins theresa osborne robin wright penn single mother and researcher at the chicago tribune whom finds bottle washed up on shore as she is jogging one day inside the bottle is an anonymous love letter addressed mystery woman named catherine and theresa is so taken aback its honesty and sweetness that she shows it around at her work and her objection finds that her editor has placed the letter in the newspaper soon heavy research is conducted find out who wrote the letter based on the type of bottle and ship logo on the top of the typed message and after it is traced man named garrett blake theresa finds herself traveling the outer banks boating town in north carolina find out the specifics of the message of course garrett turns out be handsome rugged man around theresas age and played kevin costner she is immediately charmed him but hesitant unveil the truth of why she is there and finds that catherine was garretts late wife who died few years earlier do you think you know where this is headed most likely you do and would not call it giving away anything say that the pictures end the movie has fallen into deep artificial melodrama that did not buy for second if there are any positive things say about message in bottle it is that the performances robin wright penn and paul newman as garretts stubborn but loving father are far above par be in such wasteful shaggy dog love story and that the cinematography caleb deschanel takes great advantage of the beautiful eastern coast and paints chicago as an equally alluring city meanwhile costner has yet redeem himself for some of the lessthanstellar films that he has made recently it seems that such bad luck he would not want make another movie set near water but here he is again one of the main and most ridiculous centerpieces set on stormswept sea the other actors are all sadly wasted including illeana douglas an underused actress who seems always get stuck the friend roles here playing penns confidante and coworker at the tribune the first half of message in bottle plays like humdrum trite television movie for the lifetime channel as theresa spends great deal of time getting know garrett dialogue that is not the least bit stimulating or entertaining usually am the type of person practically salivate over dialogueladen sequences since the is no doubt trying develop the characters and their relationships but here it all rang resounding falseness since the dialogue felt written and not as if people were really talking when the main characters of have very little of interest say each other and are not particularly interesting themselves you know immediately that you are in trouble swear that while watching message in bottle felt as if had just read the screenplay in its entirety before arriving at the theater heck in actuality am not even familiar the novel this is based on nicholas sparks always one step ahead of the characters the movie ran so closely and tightly the constraints of the triedandtrue melodrama the strip often seemed almost be in danger of tearing nobody wins prizes for guessing that garrett will eventually find out theresas secret and that several obstacles will come within their ways of living happily ever after this same exact problem occurred in last years very very similar watch this and you will realize just how similar mean meg ryannicolas cage romantic drama city of angels although theresa is deeply touched the heartfelt letter that she finds in the bottle perhaps the filmakers might have been better off finding message in bottle of their own preferably before filming began it should have read memo screenwriters use you brain

i remember really enjoying this movie when saw it years ago guess my memory really sucks there is very very little that is funny in caddyshack the laughs are few and far between and what there are really are not that great caddyshack as the name implies more or less centers on one young caddy working at an exclusive country club michael okeefe plays said caddy why they cast this unknown fairly untalented actor in the lead role is completely beyond me the movie does not seem have real plot just series of scenes that are little more than opportunities for the rest of the cast mug at the camera the only real story if you can call it that was subplot involving the mentally disturbed greens keeper bill murray who is having his own private little war against gopher who is ruining the course most of the marginal laughs come from rodney dangerfield and ted knight mugging and overacting for the camera painfully limited success bill murray is slightly amusing in places but fairly wasted the biggest waste of all is chevy chase who did not even crack smile on my face his characters lame zenlike approach golfing there are few decent scenes involving the interaction between dangerfield and knight but they are far too infrequent carry the movie guess that is what you get for basing story around an unknown kid am not sure what the writers of this thing were thinking of but really think it was something far removed from comedy as they were putting pen paper nothing about this movie works it would not have taken genius figure out that this thing was not going fly most of the scenes just could not possibly be funny it is as if the writers where off in their own little brain damaged world am sure scenes involving chevy chase and his oneness the golf ball were supposed be funny in reality they were painfully embarrassing watch there is scene at the club pool where all the caddies go wild for the hot babe of the movie walking in her bikini olive oil would have filled out this swimsuit better than this girl everything about this movie was just completely implausible as far as the comedy was concerned maybe if you were drunk out of you mind or high off some sort of illegal narcotic this thing might be funny but for the rest of us stay the hell away from caddyshack

tommy lee jones chases an innocent victim around america who is trying prove that she did not kill her spouse the fugitive not quite this is the plot for double jeopardy another fugitive copycat without the action excitement and good acting that the original had there are other slight differences besides one movie being bad and the other good this time tommy lee jones plays parole officer not us marshall clever huh oh and the fugitive ashley judd was framed her own husband bruce greenwood who needed collect two million dollars in life insurance money not one armed man both movies are on video make the wise choice and pick the fugitive there are so many flaws in double jeopardy it is laughable while serving time in prison libby parsons judd discovers that she can never be charged for committing the same crime twice learning that her husband is still alive she decides serve her time in prison find him retrieve her son and kill her husband if necessary when the strict parole officer travis lehman jones stands in her way libby decides break the rules who knows why and continue her plan despite the fact that if she gets caught she is going back jail director bruce beresford spends way too much time trying convince the audience that libby misses her son every other scene we are given shot of libby staring and crying at his picture in an action movie like this valuable time wasted on these shots takes away more opportunities for libby get up and do something all that is needed in this type of movie is short scene in libby tells herself or friend miss my son nothing more nothing less dr kimble of the fugitive did not look at one picture of his dead wife his primary concern was save himself libby at times shows this same determination but not nearly enough ashley judd and bruce greenwood both are excellent actors but if they continue do movies like this they will be typecast for the rest of their careers kind of like their doomed costar tommy lee jones winning an oscar for the fugitive must have convinced jones that audiences will never get tired of his idomyjobwhethertheyareinnocentorguilty roles people still pay see his movies and he makes plenty of money so guess he was right though do not think he will win another oscar again the ultimate mistake in the script is what eventually becomes of libby parsons even if she was excused for disobeying her parole officer the number of other crimes she commits while on the run are too numerous count burglary assault grand theft auto are some of libbys slipups the message of the movie is you can break all of the small laws as long as you are innocent of the major crime hopefully criminals will not use double jeopardy as reference in court for why they are innocent that would just be plain stupid

while am not fond of any writers use of cheap easy puns am not completely above using them myself when the situation merits it witness my review of _pecker_ from couple of issues ago so here goes the juvenile collegeset black comedy _dead_man_on_campus_ is dead on arrival straitlaced med student josh tom everett scott who manages remain somewhat likable throughout blemishfree academic record breaks out into fs thanks the influence of his everpartying roommate cooper markpaul gosselaar who introduces josh the sex and boozefilled nights that come university life the threat of losing an academic scholarship josh and life cleaning toilets for his dad looming cooper what are two goodhearted slackers do easylook for loophole they find in the form of an unbelievable rule in the school charter that states that if students or students roommate commits suicide the surviving student shall receive straight as so instead of studying josh and cooper attempt seek out the most depressed student out there move him into their dorm room and drive him suicide before the semester ends director alan cohn and screenwriters michael traeger and mike white working from story anthony abrams and adam larson broder take their sweet time build the head of steam that comes josh and coopers diabolical plot until then the usual boring cliches of college life booze sex more booze fill the time is made feel longer _saved_by_the_bell_ alumnus gosselaars sitcombred mugging that said once cohn and company do build some comic momentum they mishandle it the introduction of the manic psychotic cliff lochlyn munro potential roommate for josh and cooper brings some demented life the uninspired proceedings before being hastily written out in favor of two less interesting candidates paranoid nerd buckley randy pearlstein and british death rocker matt corey page one wishes that cliff would reappear but as they say be careful what you wish for not surprisingly he does resurface and it then becomes clear that this is character that is best taken in small dose almost immediately his extended boorish and sociopathic antics loses its novelty the same can be said about all of _dead_man_on_campus_ whatever morbid appeal the farfetched premise has quickly evaporates and the selfabsorbed characters especially cooper pretty much grate from the getgo _dead_man_ does not grow tiresome it already _is_ once the clever opening titles are through as it slogs along cheesy happyforallparties conclusion _dead_man_ lives up its title and then somenot only does the movie grow even more tired and die it still insists on going on like zombie

boy what great movie keanu reeves and morgan freeman acting together the director of the fugitive andrew davis back again give us another thriller and the beautiful rachel stealing beauty weisz thrown in boot how could this not be blockbuster all diehard keanu reeves fans read on ol much ado about nothing plays eddie kasalivich machinist studying at the university of chicago help pay for the rent he takes on this job making the machinery for hydrogen project being conducted the university happy coincidence he also happens stumble on the solution the final problem and thus is the only one who knows the key performing this feat of miracle physics this project holds great promise taking hydrogen from water and giving out more energy than is put in potential solution the earths energy problems without the pollution cost surely nobody could have any problems that morgan freeman is paul shannon the projects sponsor he works for very powerful organization that disagrees the paternal project leader as how quickly technology should be released the public he figures the world will disintegrate into anarchy if the results of the project are released too quickly so he murders the project leader blows up the project great but short scene here sort of like mini id citydevastation thing and tries simulate the experiment at some other hitech hushhush location unfortunately our intrepid machinist and an english physicist weisz manage get away and now follows fugitivelike chase using not too dissimilar rehash of that movie script this movie is just dying for comparison the fugitive both movies use chicago as the main city and since the place does not change much guess we cannot really blame the setting for the paucity of atmosphere the trouble here is that where the fugitive had harrison ford and tommy lee jones chain reaction only has keanu reeves and fred ward credit them but we are not really given much of chance empathise the characters where ford was able work within the confines of the movie evoke sympathy eddie kasalivich just doesnt seem very believeable and reeves character is never given the time develop it might have been better investment in give the characters more depth and spend less time on the chase sequences frankly get quite boring after while harrison ford was the man against the world he was alone in world where he did not know who trust and it came across real well in chain reaction keanu reeves is not alone now that would be fine if the fleeing couple had some chemistry and could really portray some paranoia vulnerability and confusion we do not get this we get him thinking he is still in speed only now our sandra bullock has an english accent probably does not drive bus and hardly contributes anything the movie the producers here probably thought hey what if keanu and rachel do not hit it off too well let us rope in that morgan help us out well keanu and rachel did not hit it off well on the screen and most unfortunately morgan freeman does not help much either the only thing we come really know of paul shannon is that he always has full load of cigars in his cigar holder it is not really his fault once again andrew davis just does not take the time build his characters someone must have convinced him that this time round cinema dollars are best earned making the movie run like headless chicken the flying inkpot rating system wait for the tv broadcast little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice

there are those of us who think of leslie nielsen as the bumbling hapless straight man from the hysterical naked gun films crack an immediate smile and forgive him of whatever wavering movie spoof he is committed himself starring in since the wavering movie spoofs however are less forgivable be fair wrongfully accused the sendup in question and nielsens third parody since the last gun is not quite as excruciatingly humorless as his dracula dead and loving it or spy hard is mighty good thing nielsen is still in tiptop comedic form able as ever deadpan his way through even the most horrible puns but he really needs screenplay that plays off his talents instead of relying on them and he needs one very soon wrongfully accused meshes together the premises of the fugitive and patriot games casting its always game star as ryan harrison get it master violinist who is drawn into an affair married temptress kelly le brock she however sets harrison up take the rap for the murder of her husband michael york crime actually committed onearmed onelegged oneeyed man aaron pearl harrison is arrested found guilty and sentenced death but escapes from prison bus of course and then is pursued determined s marshal named fergus falls richard crenna unnecessarily riffing off of tommy lee jones already smirky oscarwinning role there is also mystery brunette melinda mcgraw and an assassination subplot involving the n secretary general but like any of it matters wrongfully accused gets off an assured start an inconcert nielsen touted lord of the violin barechested posters pulling jimi hendrix on his musical instrument as hundreds of tuxedoclad mosh in front of the stage nice touch most of the scenes that follow however never top the opener hysterical exceptions the mentos and baywatch goofs movie parodies are crammed in at an almostsubliminal rate but most are empty when giant snake lunges onto the screen and snatches cast member la anaconda or baseball players disappear into field of dreams esque cornfield there is really nothing laugh at other moments like an interlude in fishing shop are so unfocused that you are not sure what you are supposed be laughing at there seem be more cheap references than frenzied sendups here so it is possible that directorwriter pat proft bombarding the viewer careless mixture of the two guarantees something is sure stick and what does stick sticks well particularly the jabs at genre conventions like stylized flashbacks and hardboiled dialogue what those naked gun proft collaborated on did great these bits are so ontarget that they allow you remember wrongfully accused as an almosthalfwaythere spoof instead of lamebrained failure the movie might have been cursed begin opening fast on the heels of mafia from proft colleague jim abrahams and baseketball from proft colleague david zucker but it is strong possibility that nobody is going be accusing wrongfully accused of being nielsens funniest

please do not mind this windbag letting off bit of steam just want warn all of you all not waste your hardearned on anaconda it is not even worth cent video rental do not listen ebert on this one he has no clue what he is talking about btw accompanied my friend this one because she was required watch it on assignment she reviews movies for local paper now will actually back up my huffing and puffing here goes movie anaconda rydains bottom line wait for it come on usa up all night even then doubt it is worth the price of jolt help you stay up that late why do hate anaconda let me count the ways first of all this movie gets way too many snake facts wrong as an ophiophile snake lover can tell you that anacondas would never reach length of feet they are scared of people cases of snakes eating adult humans are extremely rare because human shoulders are too wide fit in snakes mouth and constrictor snakes do not kill what they cannot eat people can outrun snakes no trouble especially heavy ones like anacondas if an anaconda did eat human it would need at least months of sitting on its butt digest the huge meal therefore it could not run around gobbling up everybody else in the cast and snakes have no vocal cords so they cannot make funny squealing noises whew was prepared suspend reality if the movie would have been worth it unfortunately anaconda was about as suspenseful and exciting as watching paint peel my friend and even successfully predicted who would live at the end anybody can tell the bad guy is going die eventually that was pity because his character was one of the few reasons my friend and did not give up and fall asleep he was the most likable character in the movie who would not enjoy somebody who looks like deranged walt whitman anaconda did have its cute moments arguments between ice cubes character and the british guy for instance however those small flashes of wit were not worth the other hour and twentyeight minutes of boring schlock the writers had and blew multitude of opportunities insert funny lines was quite disappointed scene where young guy tells young lady that the jungle makes him horny did she retort clever egowithering comeback of course not am trying work gee that is even dumber than the crap comebacks come up she could have told him go find knothole or something but will admit there was just one scene where was surprised at the outcome hint it involves the evil guy and miss crap comebacks as for the plot am still trying find one this movie was basically an excuse get boatload of people into dangerous territory where they could get snarfed ridiculous computergenerated anacondas the eyes and fangs of vipers and the fasterthangravity downward acceleration of harrier jet harrier snake not mention instant digestion so they could go snarf countless other victims the writers tried throw in some sort of plot twist should call it plot knot because it made no sense in the sick guys gfriend kisses concludes rydains diatribe on shameless exploitation and perpetuation of public fear of snakes comments flames anyone rydain the atomic cheese fresh from chernobyl dairies

this movie is written the man who is deemed be one of the hottest writers in he wrote the groundbreaking screenplay for scream then added the successful know what you did last summer script his mix and also created the popular tv series dawsons creek so when he asked direct his first movie based on his first ever script written everyone and their grandma said sure go for it uhhm my question is did anyone bother reading this stupid script plot ace student leigh ann watson is mistakenly caught some cheating papers the bitchiest teacher in the west mrs tingle and set lose her scholarship college when she and her friends visit the teacher at home in order explain their side of the story they end up tying her up and slowly trying talk some sense into the hardheaded woman critique it is not so much that this is bad movie than the fact that it sucks this movie is chockfull of onedimensional characters contains no actual humor that was able zone in on zero tension or thrills plot holes the size of my big ass lame pop tunes played mask nothing going on in the movie and molly ringwald vivica fox and lesley anne warren tossed away in throwaway roles was primed for this as its interesting premise had me thinking misery and but unfortunately for williamson he went nowhere the bright foundation making references the exorcist and dr zhivago doubt many in his target market will appreciate he also forgot about suspense all of his characters based on incomprehensible decisions unbelievable motivations and simply boring us all of their trite dialogue sure katie holmes is cute and her costar marisa coughlan did reasonably amusing impression of the exorcist worth two points out of my three on ten but how can we forgive the biggest onedimensional character in any holmes rival in the mrs tingles complete unprofessionalism being let go all others around her are teachers allowed behave that way nowadays and transparent romance between holmes and some longhaired dude hired be the poor mans version of skeet ulrich who himself is poor mans version of johnny depp all in all this movie was laughable for me provided me no insight into anything demonstrated williamsons genuine lack of directorial skills alongside juvenile script and provided helen mirren great role chew into unfortunately forgetting give her character any believability humanity or capacity comprehend no hip lines no cheap thrills just dull time at the movie theater if you want see funny teenage movie go see detroit rock city and thank my drunken sorry ass in the morning little known facts about this and its stars kevin williamsons father was fisherman kevin used his knowledge of fishing hooks and winches when creating the killer in know what you did last summer he is also huge fan of steven spielberg and coincidentally so is dawson leery on tvs dawsons creek show kevin created he was once an aspiring actor in fact he even landed bit part on tvs another world also williamson has gone on record say that an unsupportive english teacher who once told him that he would never amount anything was the inspiration for mrs tingle is also loosely based on the book killing mr griffin the writer of know what you did last summer lois duncan he has also come out and said that he is gay man helen mirren was born in london england under the name ilynea lydia mironoff she is married director taylor hackford whose works include devils advocate and an officer and gentleman this was originally titled killing mrs tingle but was changed after the columbine high school shooting incident actress marisa coughlan will star in kevin williamson next tv project called wasteland this is actor barry watson first full feature he has played the character of seth on tvs malibu shores several times

in typical cinematic high school the football jocks have sex the girls and then dump them but not before the boys scores are dutifully recorded in their little black books as the sexual acts take place the other guys hang out nearby guzzling beer and grunting like pigs in the rage carrie robert mandels terminally bland sequel carrie there is not single original moment only amy irving returns from carrie and the talent of the rest of the sequels cast is impossible determine given the stupefying mediocrity of rafael moreus script as rachel the horror storys lead emily bergl gives one of the least scary performances in recent memory but it is not exactly her fault the director asks for little from his actors is precisely what he gets sporadically in this lame and lifeless movie rachel will cause school lockers and windows fly open but generally she just mopes around looking like victim her fellow students delight in tormenting her of course she will get her revenge in the obligatory ending bloodbath in she will decapitate and castrate the boys and crush the girls burning timbers as the movie marks time until its big finale it throws in some repugnant scenes hoping turn audiences stomachs rachels girlfriend commits horrible and realistic suicide after the boy who made love her the night before spurns her he gets major points in his black book for this but his buddies say he would have gotten more if he had had sex her after her death even helpless puppy is run over and we see his poor little body flipping over and over under truck the teenagers in the movie are completely blas about it all does not it offend you that some girl offed herself yesterday asks one of the few kids conscience why responds his nonplussed girlfriend she was not anybody remarkably devoid of any energy especially for horror flick the movie makes one yearn for fast forward button on the theaters armrest material this bad the films only hope is go for parody but it is not smart enough realize it even the mandatory epilogue is as pointless and predictable as the rest of the movie the rage carrie runs it is rated for graphic violence teen alcohol abuse sex nudity and profanity and would be acceptable only for older teenagers

man this was one wierd movie similar conspiracy theory in that it could not decide genre it is the first hour is your standard stock aliens clone nicely created an eerie atmosphere about the ship the last half hour this was when the makers blew the script out the airlock and just decided screw it let us just kill everybody from then on forget scifi this movie becomes horror what really dissappointed me about this movie was that it tried scare you in entirely the wrong way instead of using clever tricks or trying build up scare this movie just uses loud noises sudden camera shifts and short quick bursts of gore yawn everyones seen it all before and knows when expect it the one thing that was done well was the lead up finding out about what happened the previous crew there are skeletons lying around mangled and mashed but what did this then finally after being painfully restored the new crew views the video the acting is not too bad at all considering what the actors had work anyway as there is no complex or interesting dialogue speak of there was some very nice camerawork in certain sequences though like when the hull near the bridge of the event horizon is breached and the camera pans back follow specific objects as they bounce across the deck and are sucked out into space this movie could have been so much better it had good experienced cast who deserved more work there was just nothing new here that any of us have not seen before in aliens or hellraiser

the king and a warner brothers animated musical feature recycles the classic story of woman who challenges the heart of king obvious results when anna miranda richardson british schoolteacher travels saim educate the kings martin vidnovic children she learns that the king is treating his people unfairly and must say something the greedy ruler meanwhile the kings prime minister ian richardson the stereotypical villain plots overthrow the king taking the throne the last and most predictable main subplot deals the kings son allen hong and his love for servant tuptim armi arabe and how he conflicts his feelings and the ancient laws of saim not even the lone strong character of anna can save the unbelievably horrible waste of talent as the king and is problems could fill the blank pages of journal will only note the major difficulties for it would take pages elaborate on every detail the screenplay written arthur rankin peter bakalian jacqeline feather and david seidler is based upon the play written richard rodgers and oscar hammerstein has some of the worst dialogue written in within recent memory as every time the obnoxious king would shout etc etc etc would cringe literally speaking of cringing did quite bit of this during the rather short is classic display of terrible filmmaking besides the repetitive dialogue from the king on the whole the songs seem out of place and unlike the lyrics are unmagical the sole song is used cleverly is getting know you is used as anna shows the children the great outdoors they have never been exposed unlike disney animated features the king and is songs do not add the and are as uneffective as could be take the following scenario as an example as the sheer horror of the king and is music is at its worst you are being hunted dragon what do you do sing happy song martin vidnovic voices the king without effort or emotion you hear the saying two negatives do not make positive believe it the terrible dialogue that the king has along his awful voice track the king is completely unbelievable only shows mild signs of any personality and the only thing that changes in the king is that he says etc etc etc more and more as the progresses no personality at the beginning of the movie none at the end and where does this characters personality change hey thought anna was supposed change him is not that the whole plot the prime ministers hideous sidekick darrell hammond brings his share of cringes as well oh no another one of his teeth fell out hardyharhar he is supposed bring laughs for the kidlets but even at age five would have cringed while watching him the way this review is going you may think the reasoning for my hate for this is due not liking animated films hence why hate this movie because the king and is disgrace animation animated films such as the lion king and the prince of egypt are among my favorite movies of all time the animation team does design their share of well animated settings so this makes it easier take my mind off of the annoying king until realize that day and night switch back in fourth within seconds have not read the play or seen the oscar winning adaption but from what can tell the screenplay for the version completely butchers the play for the king and is never magical nor interesting if it was not for miranda richardson who voices anna feeling the king and could earn the title worst movie of the decade instead the king and will just go down as among the years worst the bottom line avoid this movie at all costs not even young children the target audience in this will enjoy it not the slightest bit

synopsis cromagnon ayla loses her mother an earthquake and escapes certain death lion reluctantly rescued neanderthal clan who likes have sex doggystyle ayla grows up become blond feminist supermodel who challenges the neanderthal patriarchy throwing rocks and giving birth without mate comments allow me state for the record that find daryl hannah an appealing presence in movies she proved quite charming as the intelligent astronomer in the romantic comedy roxanne and equally creepy as pris in the scifi classic blade runner the clan of the cave bear clearly tries capitalize on hannah as selling point the poster art bears striking closeup of hannah in tribal paint and the video box prominently features her name in lettering the same size as the title not even her starring role in this turkey unfortunately can save it from being an unbelievable exercise in cheese it is so uniquely bad dealing prehistoric man that actually tries and miserably fails be serious that it is oddly fascinating the ridiculous attempt at drama here leaves the audience somehow transfixed wanting see how this dud plays out the clan of the cave bear is based upon popular novel jean auel this day the book possesses loyal cult following remember dear friend of mine had dogeared copy of the novel she had read as child all the socalled dirty parts blacked out marker her grandmother have never read this book but sure hope it is times better than its adaptation if not then am at complete loss explain its popularity the clan of the cave bear immediately opens comically absurd scene young ayla looking much like drew barrymore in t tramps about in the woods her cute little ponytails and fur wrapped about her the audiences expectations of convincing portrayal of prehistory are immediately shattered what follows is laughably choreographed sequence in an earthquake swallows up aylas mother blonde fur pants er leggings tearful ayla looks on as the cameraman shakes the camera well as the earthquake slowly recedes hungry lion becomes interested in her for lunch but the screaming sixyearold manages outrun the king of the wild and find safe haven will not detail the story any further this seems enough illustrate my point this movie is really stupid it never even gives the audience chance suspend their disbelief also the obvious comparison between the appearance of cromagnon man in prehistory and the rise of feminism in our century is about as subtle as burning wonderbra in front of charlton heston the movie does not just suggest this message it whacks the message into the audience twobyfour blond gorgeous woman challenges the social laws of bunch of people in gaudy brown wigs she is of the new people they are of the old people the memories yep we get it we get it the clan of the cave bear apparently received an academy award nomination for best makeup surprises me the movie depends upon lot of makeup obviously but much of it is unconvincing as stated before daryl hannah is daryl hannah here she looks like she just stepped out of the shower all the time the rest of the characters have dark makeup of some sort smeared over them look like dirt the facepainting that is occasionally seen is perhaps the only notable work here in my mind this movie also suffers from its new age trappings maybe the music sounded lot more fresh or original during but now it sounds dated and cliched like poorly conceived elevator music add this the films fauxmysticism including spirit animals and dream visions and narrator who sounds like psychic you would expect hear on number and you get movie that has serious problems being serious the clan of the cave bear is rated though it is probably one of the most inoffensive offensive films have seen in quite while it contains several scenes of sex sans nudity the violence mostly consists of hunting scenes the funniest moment of the movie occurs when neanderthal in love ayla attempts rescue her from ferocious bear the bear bites his head off and the audience sees it rolling about although this may sound gratuitous am sure it is so cheesy that it probably will not bother most people the clan of the cave bear is bad movie however as wrote at the beginning of this review it does have the distinction of originality typically when think of bottomofthebarrel films dealing early man fantasy movies involving dinosaurs who did not exist at the same time as man and raquel welch come mind the clan of the cave bear tries so hard be serious that though it is so bad the audience is still interested the unique setting and characters of the movie is why awarded this turkey two stars have think that fans of the book would be disappointed this version however am only basing this observation on the fact that the book is almost invariably better than the movie shudder think that it could be otherwise

salaries of top actors are getting obscenely large these days and many find this be the main reason for skyrocketing movie budgets actors who demand such salaries might be greedy but in some instances they are quite justified because many films would never be watched or even made without their participation proof for that can be found even in the realm of lowbudget movies and one fine example is breakaway thriller directed sean dash and starring in famous figure skater tonya harding face of tonya harding is most prominently featured on movies poster but the main star of the is terri thompson who plays myra attractive woman who works as courier for gangster one day she decides retire but her employers are anything but enthusiastic about that realising that her life suddenly became worthless myra starts running for her life followed professional assassins terri thompson being the actual star of the instead of tonya harding becomes quite understandable after the scenes that feature former figure skater although tonya harding displays convincing martial arts abilities her acting leaves much be desired on the other hand her disappointing efforts are hardly out of place in the that lacks originality believable characters and situations and actually represents anything that gave bfilms bad name martin sheens brother joe estevez whose character looks like he had entered from another movies set is the only bright spot of breakaway unfortunately he appears in this too little too late prevent viewers from realising why tonya hardings silver screen debut proved be her last

movies like six days seven nights make me mad because talented people like harrison ford anne heche and ivan reitman put lot of hard work in script worth about ten cents the script was written michael browning and he decided that instead of thinking up new ideas he would rehash lot of cliches omit even the slightest bit of character development and then throw in drugdealing pirates provide for few highlevel action sequences and explosions there are good scripts out there that highprofile actors can make see the truman show for instance six days seven nights is simply waste let us see we have get harrison ford and anne heche alone on an island so how do we do that well we will make her feisty magazine editor and we will make him crusty old pilot but wait she has have fianc that can be david schwimmer but wait if she has fianc how will she and harrison ford crash on the island alone know they will get their vacation spot and then she will get called back yessssss so they will crash on the island and that will be funny for about five minutes shucks oh have got it we will throw in distracting subplot in her fianc has sex really attractive woman who acts like bimbo and then he can feel guilty then when anne heche kisses harrison ford they have kiss because otherwise nobody will want see the movie it will be vindicated action because her fianc will already have cheated on her then for no obvious reason they will accidentally run into pirates who try kill them oh yes feel so good about this story instead of using characterization propel the events it will be completely random and yet totally predictable imagine that do not get me wrong six days seven nights is not boring picture ford and heche both do great job the sparks fly between them and so most of brownings inane dialogue is drowned out the actors sheer force of talent almost every scene between them has energy that the performers bring the screen and found myself laughing pretty hard schwimmer is also funny and manages milk all of his scenes for whatever he can get and reitman who has made some good films at least tries make things exciting even though the pirate subplot is profoundly dumb was prepared be pleasantly sidetracked the action sequences it is just when start think about the story that my contempt for this surfaces the picture feels like it is been hacked pieces would not be surprised if five or six inept subplots have been edited out completely the ones that are here are as bad as they come think let out very audible groan when they get the first glimpse of the pirate ships and would just like shake the producers the shoulders and scream why did you pick this awful script the is outright stupid but some of the elements are subtly horrifying for instance take the subplot in the schwimmer character has sex the bimbo and then feels really guilty this is serious problem in real life but six days seven nights reduces any chance of complexity weak plot device his actions are what makes it okay for heche kiss ford in script that lacks even glimpse of intelligent subtlety find it odd that such strangely insulting device ended up in the story this is summer movie season but that does not mean our movies have be dumb so far has been one of the worst years in recent memory for summer blockbusters when was in line for six days seven nights heard the woman in front of me ask for two tickets that new harrison ford movie why did not she know the name of the suppose she just did not care what bothers me even more is that the people who make these bigbudget pictures do not realize that their films are becoming parodies of themselves good actors should sign good scripts and if insists on making flicks rake in cash they least they could do is assume that we would like spend our money on story worth more than ten cents

if anything stigmata should be taken as warning against releasing similarlythemed films relatively close one another of the four supernatural horror flicks released this year it is clearly the worst suppose should have seen this coming after all blair witch thoroughly creeped me out sixth sense was mildly spooky and then stir of echoes had its moments but was not anything would lose sleep over clearly the quality of the horror this summer has slowly been dropping is it then any surprise that stigmata is the dullest most horribly executed piece of mtvinfluenced tripe have seen in long while no not really patricia arquette plays frankie page hairdresser from pittsburgh who receives rosary as gift from her globetrotting mother as it turns out the rosary belonged recentlydeceased brazilian priest the priests church had been under investigation father andrew kiernan gabriel byrne because of the mysterious appearance of bleeding statue father kiernan is an investigator who has made career
