out of disproving supposed religious signs but this time he believes there is something the bleeding statue his investigation is soon called off however when the frankie starts exhibiting signs of the stigmata in person is inflicted wounds like that of jesus christ father kiernan is initially skeptical of frankie story considering she is an atheist but once he witnesses the stigmata attacks himself he dedicates himself finding out what is going on he eventually begins suspect that his boss cardinal houseman jonathan pryce is concealing something that could bring down the catholic church as it turns out the dead priest had been working on the translation of fifth gospel before they were excommunicated the new rupert wainwright music video mean stigmata is the sort of that starts off ok and only gets worse indeed it would have been good if it were music video because it is only interesting for about five minutes am not sure what wainwright is trying prove his endless parade of slowmotion doubleexposure and extreme closeups whoaaaaaa other than the fact that he has the most swelled head of any director in and yes he has been school his camera trickery is interesting for little while but eventually it becomes headacheinducing what this needed is second audio track be played over the dialogue such as it is wainwright screaming at the audience see look at what can do am an excellent director maybe then he would explain why he decided start half of his scenes slowmotion shots of water dripping in reverse or why he included random superfluous shots as that of an egg frying ooh scary if there was some underlying meaning behind all this camera trickery did not see it just when you thought it was safe get involved in the story here comes doubleexposure shot of two patricia arquettes collapsing into bed for no reason whatsoever arrrrrrrghhhh then again the superfluous camera trickery would not bother me if stigmata had story or characters that were remotely engaging though wainwrights vanity certainly does not help he does seem have been given nearly unworkable script where are plot continuity and character development when you need them case in point frankie page is the character that assume we are supposed identify and sympathize but we are not given any back story on her character or any reason like her the extent of her character development seems be that she is hardworking hairdresser who can somehow afford cavernous apartment on the top floor of her building and she is kind of cute so let us start the bleeding the fact that she is clearly not the brightest bulb in the drawer does not help either according frankie page what is the first thing do after receiving mysterious wounds on your wrists and back go clubbing sure that makes sense arquette byrne and pryce give it the old college try but their characters are so onedimensional that they just appear be sleepwalking scenes between arquette and byrne that were probably supposed be sexually charged fall almost embarrassingly flat because the setup of the romantic subplot is so clumsily handled that it almost reaches the point of becoming laughable even though frankie pages life is falling apart before her very eyes she still finds the time hit on priest who wanders in her hair salon even more curiously he seems be interested in her advances father andrews religious doubt pops up so suddenly that it seems more silly than dramatic as for pryce he may as well wear curled mustache and cackle will get you my pretty for all the depth his cardinal houseman is afforded trust me am not revealing anything telling you pryce turns out be villain what is worse after being faced dull characters and the prospect of having annoying camera tricks and loud music jammed down our throats we now have contend story that starts off in one direction veers off in another then another and ends up being totally incomprehensible first of all the does not even bother explain what should be very simple plot details how does frankie get the stigmata merely touching rosary how come an atheist like her was chosen since father andrew mentions that only very devout believers have ever received stigmata actually am not sure what frankie was posessed supposedly stigmata occurs when one is posessed the holy spirit but the later has her being posessed the dead priest and later some evil spirit think one is it the answer this question of course is very simple the possessing entity in each scene is determined whichever effects and flashy camera work mr wainwright wants use this time furthermore the ending is ridiculously neat little wrapup and the filmmakers compound this problem ultimately turning the into diatribe against the catholic church if you do any research at all about the gospel of st thomas you will find that it is not being suppressed the church as the seems claim but that it is readily available at your local library there is nothing the catholics need worry about though stigmatas religion is so offbase that it cannot be confused for anything remotely resembling the real catholic church if they wanted portray catholic priests as mobsters they should have gone allout and equipped them sharkskin suits and tommy guns would have been far more interesting am not catholic in fact don care much for the catholic church but its cartoonish misrepresentation in this should not be considered realistic any means it is rare see that fails on as many levels as stigmata does it not thoughtprovoking though it would like be and it is definitely not scary though it pretends be am not sure why they tried pass this off as horror because there is absolutely nothing scary about the story maybe it is an attempt cover up the fact that none of the scenes have any dramatic weight whatsoever the initial shock of seeing arquette covered blood is dulled the fact that it happens over and over and over like so many films of the mtv generation this one suffers from overkill so much is overdone in stigmata that it eventually has no effect on the audience leaving us pick out the films many flaws am also still trying figure out why the quotation they take from the gospel of st thomas is so earthshattering when we finally hear it the saying sounds like something every fiveyearold learns on their first day of sunday school means that for all its flash the whole is really much ado about nothing the dog days of summer usually produce one monstrous dog and stigmata is it

john boormans zardoz is goofy cinematic debacle so fundamentally misconceived and laughably executed that it takes on bizarre enjoyment quality all its own not since the rampant bumblings of one edward wood jr has movie been so silly and so serious at the same time of course woods career can be explained two things he had no money and he had no talent boorman on the other hand cannot court such excuses explain zardoz or his followup the equally awful exorcist ii the heretic boorman obviously had sizable budget matinee idol movie star sean connery in the lead role and although you would not know it from this boorman does indeed have talent this is the man who made the slick modern masterpiece deliverance as well as the autobiographical world war ii drama hope and glory the slightly overconceived arthurian epic excalibur and the fatherson jungle adventure the emerald forest his films all show that boorman is never lacking in imagination but sometimes that comes at the cost of coherence and taste if boorman is anything he is ambitious and when he succeeds it is in grand fashion unfortunately the bigger they are the harder they fall and when boorman falls the resounding impact can be heard for miles around zardoz is meant takes its place among the grandest of mystical movies an obsession of boormans his screenplay tries elicit the same mythological connotations of the arthurian legends or even the wizard of oz book figures into the movies plot but despite all this reaching the resulting movie is more unintentionally funny than intentionally enigmatical or compelling the events take place in the distant year but there is little of the typical futuristic movieness be found in fact things seems have moved backwards people riding horses shooting oldstyle guns and living in large victorian mansions it is more middle ages than space age the world of zardoz is divided into two distinct hemispheres the outlands where all the poor pathetic people live and the vortex where select group of wealthy intellectuals live in comfort and everlasting life these immortals never grow old they never engage in sexual activity they possess psychological powers and they live in sort of quasiutopian marxist society where everyone is equal and everyone contributes equally the society however if one breaks the rules that person is punished being aged so many years if someone breaks the rules enough he or she is aged the point of senility and imprisoned an eternal existence in geriatric home others aged criminals one of the immortals arthur frayn niall buggy squirmy man mustache and goatee tattooed on his face is charged keeping order in the outlands and forcing the residents farm so the immortals can be fed like the wizard of oz he adopts godlike status among the people flying in their part of the world in giant stone carved like menacing head this flying head is one of the movies opening images and it is dead giveaway of the lunacy come calling himself zardoz frayn gathers bunch of outlanders and makes them into group called the exterminators whose purpose is kill most of the other outlanders so they cannot procreate and take up more resources from inside his giant stone head zardoz bellows seriously laughinducting statements like the gun is good the penis is evil that line alone is worth the movies cult following one day an exterminator named zed sean connery sneaks into zardozs flying stone pushes frayn out and goes back the vortex once there the immortals label him brutal and study him like lab rat taking great perverse care in exploring his sexuality is mystery them they seem especially interested in his ability gain an erection and there is one downright hilarious sequence where bunch of scantilyclad female scientists show zed erotic footage on video screen in an attempt determine what gets him worked up say hilarious because that is exactly what zardoz is it is obvious that boorman did not intend it be so he made this the straightest of faces although have hard time believing that as production moved forward he did not get even the slightest inkling of how patently ridiculous it was becoming just looking at connery is enough give one the giggles he spends most of the running around in red loin cloth that resembles diaper mane of hair braided halfway down his back wyatt earpstyle handlebar mustache and pair of thighhigh patent leather boots that would look more appropriate on cheap hooker boorman made the right after the critical and financial success of deliverance is the only reason can imagine studio would greenlight this effort he attracted some rich talent on both sides of the camera including cinematographer geoffrey unsworth whose striking visuals are about the only good thing in zardoz besides the inadvertent humor sean connery had made his last james bond in and perhaps he was looking for change in pace he got exactly that in zardoz and it is wonder it did not end his career am sure boorman intended for this movie make some grand statements is it treatise about the infallibility of eternal life is it condemnation of those who consider growing old be bad thing or is it social statement something about the inherent negativity of class distinctions and the violence it creates karl marx might like it if he were more like timothy leary come think of it maybe boorman made it as an extended lsd trip people high on illicit substances are the only ones can imagine enjoying this asinine silliness as anything more than completely unintentional comedy

the kids in the hall are an acquired taste it took at least season of watching their show on hbo before became believer maybe after watching half dozen kids in the hall movies they would grow into the big screen my recommendation is that unless you are big fan of the kids skip the as it is their firstand most likely onlyattempt at full length lacks the qualities that made their comedy work on tv bigbudget and glossy production can not make up for lack of spontaneity that permeates their tv show the kids go through the motions but you get the feeling that they arent really having fun doing so and this makes it more difficult for the audience enjoy their antics brain candy is bunch of skits tied together the story of pharmaceutical company that develops new drug cure depression in typical sketchcomedy tradition each actor plays several roles doctor cooper kevin mcdonald and his team create the drug then under pressure from don roritor mark mckinney founder and president of roritor pharmaceuticals dr cooper releases the drug into the marketplace the ensuing distribution of the new happy pill throughout the populace drives the rest of the at about minutes brain candy still seems long the best thing about sketch comedyand the kids are no exceptionis the ability quickly deliver the laughs then go on another quick skit but the additional setup necessary in telling longer coherent story the laughs just dont come fast enough strangely the show is even more tame than it was when on cable tv the movie makes several attempts at risquenessmostly pointing up the gayness of one of scott thompsons charactersbut they seem almost forced as if they have live up pg rating one of the best bits though does make use of thompsons naked buttocks we see him charging into battlegoing have sex some guys taking shower in the classic of this genre monty python pulled off this delicate balancing act between plot advancement and punchline delivery for most of the holy grail the kids unfortunately are not up the task there are some amusing moments be sure but not enough make the experience an enjoyable one

there was time when john carpenter was great horror director of course his best was masterpiece halloween but he also made the fog and underrated prince of darkness heck he even made good in in the mouth of madness but something terribly wrong happened him in the terrible comedy memoirs of an invisible man somehow carpenter has lost his touch junk like his failed remake of village of the damned his uninspired sequel escape from a those movies however look like cinematic works of art compared his latest john carpenters vampires if was him definately would not want put my own name in the title it is sad state of affairs when carpenter can make something as misguided and flatly written and filmed as vampires the story is simple jack crow james woods is vampire hunter who along one of his partners montoya daniel baldwin and prostitute katrina sheryl lee survives an attack from the master vampire valek thomas ian griffith since katrina was previously bitten him crow takes her along because anyone who is bitten valek becomes telepathically linked him until they themselves turn into vampires couple days later and crow is hoping find him the help of her it seems valeks mission is steal black wooden cross from roman catholic church that will enable him become so powerful that sunlight will not destroy him my question is how many time have we seen this same story played out well the answer is just about as many times as better version of the story has been made john carpenters vampires sadly enough is one of the most unscary horror films have ever seen in fact there is not even one suspenseful moment in the whole minute running time the nonstop vampire attack sequences are stylelessly filmed without any interesting camera work is usually trademark of carpenters and then we come the screenplay as far as can tell is nearly nonexistent there is no story development and there is not even an attempt flesh out the characters james woods can be good actor but he has nothing do here but say couple of pseudo clever lines of dialogue daniel baldwin has some potential but his character comes off as being very dense and sheryl lee faring much better as laura palmer in twin peaks like all of the female characters plays an offensive stereotypical whore there is not an ounce of intelligence or excitement in john carpenters vamires is very disheartening coming from an exfan of carpenters he has said that he turned down directing halloween because he could not work up any excitement for it and yet when asked about vampires sequel he said he would be happy do it think that is definite sign that carpenter has finally lost any trace of his lasting talent not mention significant number of iq points

two party guys bob their heads haddaways dance hit what is love while getting themselves into trouble in nightclub after nightclub it is barely enough sustain threeminute _saturday_night_live_ skit but _snl_ producer lorne michaels _clueless_ creator amy heckerling and paramount pictures saw something in the late night television institutions recurring roxbury guys sketch that would presumably make good feature emphasis on the word presumably _a_night_at_the_roxbury_ takes an alreadythin concept and tediously stretches it far beyond the breaking pointand that of viewers patience levels the first five minutes or so of _roxbury_ play very much like one of the original roxbury guys skits what is love blaring on the soundtrack the brotherly duo of doug and steve butabi chris kattan and will ferrell bob their heads scope out hotties at clubs and then bump select few violent pelvic thrusts there is one crucial difference howeverthese guys speak that little fact has been used as justification for the films existence that the butabis newfound capacity for speech would open up whole new set of doors for the characters the doors opened director john fortenberry and screenwriters steve koren ferrell and kattan are new that is for sure but they all lead comic dead ends there is no story per se only loosely structured and linked series of subplots the brothers literally run into or rather get run into as in car richard grieco of __jump_street_ fame and through him they gain entrance into the exclusive roxbury club there they meet hotshot club owner chazz palminteri conspicuously uncreditedcan you blame him who takes an interest in an idea of theirs meanwhile the bros overbearing father dan hedaya wants them stop clubbing when doug refuses and the dimwitted steve obeys his father rift is created between the two the narrative messiness of _roxbury_ would have been forgivable if all that went on were the slightest bit funny but virtually none of it is the assembled press audience mostly sat stonily silent throughout the entire the one big exception being big laugh near the end alas the jokea rather lazy takeoff on _jerry_maguire_will only strike chord people who have seen that granted lot of people _have_ seen _jerry_maguire_ but the fact that the films best joke is completely dependent on ones familiarity another says lot about _roxbury_s lack of inspiration that lack of inspiration can be traced back the insipid characters themselves like too many of the skits on the current incarnation of _saturday_night_live_ the roxbury guys is onejoke sketch that never once suggests that the characters have enough comic life in them survive outside of the sketch context after watching one of the roxbury skits on snl this is what you come away from the characters they bob their heads what is love bump unsuspecting women and that is all after watching _a_night_at_the_roxbury_ you will be left exactly the same

in ship set sail on her maiden voyage across the atlantic for america this ship was built be the largest ship in the world and she was she was also build be one of the most luxurious and that she was finally she was built be unsinkable and that unfortunately she was not get ticket for this voyage you either spent lifes savings get america start life anew were part of the upper class and had the money spare or finally were lucky enough have full house in poker match the docks like jack dawson jack dawson makes the trip and happens be at the right place at the right time rose dewitt bukater first class passenger climbs the railings at the aft of the ship thoughts of jumping thus is started tale of romance and intrigue and tale of death and tragedy this movie is about tragic event that took place great many years ago an even that should not be taken lightly as any other bit of historical trivia the movie titanic shows what happened maybe not degree of accuracy but it still shows it very realisticaly now the titanic is both story on its own and backdrop for story it serves as both admirably brining forth an interesting story that although simple in its most simple premise is very captivating this movie is very emotional simply because of what it is but that alone is not enough the story is brought out certain style that makes is so much more emotional and so much more effective movies such as this will not be forgotten all too quickly and unfortunately then are not something that is produced any great frequency the attention detail that was paid is remarkable the whole premise for the telling of the story is interesting the showing of brand new footage from the wreck of the titanic adding much flavor an already good movie part of the magical chemistry behind this story is the acting and for this movie its extremely good acting from the whole cast the performances put in the main stars is something be admired the characters were played out so memorably that both leonardo dicaprip and kate winslet should receive at the least nominations for their roles looking at the acting done in the movie it seems as if they are not acting but are actually the characters in the movie the casting for the movie could really have been better in my humble opinion that is one character that will most likely not be mentioned any other review or commentary about this is that of the ship itself yes you read correctly the ship is character how is the titanic character you ask well simple ship had certain character about it and as most sailors and boats men will tell you this character is everything about the ship from its specifications its luxuries and the titanic was no stranger this mr cameron brings the ship life in an almost literal sense all this adds the movie in certain way that most productions cant seem grasp now produce the effect that mentioned above and sink the ship itself are feats that are accomplished special effects wizards the effects in this movie range from marvelous costumes beautifully rendered scenes of the ships sinking in some respects you cannot tell that the effects are there you simply think that what you see is what happened or what is happening if your imagination is good the technical wizardry done in this movie is just spectacular and actually getting new footage from the wreck of the titanic is unique the movie will leave you amazed at the effects and that is feat since there is no monsters or aliens in this movie just humans and an oversized ship the movie will amaze you and it will pull on your emotions the theater that went had few people leaving tears in their eyes now that is not feat accomplished most movies now the fact that the tragedy actually occurred is brought home something of punch wont spoil the ending and say what happens regardless it is an interesting movie from beginning the very end the historical value of this movie is quite high and honestly is something that should be watched for the sake of seeing it and seeing the tragedy for it is extremely well done the method of telling the story is also good maybe not totally unique but effective none the less regardless of anything mentioned above this movie is grandiose production and the sheer size of the project undertaken is something be marveled at the simple fact that the movie is smashingly successful at what it aims achieve is just astonishing if you get the chance see this movie go it might not be the best movie in the world but it ranks fairly highly and is well worth the time spent watching it during none of the hours and minutes of the movie are you bored nor does your attention wane from the movie

the start of this movie reminded me of parts from the movie stargate people are looking around in an egyptian temple reading about some dangerous thing that is going destroy earth in the future after sort of confusing bit involving fakelooking cyborg things the movie jumps into the future and the movie improves leaps and bounds the basic idea behind the movie is that every once in while make that every years or so an evil force comes destroy earth the things needed defend against this menace are the four elements of nature plus the fifth element the plot in this movie really is not that important the thing though this movie has very good special effects for the most part the technoish music in the background fits the mood very well bruce willis is an illegal taxicab driver in futuristic new york city one day lady draped few bandages drops down into his trunk this movie is about what happens the plot twists are interesting and the movie never fails present the viewer variety of different locations also there is fair bit of action in the particularly towards the end some characters are just plain strange including highlyenergetic deejay in drag bruce willis does his normal job of blowing things away like he always does the movie is definitely watchable and rarely slows down it is one of those scifi films where you will be saying cool followed what the hell give the fifth element

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned james tobacks return directing after eightyear layoff two girls and guy is is comprised more or less of just that one guy blake robert downey jr two girls carla heather graham and lou natasha gregson wagner one primary setting blakes absurdly spacious bachelor apartment and great deal of dialogue embracing near realtime approach this is highly theatrical feature that completely hangs upon the performances of its three actors and the quality of the dialogue written mr toback for his bantering characters fortunately the films cast is up the challenge and the wordy exchanges between the triad of characters while admittedly variable are occasionally wickedly amusing the films setup is fairly generic in nature and opens rather unpromisingly we meet selfpossessed blonde carla and feisty brunette lou both waiting outside soho loft as they engage in idle chatter it is revealed that they are both waiting for their respective boyfriends return from the airport and it does not take long for them come the realisation that they are being twotimed the same guy more indignant him than catty each other the duo break into blakes loft and await his arrival for confrontation it is when blake returns his abode where the hits its stride played magnificent bombast mr downey jr blake is cad all right but captivatingly dynamic blusterous and stealthy piece of work that bursts onto the scene and raises the stakes new heights it is fascinating watch this character in his natural habitat and perhaps the films best choice was have his two girlfriends scamper off into hiding upon his return allowing us size up blake not his interactions others but his own innate behaviour whether he is flamboyantly behind his piano in rollicking rendition of vivaldi or on the phone leaving messages his beloveds carla lou and his unseen sickly mother it is never less than wildly entertaining and insightful though at this point almost hoped the would transform into oneman show typical afternoon in the life of blake if you will carla and then lou reveal themselves and the sparks begin fly one of the great touches in the is how blake when startled carlas unannounced appearance begins both verbally and physically backpedal even before he realizes that the cats out of the bag doubleteamed the understandably aggrieved women who are more smirkingly inquisitive than ferociously vengeful they want justification for his ongoing hypocrisy an increasinglyflustered blake weakly defends himself apologetic and even selfrighteous declarations against their verbal jabs surprisingly delightful in the waltz of scathing witty banter shared its trio of characters two girls and guy concludes its first sequence an unexpected apoplectic act of such outrageous audacity that it seemed nothing was offlimits for this however it would be unfeasible attempt string along carla and lous outrage full featurelength and it is as the movie gradually transforms into the sharing of exploratory profundities on the nature of fidelity and relationships that it slowly but surely begins unravel the dialogue becomes less and less engaging and clever the films tempo loses its liveliness the dynamic between the characters evolves in unconvincing fashion and several sequences fall flat subtle and notquitesubtle allusions are made poster of jules et jim hangs prominently on the wall and secrets are revealed barrel the toward an uncompelling weepy finale one key turning point in the is the kinky sex scene between blake and carla two girls and guy was embroiled in bitter longrunning dispute the mpaa regards this scene contractuallyobligated deliver an rrated mr toback was forced resubmit fourteen scaleddown versions of the steamy interlude before the mpaa withdrew their nc rating in favour of an and while admittedly titillating the net effect of the vignette on the films thematic narrative is rather dubious if anything two girls and guy serves as showcase for the phenomenal talents of mr downey jr whose versatility is put the test in this he plays the gamut from indignant humbled from selfassured disconcerted yet his acting gears shift so smoothly as not be registered it is wonderful performance in role customtailored for him mr toback wrote the screenplay in four days shortly after mr downey jr was arrested on drug charges and it is hard not see echoes of reality seeping into his character in monologue his mirrored reflection blakes selfchiding get his shit together is disquieting in its resonance while mr downey jr showstopping performance is undoubtedly the primary strength of the both actresses are solid in more broadlyobserved roles ms graham is quickly becoming one of americas more daring actresses involving herself in three successive risky projects two girls and guy and boogie nights are both quite sexually frank while lost in space has screenplay penned akiva goldsman she is quite appealing here playing character at once both dainty and sultry meanwhile ms gregson wagner initially portrays lou such an unwarranted spunk that audiences are likely find it either annoying or like me endearing she tones it down substantially as the progresses but found her more fun watch as the artificially excitable chatterbox the was reportedly shot in eleven days filmed mostly in sequence and the resultant artifacts of this rapid shoot are evident throughout two girls and guy has an agile spontaneous sort of feel and one senses that mr toback encouraged good deal of improvisation from his three actors while the could be transposed directly the stage more or less intact it does not feel constricted the expansive apartment setting is wellused vary the background and mr toback allows his camera wander and linger on his characters in an effective manner two girls and guy falls short of its potential but thanks some stellar work mr downey jr it is still often an enjoyable bitingly funny romp particularly as we watch the surprisinglyresilient blake evasively try rationalize his behaviour and even turn the tables on his girlfriends am an actor he tells them at one point using the ol triedandtested occupationalhazard defense actors lie but not they all seem agree denzel washington

robert altmans cookies fortune is that rare movie that does not depend on sentimentality be uplifting and make its viewers feel good it is sunny delightful dreamy comedy filled lovely performances skillful direction and topped off an understated clever extraordinary script as this is an ensemble piece it is forced start of slowly as it introduces us its characters all of them residing in southern town called holly springs first we meet willie charles dutton an honest man slight drinking habit we then see that willie takes care of an elderly lady nicknamed cookie who is slowly losing her grip on sanity and is being filled loneliness despair and want of her dead husband we cut camille glenn close who is obsessively directing play her sister cora julianne moore then we briefly get acquainted emma liv tyler an apparent relative of cookie who is downbutnotout teen outcast still full of love and hope even though she has no real place live we also fleetingly see emmas lover jason chris odonnell an ambitious but far too excitable young cop we are now about one quarter through the two hour picture and robert altman decides that it is time set the plot in motion we see the ecstatic cookie stare hopefully at picture of her husband she exclaims here come and then puts pillow her face and shoots herself soon after her niece camille stops get fruit salad bowl comes upstairs finds cookie dead and flips out convinced that suicide is disgrace and that she will have none of that in her family she eats the suicide note and convinces her slightly slow yet sweet sister that it was murder she makes sure that she stages it like murder as well scattering jewelry all over the floor breaking few cabinets windows and doors and then throwing the gun out in the back yard the only reasonable suspect is willie who immediately gets taken into custody and put in jail cell they all know he did not do it so the cell stays open and he plays scrabble the sheriff and the faithful emma meanwhile the unperturbed camille continues her nonetoosubtle manipulations trying further cover up for the murder while at the same time making her easter play success so begins cookies fortune aptly described critic scott renshaw as southern spin on fargo except that this one is far funnier and much more enjoyable than the coen brothers darker somewhat disturbing and slightly overrated escapade robert altmans slight picture is in some ways reminiscent of something like midnight in the garden of good and evil as well in that both films focus on and off on the eccentricities of the residents in southern us town indeed most of the characters in cookies fortune are loads of fun observe and portion of them are fascinating and surprisingly multi dimensional glenn close turns in an insubstantial in terms of her career but magnificent performance as the conniving camille and is also the source of good portion of the many laughs that we enjoy in this movie and she is perfectly cast as the prolific aunt alexandria character endlessly obsessed family dignity the equally essential role of willie is handled an intangible grace veteran thespian charles dutton mimic time kill there is nothing like movie leaves you feeling all warm and fuzzy inside hours even days after the ends cookies fortune is such movie loved the light kindhearted approach altman whose last project was the dark intense drama the gingerbread man took towards the tricky subject matter enjoyed the talented ensemble cast even liked the trite in the south everybody is related everybody cliche that is inevitably employed the time this movie draws close am not sure why cookies fortune had such an allaround pleasing effect on me perhaps it is that good ol southern charm

well will be damned the canadians can make good movie the world is coming an end we do not know why or how but apparently there is no way stop it the world has had this information for months as most of the rioting and other assorted chaos has passed and governments have shut down operations yet for handful of toronto citizens life goes on they are not going crazy or attacking people in the streets instead they are simply preparing themselves for the end some engaging in activities they have always wanted do some gathering family and friends and others just seeking be alone these peoples lives however all intersect during their final six hours writerdirectorstar don mckellar has crafted highly unique and emotional all of the main characters are compelling as they try and do whatever it is they need do on their last night on earth craig callum keith rennie tries fulfill all his sexual fantasies gas company employee david cronenberg calls every customer letting them know the gas will be flowing until the very end and thanks them for their business and patrick mckellar just wants be himself but is not having much success even minor characters keep popping up where you least expect them tying everyone even closer things seemed little hokey towards the beginning of the but ultimately everything comes together nicely although it is not happy some moments are understandably gutwrenching the story is enhanced some unexpected humor and very realistic performances particularly from sandra oh whose character is just trying get home her husband before the end have absolutely no problem that the reason for the end of the world is never given nor does it bother me that the world is ending at exactly midnight in toronto anyway but do wonder why the sun never sets come midnight the sun is still shining brightly maybe the sun is crashing into the earth who knows also it is comforting know that in mankinds final moments on the planet people will still gang up on the street for the sheer purpose of pushing over car or bus that is not shot at this mind you know people are just stupid and truly would be out in the street tipping over cars last night is available on dvd from universal home video it contains the in fullscreen format and includes the original theatrical trailer r

hedwig john cameron mitchell was born boy named hansel in east berlin as teen seeking his other half he reluctantly agrees sex change operation in order marry american i luther maurice dean wint the operation performed hack surgeon is botched and the angry inch is all that is left now she hedwig comes america is abandoned luther forms rock band and falls for her year old loverprot tommy only be rejected him later too she and her band the angry inch shadows the nowfamous tommy gnosis across the us for revenge but hedwig is really in search of her lost other half in hedwig and the angry inch first time helmer john cameron mitchell along composerlyricist stephen trask created and starred in their acclaimed offbroadway production that has become the movie and quite movie it is in its eclectic variety of songs outrageous costumes sets and makeup and especially riveting performance mitchell as the title character mitchell and trask have reinvented the movie musical and couple it the underlying story of just whom hedwig is and what she is looking for am far not big fan of musicals sure there are exceptions like bob fosses all that jazz and cabaret but for the most part they are just not my cup of tea hedwig and the angry inch is an exception though its combination of humor wit and collection of tunes that covers musical styles ranging from the rocky horror picture show and meatloaf david bowie the sex pistols the original songs stephen trask also appearing as one of the members of the band the angry inch are full of energy and variety and even though it is not my kind of music found every one entertaining and fun the audience saw hedwig thought so too the main attraction this onemanwoman show is the presence of its star john cameron mitchell gives solid sometimes fun sometimes angry performance as person searching for selfenlightenment and love as young boy growing up in east berlin hansel is abused his i father and raised his german mother in tiny flat so small that mother would make me play in the oven where he listened pop music on armed forces radio later as young man he meets luther another i and is swept off of his feet the ensuing angry inch incident comes soon after flash forward trailer park in junction city kansas and luther is leaving hedwig for another boy frustrated and broke she takes on babysitting and the odd job make ends meet she also forms band four korean housewives and the musical talent of hedwig is born she meets falls for and loses young tommy who steals her songs and goes off become rock sensation jealous and angry hedwig and her new band begins campaign shadow tommys tours and the help of her manager phyllis stein andrea martin is trying get law suit going against the star for stealing her songs hedwig and the angry inch get gigs not coincidentally at chain of seafood restaurants that just happen be next the forums where tommy gnosis is playing things finally come head so speak in new york city the popularity of the offbroadway musical and its offshoots have garnered readymade audience base for hedwig the wit humor music and search for identity has great appeal young adults but the charismatic presence of mitchell makes this cut above what it could have been it is this onemanwoman show that casts its spotlight on its internationally ignored rock star and mitchell is outstanding in the role there is not lot going on other characters though there are amusing little sidebars like hedwigs backup singerlover yitzak miriam shor deciding break away from the band join polynesian road show of rent as puerto rican drag queen the low budget that the moviemakers have for the production belies the quality of the attention details hedwigs costumes and outrageous cabaret like makeup the seedy trailer park setting and the kitschy seafood restaurants are loads of fun watch and lend the appropriate air the proceeds all on what has be beer budget hedwig and the angry inch may not be for everybody but the energy of the effort the songs the imaginative sets and costumes and fast steady pace make it pleasure watch if you are fan of contemporary edgy music it is an even bigger draw give it b

niagara niagara bob gosses niagara niagara follows blueprint not unlike lot of youngloversontheroad movies wild marcy robin tunney and calm seth henry thomas meet cute literally running into each other while shoplifting at local store mere couple of scenes later the two embark on journey toronto from their small unnamed american town in pursuit of rare doll that marcy desperately wants along the way true love inevitably blossoms what sets niagara niagara apart though is that marcy is afflicted tourettes syndrome neurological disorder that causes sudden muscle and vocal tics tunney displaying an acting range not hinted at in the teenage witch thriller the craft delivers an astonishing performance that won her the best actress prize at last years venice festival term her work tourdeforce is not imply that she attacks the scenery tunneys effectiveness lies in her modulation and vulnerability makes her depiction of marcys illnesswhich often causes her act violentlythat much more convincing and tragic she and the nicely subtle thomas develop sweetly innocent and beguilingly offkilter chemistry their journey hits few rough spots creatively along the way mostly the fault of writer matthew weiss detour involving kindly widower michael parks who takes the couple in brings the story screeching halt and the key character of triggerhappy pharmacist stephen lang is highly unbelievable but these missteps do not blunt the power of tunneys bravura turn carries niagara niagara level of poignance it would not have otherwise achieved opens march did not know what expect it is like something you chase for so long but then you do not know how react when you get it still do not know how react michael jordan on winning his first nba championship in or my thoughts after meeting him on november

notice this is review and analysis of exotica the first part of this piece is the review the second part contains some analysis of the movie might be construed as spoilers if you have not seen the movie and after reading the first part you intend do so then save the second part for the discussion afterwards starring bruce greenwood mia kirshner elias kosteas don mckellar arsinee khanijian sarah polley director atom egoyan screenplay atom egoyan exotica is that grows on retrospection exotica keeps the viewer guessing about the relationship between the various characters in the all of the people know each other but apart from that there seems be no other reason why select such set and follow them in this fictional account the director hints for possible solutions using multiline plot so popular critics in mystery train and used good advantage quentin tarantino in pulp fiction exotica reaches whole new dimension using this technique at the end it is surprising see how well the pieces of the puzzle fit together in spite their apparent unconnectedness and even misleading features the outofchronologicalorder technique has become ever so popular perhaps even de rigueur for biographical films similarly we can now expect see more movies in the future will use varying extent converging multiplots on first glance once the multiplot puzzle in exotica is solved there seems be little left look at but perceptive minds take the time dig further will be rewarded interesting views on life or rather commentaries on views of life exotica is very much worth seeing it opened critics praise worldwide first saw it in mexico city last december in canada it broke records for movie of its kind prompted the american distributor go for wide release apart from strong plot acting is very convincing and the soundtrack seems as if made for the movie the spoonfedentertainment crowd may not appreciate this movie and thus it might last little on screen but if you want try movie cut above the crowd an originality that is ever so rare all means see exotica analysis spoilers ahead what is behind the complex plot in exotica first common theme of the quest for gratification monetary means the lone taxauditor the repressed homosexual pet shop owner the pregnant woman runs the nightclub the rich man has the club remodeled the audience at the movie theatre all use personal wealth buy palliative relief for the penuries of the soul then we have the quest for gratification through visual means most of the same people including those who sit watching exotica in that regard exotica stands for onlookers at nightclub for the rich man looking through silver mirrors and poorrich people looking at others people lives through silver screen exotica also stands for unwanted society attention into the lives of other people such as the tax auditor and the pet shop owner exotica is the customer agent looking at the pet shop owner in turn is looking at the core of the problems between the strip dancer and the tax auditor through the detached eye of gay person no attraction the strip dancer and only interested on avoiding jail no personal relationship the tax auditor in exotica everybody is watching and what is worse everybody knows second exotica is about isolated people holding back their feelings about people voluntary or involuntary means transfer their view of reality other characters the strip dancer becomes the proverbial daughter the dj becomes the proverbial killer means of breaking the relationship between the father and the proverbial daughter the niece becomes the baby sitter the baby sitter becomes the dancer and the dancer becomes the proverbial daughter the pet shop owner becomes the proverbial dj finding the proverbial daughter chain made of real and imagined links coming around full circle just as everything comes around fitting whole at the end of the movie

i actually am fan of the original or so liveactiondisney flick of the same name starring hayley mills twice as pair of twins separated at birth divorcing parents never come in contact the other so the parents never have meet again and everyone should know how feel about remakes especially of films happen enjoy my fallacy unless you are going either capture the same exact spirit of the original or do something different it or maybe even both just wrack your brain and come up gasp new idea this remake was not originally on the top of my viewing list and was actually quite the opposite contemporary liveactiondisney films are not one of my favorties anyway they are usually unfunny alienating and big fat bore at least anyone over the age of and above the iq of this one however is shockingly not bad in fact it is actually good not the original good but what is great about it is that it does not necessarily retread the original or capture the same exact spirit as it does become entertaining for the same exact reasons the original was entertaining because it is cute and innocent fun because it has pretty killer plot that is endlessly fun follow along because the lead star is immensely appealing because the parents are also immensely appealing and am repeating myself because it is cute and innocent fun there is nothing too risque about it save the plot the idea of separating twins and denying them the truth for years is ominously selfish but that is precisely the point of the movie and it is aimed directly at either kids adults who want remember the original or young adults who want remember what it was like be kid personally am somewhere between the second and third can vividly remember when my taste in movies was not so weird or diverse the names godard and kubrick were not even glimmer in my right eye back then when would tune in every sunday night for couple years see abcs wonderful world of disney where they would show you liveaction andor madefortv disney flick an hour per week can remember my mom taking my sister and along all my friends and their mothers see all the rereleased disney films like lady and the tramp and pinnochio and most sadly remember every single christmas without fail there were barage of childrens animated halfhour shows made exclusively for the christmas season that would not dare missing can even remember seeing the madefortv parent trap ii on tv one night and after had seen that one over and over and over again saw the original parent trap it is more of late childhood movie because it deals the issue of divorce but it deals it in disneyized version it is playful and witty and charming and if saw it for the first time right now having never experienced that part of my childhood would probably dismiss it would probably do the same for the new version of the same movie if had not seen the original at such perfect age watching it could remember what fun it was watch disney and how divorce for me started get me thinking about the possibilities of my seeminglyperfect parents splitting up and how it affected my adolescence and also how it brushed that fear off smooth stroke and pointed out that even in the most fuckedup of situations things could always work out if you well manipulate things bit at least for the better this new version did that for me but it is also charming in its own way it has new cast contemporary feel and for the first time in awhile for liveactiondisney flick tone that is not corny or condescending but just right the moments that would otherwise seem corny are actually affecting in safe kind of way and for the first time since the original the kids actually know better than the foolish adults the story is basically classic now repeated almost as many times as kurosawas the seven samurai pair of twins played here lindsay lohan just like they were played hayley mills in the original are separated at birth their divorcing parents one annie is sent live the mother natasha richardson resembling her mother vanessa redgrave more than had ever noticed in london where she lives her parents and her devoted foppish butler simon kunz as she works as swingin fashion designer she grows up refined and classy but also keen knowledge in sports and pokerplaying the other hallie is sent northern california her father dennis quaid live on vineyard their pseudomaid lisa ann walter and grows up rugged yet charming they both meet at the same camp one that annie wants go become more rugged they feud because they look alltoo similar and are thus in tight competition results in some nasty pranks winds them in seclusion together in private outoftheway cabin there they become friends then learn about eachother once they know everything they concoct scheme switch places so the one can meet the other parent whom they have only heard of they learn about eachothers lives in detail they make sure they look alike requires hair cutting and notoriously earpiercing scene is like the kiddie version of the hypodermic needle scene in pulp fiction and when the end of summer comes they switch and hope for the best lindsay lohan does not necessarily copy the acting style of hayley mills in the original but she comes off just as appealing as she did once she does though add couple new things she makes the california twin little more appealing and the london twin bit more frank and snobbish than the snotty and proper original respectively she also adds on an american and british accent each one one faking the other accent throughout and if you really take notice you can see that the fake ones accents are not exactly perfect she is also incredibly appealing not merely cute is especially notable since this is her first feature and we know how notorious child actors are especially in their first films she makes great protagonist and it only helps that the supporting cast is equally appealing dennis quaid in fact has not been this likable in about decade his big dumb smile and near cocky attitude is what has made him notable actor in the past not just that he is mr meg ryan ditto natasha richardson except that she just has not ever been this likable period the two make winning couple maybe not so winning as maureen ohara and the late brian keith in the original but they still work for this instead of the bickering that ensued in the original the adds another dimension and another angle their characters that was amiss in the original during the opening credits we see glimpses from their courtship on the qe where they fall quickly and madly in love eachother and when back together again the films more smarmy scenes come off as actually sentimental but in that great way not the migraineinducing way as in many such films this all brings this new parent trap level of entertainment that has not really existed since well the original years ago still my money the best liveactiondisney flick of all time this is because it has form of intelligence and wit that makes such plot points as an otherwise standard villainous love interest subplot golddigging sharon stone type played elaine hendrix who is deliciously tormented the twins later on in the treat instead of bore like the original this transcends all the crap that it very well could be case in point it takes two starring the olsen twins because it treats the children as the smart ones and the adults as the silly ones not the other way around and because above everything it knows exactly how be charming without biting off more than it can chew however in comparison the original it could be bit better certain scenes work well but not nearly as well as they worked in the original liked the way the parents fought over past dilemnas and then fought over falling in love again better than liked watching two old flames getting back together over bottle of wine somehow feuding is always more cinematic and pleasing than mere reminscing lesson extracted from the howard hawkscary grant films of yesteryear and as much as this transcends mere cutedom compared the original this almost drowns in cutedom the original though not gritty was far more stylized and just as suitable for adult audiences as it was for young audiences as such this remake may never be nearly as great or classic as the original but it at least knows how treat its source material dignity and respect and how create virtually the same effects without bordering on plagerism or petty annoyances

gere willis poitier chase each other around the world the jackal review michael redman copyright michael redman when the soviet union imploded the western countries lost their shadow the united states friendly the russians we no longer had an entity blame for the worlds problems this showed up in films as the communist government was no longer the easy bad guy it is time rejoice because we have found our new villain now it is no longer the russian government who sends killers out into foreign lands it is the russian _mafia_ perfect solution it combines the dread of organized crime and the stillpresent uneasiness the former eastern block countries best of all the villains are still foreigners fear of the other always plays best so it is crime lord in moscow that sends legendary hitman the jackal bruce willis assassinate highly placed us government figure in retaliation for the death of his brother during nightclub raid the fbi is at loss as how protect the target from someone they are not sure even exists coming their rescue is former ira operative declan mulqueen richard gere who is temporarily released from prison assist fbi agent carter preston sidney poitier and russian major valentina koslova diane venora mulqueens exgirlfriend basque terrorist isabella mathilda may is the only person who has seen the elusive jackal presumably there is an exclusive international terrorist club somewhere where the three met the follows two parallel tracks as the jackal prepares for his million hit and mulqueen attempts locate him while preston makes sure that the irishman does not slip away crossing numerous borders and donning various disguises for both himself and his minivan the killer is always one step ahead of his pursuers being very loosely based on the same book the thriller the day of the jackal comparison between the two films is inevitable there is no doubt that the original is the better movie playing the story for suspense rather than the current actionadventure as mystery the jackal has enough holes in it ruin the tale but if you can accept it for what it is there is entertainment be had holes let us see pivotal clue for mulqueen is so obscure that he must possess psychic powers pick it up for year veteran that can command the big bucks the jackal is an incredibly poor shot the final scene between gere and willis occurs in location that should be mobbed police but it is just the two of them willis disguises usually look like bruce willis and are just as interesting as val kilmers in the saint and lest you misunderstand that is not compliment but the three stars are fun watch it is good see gere in something other than business suit willis has mixed history in picking projects but his characters are always watchable poitier is far the superior actor but has limited screen time the problems in logic are flaws but do not ruin the experience occasionally there are movies that transcend their blemishes this is one of them the appeared in the bloomington voice bloomington indiana

it is terribly unfortunate that stir of echoes tautly written and directed david koepp who made one of unsung treasures the trigger effect should be released little more than month after the sixth sense is still going strong at the box office these two films are undoubtedly going be compared judging from practically all of my fellow audience members last night and although they have eerily similar storylines stir of echoes is more of straightforward psychological horror while the sixth sense is closer psychological drama additionally while the sixth sense had shocker of an ending that undoubtedly has been one of the major factors in its recent repeat business stir of echoes is more conventional and predictable in its final twist and where the sixth sense was disturbing stir of echoes is just plain scary have feeling most viewers are going come away unimpressed because of the unavoidable similarities and will foolishly forget judge this on its own respectable merits adapted from novel richard matheson that was written some forty years ago stir of echoes opens cute sixyearold boy named jake zachary david cope who is taking bath he is speaking directly at the screen but we immediately have feeling someone else is there finally he asks does it hurt be dead apparently jake sees the ghosts of dead people but unlike the sixth sense this young child is not the focus of the picture instead tom witzy kevin bacon chicago lineman is our protagonist jake is his son and maggie kathryn erbe whom has just discovered she is six weeks pregnant is his hardworking wife one night while at party their closest friends tom convinces maggies newage sister lisa illena douglas try and hypnotize him it unexpectedly works and before long tom is seeing things he would not normally see including deceased teenage girl jenny morrison in his house who happens have been missing for the last six months seeking help from lisa she tells him that while he was under hypnosis she told him that after he awoke his mind will remain clear and free like an opened door she did not expect it work but it did and the only way stop it is for tom somehow find way help this girl he sees stir of echoes is not perfect any stretch of the imagination but in the thick atmospheric mood it conjures up it is terrifically eerie domestic horrordrama and is not only effective on technical level but is impressive in its portrayal of struggling workingclass family kevin bacon and especially kathryn erbe dream the fishes are topnotch and exceedingly believable as loving married couple who nonetheless have their fair share of problems after tom is hypnotized and starts seeing ghastly visions he is completely taken over his desire solve this mystery of the disappearing girl whom he has seen lurking in his house and instead of maggie not being understanding she instead believes what tom says and aside from being little worried what he is going through does not try stop his pursuit bacon and erbe are not traditional stars like tom cruise and julia roberts and therefore are easier relate and always plausible as struggling couple who have work overtime at their jobs just make ends meet in masterfullydone entrancing sequence tom is hypnotized lisa but instead of watching him we instead see what he sees starting from his view as he closes his eyes into darkness lisa tells him visualize being in an empty movie theater and so we as audience members are watching movie screen from inside theater is also showing movie screen in theater telling him move closer and closer the screen as fuzzy word in black letters pops up on the screen we begin float closer and closer the front of the theater until we see that the word is sleep never before have seen hypnotism scene as mesmerizing and brilliantlyconstrued as this one truthfully this setpiece and another in tom wakes up from nightmarish dream only quickly discover he is reliving what he has just dreamt are worth the full price of admission alone just see them on the big screen having loads of fun her small role as maggies sister lisa illeana douglas die for her last great character is delight but rarely used her full advantage in feature films funny and enjoyably offbeat douglas gets utter the best line in the while talking maggie about toms visions of the girl she remarks would not be worried about him seeing another girl although the fact that she is dead gives one pause also of note are jenny morrison intersection who is truly poignant in the last half of the when we flash back see what really happened her missing character and liza weil remarkable in whatever as morrisons grieving teenage sister debbie if the resolution of stir of echoes does not live up its obviously frightful full potential and it does not what comes before is both involving and appropriately gritty the music score james newton howard and unsettling use of whispers and ghostly sound effects successfully compliment and foreshadow the offkilter frameofmind that tom is put into and director david koepp proves once again that he is director knack for creating almost unbearably tense situations that revolve around realisticallywritten characters stir of echoes is not as good as the sixth sense but why should it need be both films are fully capable of standing on their own two feet and stir of echoes really is spinetinglingly good horror

usually when blockbuster comes out it is loaded effects stars bad scripts and plenty of action mystery men may contain an allstar cast and efects but the clever script and characters are what really works is rare see this year the is based upon the comic book series the flaming carrot bob burden in wanna be super heroes try and fight crime only be out done the real hero of champion city captain amazing greg kinnear things go little haywire when the sinister casanova frankenstein geoffrey rush is released into the city where he captures captain amazing and plans wreak havoc upon champion city well the trio decide take matters in their own hands saving the city but first they need some assitance this is where the takes turn for the better in the beggining there were only wanna be heroes blue raja hank azaria mr furious ben stiller and the shoveller william macy sure they were enterataining but their acts grew old fast that is until they aquire invisible boy kel mitchell and the bowler janeane garafalo and mr splein paul reubens of rescue the from becoming disastorous mess thankfully the original heroes become amusing some support of reuben and garfalo on screen the whole premise is rather ridiculous but packs few punches keep interest for one the is considerably clever it literally pokes fun at super hero films like batman and robin superman etc in fact many scenes are similar batman and robin including the opening sequence only altered in humorous and superior way part of the cleverness comes from the cast sometimes such talent is overblown but the acting is what keeps it alive here while azaria and macy were enteratining characters really stood out one was paul reuben no matter how disgusting or revolting mr splein may be you still cannot help but laugh it so incredibly moronic it is just riot watching reuben relieve himself of bodily functions janeane garafalo also was an interesting character she seemed be the most outgoing and convincing character on screem due her enthusiasm that kept the flowing men is worth seeing alone for those troubled heroes on the downside few of the heroes and especially the villain never really lift off kel mitchell and geoffrey rush were both utterly useless their parts were so limited they would be lucky at all be on screen for more than minutes ben stiller too was wasted mostly because of his unlikeable power and dialogue none of these characters get rise out of anybody but happily they are lost in the charming flow of the as far as the budget goes it was wisely spent on the cast not the effects while the set designs and action all look nice am glad there was seperate aspect that the focused on and for that applaud slow at times and rather pointless mystery men still delivers it forgets about money making because it is not likely make bundle like it is proceeders and that is what works stupid maybe but for once am not disappointed no one expected an intelligent but you get thats wit captures your attention and makes you forget this miserable year

review peter jacksons the frighteners has received some notice for setting the record for most computer effects ever in movie and still coming in at the extremely cheap million price tag but for those who were dismayed this years blockbusters like twister and independence day the frighteners has much more offer than special effects and for those worried wether or not peter jackson would compromise you can rest easily the frighteners is as far removed from as highprofile movie can get michael fox stars as frank bannister con artist who can speak ghosts he uses this ability set up scam in small town where his ghost buddies scare the hell out of people then he comes and pretends get rid of them this is how he has made living ever since his wife died in car crash years ago franks latest customers are young couple played trini alvarado and peter dobson when dobson ends up dead alvarado starts take an interest in fox but dobsons spirit is still around as he refuses beleive he is dead this leads very awkward and amusing dinner date between fox and alvarado dobson tagging along as ghost things start getting complicated for fox when he is accused for series of murders taking place in the town fox sees someone named the soul collector crushing the heart of the victims but noone else can see that so when fox shows up try and save each victim naturally people suspect he is the killer fox sees that alvarado is next on the soul collectors hit list and the last half hour of the movie deals foxs attempts save her from this evil spirit there are many wonderful twists and turns in the screenplay written peter jackson and frances walsh the movie starts off as black comedy and ends up horroraction the mix between these genres are perfect no laughs are sacrificed in the name of horror and vice versa one point of contention might be lackluster score danny elfman but that hardly seems like flaw when you have such diverse cast all in top form michael fox delivers one of his best performances date as man who hides the sorrow of his wifes death and then is forced confront this later on alvarado looking like andie macdowell makes great frightened tough and smart heroine and jeffery combs as paranoid fbi agent is brilliantly bizaare the frighteners never once feels like it is running long the first hour is as funny as any comedy this year and the last half hour is as thrilling as any of the big budget blockbusters this movie is probably what casper would have looked like if david lynch directed it it is easily the best of the year so far

before you read my review you gotta know that love woody allen this is very important note because allens films are generally an acquired taste and definitely not for everyone know folks who believe him be complete genius while others see him as dirty ol schnook who keeps making the same movie over and over again love most of his films but will admit having been quite disappointed his recent crop during the in fact why he felt the need make movies in those years is beyond me if you look at the quality of those films you will hear what am saying the only two films of his that really liked during that time were bullets over broadway and husbands and wives in fact secretly hoped that he would take some time off at the turn of the millennium just reenergize or something but it does not appear as though he has any intention of doing that so here am again reviewing yet another woody allen movie and hoping that it brings back the woody from the days of old plot the year is and woody allen is topnotch insurance investigator his methods are very oldfashioned and apparently out of date new employee hunt has just been hired streamline the operations for greater efficiency the two do not like each other one night they are both put under hypnotic trance magician and unbeknownst them placed under his control soon thereafter jewels are stolen words of love are exchanged and everyone is looking for an answer critique wonderful recreation of the style movies the fasttalking witty banter between coworkers catchy jazz score moving things along noirish elements such as the veronica laketype sexpot oneliners galore and fluffy if inconsequential plotline on the downside the actually starts off pretty slowly the first hour tossing only few guffaws out there but never really generating any kind of steady flow or energy the sets on the other hand were amazing the production design and costumes were perfect and the casting ideal so kept hoping that the would pick up and not turn into yet another mediocre outing for the man but it was not not long before was fully engaged the characters entertained the many zingers delivered backandforth between allen and hunt and actually interested in the resolution of the flick also appreciated how allen played the fine line between homage the films of old parody and actual reinvention note therons entire female persona that is drenched in noir very cool of course films like this little or no real tension in the plot need solid actors keep you interested in the quickfire dialogue and once again allen does great job in playing his character who for once is not his typical new york jewish neurotic cheating insecure husband dude he actually plays macho guy here and handles it pretty well especially the scenes in he is hypnotized but the bigger surprise for me in this was helen hunt an actress who was openly sick of seeing in movies late last year sorry babe you were just in too many at the same time anyway she is really great in this as the headstrong woman looking new era of equality amongst men and does not miss beat of allens fastpaced dialogue did not care much for her running joke about him dying whenever he left room but overall she was really good and especially liked the way that her sweaters clung her breasts as they did yum yum harumph but digress so let us recap great looking picture nice jazzy score some funny oneliners especially in the second half decent plotline although you should not expect real mystery or anything and some solid acting all around cannot say that this is even remotely close any of allens best work but certainly believe it be step in the right direction especially after the dinky decade of films that he just went through it is probably better geared towards allen fans more than anyone else but would still recommend this anyone looking for cute oldschool kind of vibe chemistry between the leads zippy dialogue and satisfying conclusion little known facts about this and its stars annie hall celebrity everyone says love you husbands and wives mighty aphrodite small time crooks when harry met sally you have got mail

susan grangers review of legally blonde g it is pretty in pink clueless comingofage story for the new millennium as elle woods reese witherspoon perky southern california sorority queen switches from fashion law in order win back her yuppy boyfriend matthew davis the girlpower story begins as this sweetheart of delta nu is unceremoniously dumped bonehead who says if am going be senator the time am need marry jackie not marilyn determined prove she is as smart snobby brunette selma blair from countryclub connecticut elle not only applies harvard law school but gets in much the amazement of family friends and faculty once there this flaxenhaired fishoutofwater not only survives but tenaciously thrives befriending local manicurist jennifer coolidge dazzling professor victor garber and rescuing defendant ali larter in celebrated boston murder trial plus finding more worthy beau luke wilson in the tradition of teencomedy filmmaker john hughes and his disciple amy heckerling there is wit cheerfulness fidelity of observation and penchant for problemsolving firsttime feature director robert luketic is blessed reese witherspoon who is joyously incandescent in this utterly formulaic light comedy written karen mccullah lutz and kirsten smith based on soontobepublished novel amanda brown the supporting cast is terrific particularly raquel welch and holland taylor and particularly got kick out of the gag of elle distributing scented resumes in pink her signature color on the granger movie gauge of legally blonde is frivolous funny feelgood filled ditzy blonde ambition it is movie for highschool kids that their parents would be happy have them see

what do you get when you combine clueless and dumb and dumber answer the question you get director david mirkins new comedy romy and micheles high school reunion romy white mira sorvino mighty aprhodite and michele weinberger lisa kudrow tvs friends have been inseparable buddies since they graduated from sagebrush high in however when former classmate heather mooney janeane garafolo the truth about cats and dogs confronts romy about the year reunion she is astounded that she forgot watching pretty woman for the umteenth time they are reminded of how they would not let julia roberts character shop in the expensive stores because of her appearance then it hits them they are not successful what are she and michele going do romys instant solution is lose some weight off their already slender frames bag couple of boyfriends and get jobs romy says this will be easy but michele retorts that if it is so easy why had not they already done it robin schiffs script keeps the show moving some nice oneliners one of the best has romy reminiscing about her lifes battle against the bathroom scales was so lucky getting mono she says looking at her thinnest high school picture that was like the best diet ever the casting for the is so perfect that one begins suspect that the leads were chosen and then the script was developed romy and michele use their high school yearbook discuss the caste system at their high school the films editor david finfer dissolves the stills from the yearbook live action flashbacks makes the past come life at sagebrush high the hierarchy consisted of the group cheerleaders the group drama club and the group nerds romy and michele were none of the above ridiculed as the weirdoes they were constant targets for abuse even though they were quite attractive they had so much fun being together that they did not care about the others that they make their own outlandish clothes helped keep the wall around them complementing romy and micheles lightness is janeane garofalo as the dark pudgy heather mooney heather who invented new cigarette paper for cigarettes twice the taste in half the time for the gal on the go has the success and the money that they would like heather was even more of an outsider than they were in high school garofalos onedimensional role is only side show this is two person the other characters there merely for the two leads bounce their lines off of the genuine chemistry between sorvino and kudrow makes for sweet and sometimes touching comedy they have so much fun acting out their parts their enjoyment spreads the audience

martin scorseses triumphant adaptation of edith whartons the age of innocence is stunning for the quintessential new york filmmaker the man who brought the streets of taxi driver and mean streets life it seems like an odd choice for scorsese do period piece in the early but the fact that he pulls it off so brilliantly is wonder and testament the greatness of scorsese as filmmaker this is gorgeous visual experience that it surely one of scorseses finest newland archer daylewis is prestigious lawyer who is engaged may welland ryder somewhat empty and shallow new yorker who belongs prestigious family and is quite beautiful the marriage is one will unite two very prestigious families in society where nothing is more important than the opinions of others on the day that archer is announce his engagement may countess ellen olenska pfeiffer cousin of may walks into archers life archer is immediately captivated and finds himself in love ellen archer is also bound the limits of new york society is an intrusive as any other in the world archer finds himself having secret love affair in his mind countess olenska attempting keep her in his mind while trying not lose his social status
