cleanedup not as buff and has full head of hair he is just as intelligent but still very rough along the edges but he is wisened up he is no longer controlled his anger at blacks and jews and tries persuade danny who is becoming what derek was before give up his lifestyle but danny will not he goes large skinhead beer bash meets the skinhead leader stacy keach and then discovers that derek is as opposed neonazidom as he was for it couple of years ago the circles around this then spins off into nonlinear flashbacks all done in black and white we mostly see derek at his prime as skinhead living in venice beach organizing vicious and quasisadistic raids on local stores that no longer hire the white middleclass teenagers since they can easily get cheaper illegal immigrants do the same work and mouthing off his theories on affirmative action and how illegal immigrants and blacks have destroyed the fundamentals this country was built on them the white man is the one who has gotten the fuzzy end of the lolipop and he not only speaks elloquently forcefully and intelligently but he backs everything up political reasons justifying their rage at least them and frighteningly enough much of what he says sounds true american history is collection of really great scenes and moments rather than cohesive great that flows effortlessly from one moment the next in it there are some of the best scenes have seen all year one scene features dinner between dereks family and his mothers newest boyfriend played reserve eliott gould jewish liberal who quietly disagrees dereks rightist views launching the scene into fit of rage and anger that builds unparalled emotions in the audience goulds reaction dereks final summation is unnerrving another scene uses humor and traditional macho sex talk build friendship and nice connection between derek and black coworker guy torry while folding laundry in prison and another soontobeclassic is actually divided in two the murder of the two black men that winds derek in jail contains final murder so nasty that it may be the most revoltingly shocking all year there is much more appreciate like the acting is uniformly good standouts coming from avery brooks beverly dangelo as the longsuffering mother and gould who has one horrible line but other than that comes off the best performance he is given in what seems like really long time norton walks off the though coming off such intensity that he reduces anyone not doing an adequate job rubble in only the fifth movie of his career norton has invented himself as one of the most reliable and intense actors of his generation and maybe the best there is nothing like it when norton really gets rolling in this movie spewing out lines such authority that he commands all attention from the audience coming off power similar that of young maron brando that he allows the little emotions seep through is amazing sadly enough this is not going be the great portrait of racism that it perhaps hopes be it is too unambitious and even little contrived really take off as either powerful statement or an emotional masterpiece the ending especially is pencilled in from other movies tossed in just so the emotional keyboard can be trounced upon some of the skinheads are reduced mere cliches kevin smith regular ethan suplee fairs rather annoyingly as the fat skinhead whose lines consist without fail of expressing his desire eat more and even the dramatic arc is not as well travelled furlongs danny never seems really be learning lesson since the flashbacks refuse show his point of view and when he decides make change the end was inevitable it does not seem like it has actually arrived there even dereks descent into skinheaddom does not seem justified though his fireman father william russ the dad from boy meets world and do not ask me how know that is killed black junkie and even before he spoke against affirmative action intelligently there never seems be any real back story why derek became so intense about his beliefs as such one can see why the director tony kaye wanted have his name removed sorta american history is very good movie and was very moved it but it could be lot better and the problem seems be that the cut as it is is not up what he claims be his potential somewhere he claims there lies tony kaye cut and that was be the true cut until it was viewed norton who then ordered another cut and that is thus although he aimed for the directing credit go alan smithee the resident name for any that is be disowned its director it was not allowed him under the grounds that once you disown you can not badmouth it but really that is the macguffin no one really wanted this good be given the alan smithee sign of disapproval kayes right in that it is not up par even if he is not referring normal par but rather his own personal par this will not be do the right thing for the late yet it still gets its point across intelligently and backs it up its story its message that one cannot be so enwrapped in ones own beliefs or pain and suffering will occur is literally said over the narration unfortunately and even if it is not perfect at least when avery brooks turns norton after he has been beaten and raped in prison and asks him if anything he is done has made his life any better it realy hits nerve not only in derek but also in the audience

synopsis as response accusations of sexual prejudice in the armed forces female naval intelligence officer is chosen be test case if she can survive the demanding e l training she will open the way for other women be permitted follow in her footsteps throw in lot of political machinations sabotage brutality water and sand and you have an entertaining movie review the title of this movie turned me off at first mean gi jane the other titles were considered were more promising in pursuit of honor or matter of honor would have been acceptable although navy cross or undisclosed are little meaningless as far as am concerned went into this movie not liking the title and being one of those people who thinks that demi moore is absolutely ghastly as an actor my surprise really enjoyed the movie moore as lieutenant jordan oneil is much more likeable than her washed out excuse for gusty woman in few good men the storyline is simple anne bancroft playing senator lillian dehaven is ruthless machiavellian politician an agenda push using feminism achieve political mileage she forces the military powers that be backdown and permit test case enter the highly intensive navy e l training jordan is selected due the fact that she has it all looks brains and strength the training is gruelling and the indignity almost painful watch nonetheless it is one of those movies that makes me want cheer out and encourage the hapless heroheroine along in hisher endeavours sure there are the stereotypical elements inhuman treatment sexual innuendo resentful peers pained boyfriend and sexist commanding officer stepping away from the stereotypes though viggo mortensen as master chief john urgayle tries get away from being nothing more than brutal screamer his character exercises little more intellectual rigour than you would normally expect from such character jordans boyfriend royce is also in the military although they both started at the same time due the fact that he has seen active service he has advanced through the ranks much more quickly than she has royce what is his surname do we care almost resents jordans attempts advance herself although he quickly settles down being doeeyed and supportive his character seems have been thrown in so that we know that you do not have be lesbian want be in the military in parts this is very silly movie gratuitous lines and scenes thrown in for effect are so blatantly obvious or contrived that it is hard not cringe still liked it though weaknesses in the script aside this is captures heroic and reckless mood as we watch jordans battle it is increasingly clear that it is personal battle this is an individuals fight for selfadvancement we do not have have our teeth set on edge didactic preachings we do not have feel uncomfortable because we are having ideology thrust down our throats it is enough that we can sit back and hope that this one person gets what she wants and we can admire her tenacity and determination without coming out and saying whether we believe women should go into combat or not

the idea at the center of the devils advocate is thus far one of the three or four best films of is that no matter what decision is made evil will triumph god is trickster satan is humanist the last humanist he appears in many guises and seduces many men and women in his own words vanity far my favorite sin al pacino plays this role relish and gets chew some delectable lines lemme givya piece inside wisdom on god have million names as john milton the devil the main idea that he can appear as anyone in any form in this case buisness man harkens mainly back terry gilliams the time bandits but the is something else something original part of what makes it so very good is that it never takes itself too seriously it dabbles morality vanity death and child abuse but does not try become any profound study of power this is marvelous confection cocky funny thought provoking it is also entertaining there is no way you could possibly predict the ending it pulls back upon itself drawing purely out of the minds eye the final shot is more creative more daring more challenging then anything in cinema since the white sock in the coens fargo the central themes are fascinating sometimes reminiscent of james the turn of the screw and oates accursed inhabitants of the house of bly and the product that is built around it really wows its nice know that things like this are still being made

scream like its predecessor is genrecrossing it is about horror and murder mystery the mix worked very well last time and it continues entertain this time scream was also known for its selfreferential tone many inside jokes were made in reference horror movies and wes craven again scream follows suit characters saying such things as sequels suck and the entire horror genre was destroyed sequels scream story is very similar it is predecessors sidney neve campbell having survived the killing spree in scream is now in college gale weathers courteney cox has written book about the murders and that book is now being released as feature called stab for all practical purposes is the realworld movie scream at the premiere of stab two students from sidneys college are stabbed death and new story begins the press descends on sidney and her college get the scoop on this sequel killer they want know all about the links between stab sidney and the recent murders the most complex selfreference saw this should be an olympic event was the scene where gale weathers was asking questions at press conference the rest of the press was watching and videotaping weathers the other survivors from scream were watching and videotaping the press the audience was watching the whole filmed scene whew the movie is packed layers and selfreferences that make it pleasure watch even better would be watch double feature of scream and scream that is not say that these references necessarily make scream deep or even good movie the just add the fun of watching it recommend it for other reasons as well what liked best about the horror aspect of the movie is that the monster is not supernatural no werewolf or ghost or psycho superhuman strength is responsible it is person in mask and robe his only advantage the fear he strikes into his victims no extraordinary leap of faith is needed believe in the killer the down side is that if you are frightened horror movies you have less grounds say it is just movie the whodunit aspect of the movie is not that great itself gale weathers and deputy dewey david arquette also from the original track down killer they are likeable but not outstanding but in combination the horror aspect the whodunit is perfect counterpoint it was exactly year ago today that wrote the review for scream the internet movie database says that scream is in the works so wonder if will be doing the same thing on january if craven and screenwriter kevin williamson are able keep the quality high will be happy mark my calendar

when first saw the previews for ron howards latest my expectations were discouragingly low show about nothing sounds like seinfeld guy whose entire life is broadcast hours day sounds like the truman show what is it that no sooner than one production company puts out an animated feature about ants another puts one out about bugs is why was pleasantly surprised edtv turns out be fresh insightful and often times hilarious about the follies of instant celebrity the writing howards longtime collaborators lowell ganz and babaloo mandel is right on the money and howard himself should be credited for giving the subject matter fresh focus in the hands of lessexperienced director edtv could easily have had all the flavor of yesterdays meatloaf their true tv cable ratings being threatened the gardening channel apparently people would rather watch soil the northwest broadcasting company is looking for novel concept attract viewers program director cynthia topping ellen degeneres comes up the idea of putting nobody on the air and broadcasting his every waking and sleeping moment the hook is find regular guy someone normal that people can relate while scouting possible candidates cynthias camera crew discover ed pekurny and his pig brother ray woody harrelson in bar where ray believes he has what it takes for his fifteen plus minutes of fame but on watching the videotape the show is producers are more taken ed than ray he is cute he says all the wrong things and he is usda hick cynthias boss played rob reiner gives the show week deliver the goods and it is tough going in the early stages the most exciting thing that happens is ed brushes his teeth action shot wags one of the production assistants when couple of pop tarts jump out of the toaster you get the idea but soon enough thingsnielsenboosting kinds of thingsstart happen this unassuming san francisco video store clerk and the true tv cameras are right there document it eds privacy is no longer his own his newfound fame starts having negative impact on his family life and what little dignity he has left is trampled on the media who should ed go out you can be sure the pollsters have list not only is the exceedingly well cast but its performers are consistently excellent matthew mcconaughey provides the face the body language and the lovable texan accent fill the shoes of americas latest phenomenon he and harrelson look like they really could be brothers sally kirkland is noteworthy in difficult role as eds mother and martin landau is one of the films highlights as al eds ailing stepfather jenna elfman from tvs dharma and greg proves herself surprisingly worthy in the company of kirkland and landau although those alpine eyebrows of hers get little distracting even degeneres and reiner are better than you would expect in writerdirectorcomedian albert brooks made zany little called real life in smalltime opportunist makes realtime documentary about typical american family the scenes of eds family sitting around the dinner table feasting on kentucky fried chicken and waxing idiotic play like bigbudget variant on that paralleling its wickedly inventive humor as most films albert brooks real life was funny but absurd the funniestand scariestthing about edtv is that it is absolutely believable

ingredients james bond scuba scene car controlled cellular telephone synopsis warped media tycoon elliot carver jonathan pryce plots start war between britain and china in order boost ratings using stealth ship fire captured british missile at the city of beijing superagent james bond pierce brosnan uses trick gadgets pluck and charm in order foil carvers scheme this time bond teams up top female agent wai lin from china michelle yeoh the contains fights chases gadgets and comedic moments opinion it does not have casino scene or ski scene but tomorrow never dies is nevertheless solid enjoyable bond movie it neither stands out nor disappoints in old bond movies bond sometimes teamed up american cia agent felix leiter tomorrow never dies introduces new character in the form of chinese agent wai lin like leiters character wai lin would be sure bet for cameo in later bond movie stars michelle yeoh was born leo in the western zodiac in the year of the tiger on the asian astrology calendar dont believe in horoscopes but at an airport once browsed an astrology book section on leo tigers lts leo tigers prefer enough solitude grow at their own pace lts are unbelievably courageous when facing adversity the lt is also classy and has an excellent sense of refinement but she sees herself as an adventurer and prefers freedom of movement rather than flashy status symbols this person loves family and friends fierce loyalty she delights in siblings nephews nieces and extended family but she must have her personal freedom come and go as she pleases sometimes annoyance at injustice drives her take up one or two causes in love life the lt has an unfortunate mental block against committing any partner who is less powerful than she in real life michelle yeoh is asias top female star like jackie chan she does her own stunts she was born in malaysia country of many languages and her primary language the language she speaks in her sleep is english she was taught malay in school and learned cantonese from bilingual parents as an athlete michelle represented malaysia internationally she enjoyed squash diving swimming and rugby she studied ballet at the royal academy of dance in london but switched drama after spinal injury in she won the miss malaysia pageant without really intending since family member had entered her in the contest without her knowledge notoriety from the contest led eventually movie career as an action heroine michelle has survived divorce asian retail tycoon dickson poon nearly fatal stunt accident falling from freeway overpass put her in the hospital for three months and retirement from the movies her comeback from retirement supercop became the top grossing in asia that year it is not clear what michelles martial arts style is but it may be theatrical version of wing chun of her character wai lin in tomorrow never dies michelle says wai lin is the first bond girl who is on par bond someone who can match up him mentally and physically my own opinion is that casting michelle yeoh as agent wai lin was an excellent choice

it is always refreshing see superstar actor who gets paid more than enough forget about working for living want take chance and play lessthansavoury character as mel gibson does in payback of course if was being paid million for one months work would probably be willing take risks as well but that is neither here nor there payback is based on novel richard stark apparently actually donald westlake author of the grifters itself fine crime was also filmed in the as point blank starring one of the toughest of tough guys lee marvin the opens gibson having recovered from being shot several times in the back whom we do not know yet all we know is that gibson as porter is not happy chappy and is hellbent on getting the money stolen from him back and getting even in the process no matter what the consequences it turns out that the man he is after is val gregg henry his sometime partner whom he stole briefcase full of cash from gang of chinese mobsters obviously not having much of crisis of the soul val figures porter is dead and goes about using his share of the money pay off debt his employers porter however is the sort of man who holds grudge and once on his feet goes about exacting revenge on the doublecrossing val gibson gives terrific performance in the sort of role he was born play that of slightly unhinged guy who does not mind beating up or shooting people get what he wants you probably would not see other actors in his salary range take such an offbeat outofcharacter role such as porter jim carrey will not be doing anything like this in hurry after what happened the last time he tried the cable guy anyone harrison fords idea of playing an unsympathetic character is presumed innocent the last time schwarzenegger played villain was batman and robin we will not mention further and has stallone ever really played villain at all this is not say that porter is villain per se while he is not the sort of character you would not want get on the wrong side of he is nothing compared some of the ones we are forced watch in countless bad thrillers and action films where they kill innocent people in the blink of an eye or execute their righthand men just prove how mean they are porter is only trying get back what is notsorightfully his in way is almost understandable payback is an enjoyable dramatic black comedythriller will not be remembered as being among gibsons most important work but is still one of the finer films he is done the only real problem it is that while everything seems work out in the end was left feeling something was lacking was that all the ending looks as if it was tacked on at the last minute and the final voiceover does not ring true even though it was used good effect elsewhere in the filmnoir style the rest of the embodies the just ends far too suddenly after huge buildup in the penultimate scenes fine even though it needs just little something more be the kind of that can be recommended without hesitation just be ready for possible letdown of an ending

if you thought baz luhrmanns radical take on _william_shakespeares_romeo__juliet_ was wild wait until what you see what tony awardwinning stage director julie taymor _the_lion_king _the_broadway_musical_ does the bards _titus_andronicus_ for her audaciousand very bloodyfilm debut while luhrmann transplanted the starcrossed lovers florida taymor keeps this grisly tale of revenge in romebut places it in surreal temporal limbo the colosseum suggests the proper time of imperial rome but high rises and heavy duty kitchen ovens suggest the while the vintage automobiles and some costumes are more and and other garments are more gladiatorlike as tamora queen of goths jessica lange exacts revenge on roman general titus anthony hopkins for killing her eldest son and he does the same her for the wrongs she commits taymor obviously wanted express the timeless relevance of the storys underlying themes however the time convergence approach only works at times for often it is just distracting as in one scene where tamoras suviving sons matthew rhys and jonathan rhys meyers blow off steam playing video arcade games taymor did not have resort such avant garde time tricks for the story would have resonated just as strongly had she jettisoned them she is strong storyteller and master visual stylist the latter compliment encompassing all areas makeup and costume choices as well as those in the editing and photography departments she also has sure way actors hopkins titus is at once tragic and horrifying and lange is sultry as the viperous tamora the clear standout of the cast however is harry lennix as aaron moor who is tamoras secret lover and schemer in his own right lennix brings great depth role that could have easily been played as stock villain great villain he indeed is but leave it at that is not giving full justice his powerful and multidimensional work _titus_ is not complete success but it is never less than fascinating and it announces the arrival of fearlessly imaginative new cinematic voice

meteor threat set blow away all volcanoes twisters summer is here again this season could probably be the most ambitious season this decade churning out films like deep impact godzilla the xfiles armageddon the truman show all of has but one main aim rock the box office leading the pack this summer is deep impact one of the first few releases from the spielbergkatzenberggeffens dreamworks production company following the rather dismal showing of their previous two releases mousehunt and amistad deep impact shines elements could just make it one of the biggest movies of the year deep impact begins the discovery of an earth bound comet during school astronomy outing leo beiderman elijah wood subsequently stirred up the political community of the world keeping the information under wraps prevent widespread panic president beck morgan freeman took it upon himself and his subordinates execute highly secretive space project destroy the comet before it hits earth while pursuing sexscandal story amongst the presidential ranks ambitious up and coming reporter jenny lerner tea leoni unfolds the wool that president beck has pulled over the citizens of the world as if the knowledge of the imminent annihilation of mankind is not enough jenny has come terms her father maximillian schell leaving the mother for younger woman president beck announces the discovery and preparations destroy the comet exactly oneyear later so much confidence that it left no trace of panic within the american community achieving fame from announcement of the comet wolfbeiderman enroute earth the name of its discoverers leo beiderman continues life in his small town as young celebrity team of astronauts led the ageing veteran astronaut spurgeon tanner robert duvall was secretly trained carry out the mission land on the comet and create and explosion nuclear device the hope of blowing it out of its current path towards earth despite him being the most experienced in the team the younger generation of astronauts in the team doubts tanners ability due his age but these are just problems of individuals life on earth goes on as any other day confident that the comet will be destroyed when the attempt avert wolfbeidermans path failed and caused the comet split into two comet wolf and comet beiderman the president unfolds his contingency plan evacuate part of the population leaving the rest die citizens are randomly chosen live underground for years prior impact when the dust due the impact around earth have settled then all life on the surface would have died jenny and leo were picked but many of their loved ones were not only handful of earths population will be saved from destruction deep impacts moving moments occur in the least specialeffect laced scenes while the effects are fantastic they only form small part of the indulges itself in the development of its main characters leo lerner and tanner leos struggle when he learns that his girlfriend is not part of the population be saved lerners dwindling relationship her father and her pain for the mothers loneliness tanners strive gain the respect he deserves from his crew and his ultimate sacrifice all form the backbone of deep impacts moving moments deep impact smells suspiciously like the previous year release contact despite vivid differences think its probably because they both delve in story of global proportions and indulges in the premise of hope faith and life itself both do not depend heavily on eyecandy in the form of cgi effects director mimi leder who won numerous awards directing television series and made her debut peacekeeper last year is definitely director watch despite this being the first of the two meteor movies this summer the other being armageddon think there will be stark differences in the approach the subject matter while the premise of both may be the same execution and focus of the films will in fact show that deep impact has more focus on human elements than armageddon is done the team brought us bad boys crimson tide and the rock deep impact should be able satisfy variety of audiences from the most actioncraving those who just want immerse into its manipulative but nonetheless dramatic premise

there is striking scene early in city of angels where all the angels who live unseen in our midst gather at the beach watch the sun rise the camera moves above them showing the endless rows of ethereal men and women all garbed in black then the camera moves in on the face of seth an angel played nicolas cage and as the sun rises he smiles and his entire face lights up you see the angels can hear music in sunrises and sunsets but they cannot feel human touch it is an important scene for several reasons first of all it is one of many instances in the that make angels seem thoroughly plausible the presents these fantastic beings as normallooking people who drift amongst the inhabitants of earth watching what goes on little interference there are none of the standard hokey angel references used in recent films like angels in the outfield or michael the angels here are stark and believable this early scene on the beach is also an important scene of juxtaposition for its shows how gods angels can enjoy aspects of the earth that human cannot and yet they are denied so many simple human pleasures like feeling the sand on their feet or the waves lapping at their legs or the smell of the salt in the air there is an inherent tragedy in being an angel although there is much beauty in it as well they eternally walk the earth listening our thoughts touching us in our pain and leading the dying heaven like human existence being an angel is often confused and unsure city of angels is essentially love story between seth and human beautiful but sad heart surgeon named maggie meg ryan he first sees her when he is in her operating room waiting lead the soul of her dying patient heaven maggie is distraught doing everything in her power stop the man from dying on her table and seth is moved her efforts and more importantly her overwhelming sadness when the patient dies angels have the limited power soothe humans in time of misery and pain and seth does what he can his invisible touch but it is not enough he wants be her and share her pain not just stand back at distance he learns that the only way fulfill his desire for human love and touch is for him fall and become human he learns this from another fallen angel played dennis franz y d blue in touching and humorous performance sitting at diner together franz tells cages character about how wonderful it is be human be able taste food feel another persons skin smell the air and most importantly have loving wife and children of course there is pain go along all this but for seth it will be worth it city of angels is something of reinterpretation of wim wenders haunting wings of desire wenders was more like poem it was the feeling the emotion that truly mattered over what actually happened the americanized version moves the location from divided berlin broken los angeles and the emphasis shifts onto the relationship between the immortal angel and the mortal human and unlike most foreign films that are remade into fare it does not suffer extensive damage this may be because director brad silberling casper and screenwriter dana stevens blink wanted make city of angels its own movie inspired wings of desire but not an attempt copy it and yet city of angels is not typical movie it is beautifully filmed in lush colors cinematographer john seale the english patient whose sweeping aerial shots and golden lighting make los angeles into an almost unrecognizable new world seale creates many striking visuals in addition the beach scene there is wonderful sequence in circular library where all the angels appear at banisters all around looking down at seth as he watches maggie walk while the travels along charted plot it takes time develop its characters and situations it sheds light on the boundaries between what is earthly and what is heavenly and shows just how thin those boundaries are both cage and ryan give soulful softspoken performances ryan who is usually so bouncy and energetic truly embodies sadness that can only be alleviated heavenly touch cage projects all his desire and longing be human in simple heartfelt gazes and speaks the comforting knowing voice that only an angel could have what is most striking about city of angels is that stevens has added new ending the screenplay is both unexpected and challenging it is not formulaic ending because it is both sad and uplifting at the same time it does not give the audience what it thinks it wants at the end of romance instead it offers something much better something that speaks the depths of what it means be human and alive ____________________________________________ visit charlie do not surf an eclectic collection of reviews james kendrick http www bigfoot comjimkendrick email jimkendrickbigfoot com

star wars episode the phantom menace review matt pusateri few movies evoke nostalgia enthusiasm and affection like george lucas classic star wars the original blockbuster and its two sequels not only evoked wonder and passion in generation of filmgoers but has deeply entrenched itself in american pop culture arguably more americans today can explain what the force or jedi is than budget deficit or serb so years after the release of the original and years since the third the return of the jedi how can any new star wars withstand the weight of incomparable expectations and anticipation can new storyline and new cast of characters possibly compete the legends of the first trilogy luke han solo and darth vader all cultural icons against this challenge the fourth star wars episode one the phantom menace hit the screens last week and despite some early critical reviews in the major media the is neither flop nor disappointment while the phantom menace is certainly not the finest in the series it is nonetheless engaging exciting and visually breathtaking it is worthy sequel er prequel the original star wars films the phantom menace takes place decades before the setting of original films as the opens obiwan kenobi ewan mcgregor the wise old master who introduced luke the force in the original star wars is only young jedi apprentice still learning from his fellow jedi and instructor quigon jinn liam neeson the republic government has sent the two jedi settle trade dispute that has developed into blockade of the planet naboo shifty trade federation the jedi quickly find themselves not in negotiations but in the middle of planetary invasion rushing protect naboos young queen amidala natalie portman later after eventually rescuing amidala and helping her escape naboo they are forced stop at tatooine repair their battledamaged ship before bringing her the galactic senate make an appeal for justice on tatooine quigon discovers young slave boy anakin skywalker jake lloyd who not only can help them get the parts they need but displays uncanny intelligence insight and instincts quigon senses the child is unusually strong the force and begins suspect that he may be the one prophesized bring balance the force as anyone who has watched the original star wars trilogy knows far from being galactic savior the innocentlooking yearold will in time become the ruthless darth vader complicating matters further is mysterious hooded figure darth sidious is behind the trade blockade and invasion of naboo and sends out lethal apprentice darth maul find and capture queen amidala while amidala and the jedi fight save her planet they soon also have deal the deadly and relentless darth maul if the plot sounds bit complicated it is the phantom menace not only introduces an earlier generation of characters and an immediate crisis but sets up the foundation for the events that will eventually lead the fall of the republic the demise of the jedi knights anakins turn evil and the rise of the dark empire of original trilogy but the complexity is not overwhelming the story moves quickly the only drawback being that many questions predictably remain unanswered at the end of the setting the stage for the next episode one of the reasons the films story seems hazy is not that it is too confusing but too unfocused it is unclear whose story phantom menace is in the original trilogy the movies were clearly lukes story the stories centering around his growth from farmboy rebel hero jedi knight but it is unclear whether this new is anakins story or obiwans if this trilogy is centered on anakin it is shaky foundation lloyd like many child actors lacks the subtle acting skills of adult performers and as result his character seems shallow and unimpressive on screen we see nothing that suggests dark side lurking underneath his littleboy face or for that matter any presence that would make him seem so special that quigon is willing believe he is the one the rest of the cast does fine though they often work some iffy dialogue lucas neeson is perfect as an aging jedi knight mcgregor is wellcast as obiwan and conveys balance of youthful energy and calm sensibility portman fits the role of young queen well but her lines were often very formal giving her little room give her character much personality the biggest problem the phantom menace is not the plot or the characters but the interaction between them individually the characters in this new are no less developed than those in the original star wars and the storyline is not more confusing than previous films in the series but unlike the previous trilogy lucas does not do as good of job playing the characters off one another in star wars there were immediate contrasts and memorable exchanges between luke and han han and obiwan and leia and luke the ensemble played off each other and immediately showed their distinct attitudes and personalities in the sequence in where luke han and chewbacca attempt rescue leia from her cell on the death star the audience learns lot about all four characters in the ways they react the immediate problems and each other there is no comparable sequence in the phantom menace flesh out the characters and their relationships each other individually they are interesting characters clear motivations and interests but lucas develops little chemistry or tension between the them this is perhaps the most glaring weakness of this and is probably the reason it has disappointed many reviewers but despite the need for richer dialogue and stronger character interaction the is still very engaging many of the wonderful elements of lucas previous films make the phantom menace both memorable and entertaining first of course is the remarkably rich and imaginative universe lucas creates the characters visit magical underwater cities evade dinosaursized sea monsters fight battle droids and menacing destroyers on venetianlooking planet of naboo watch spectacular event part romanchariot race part nascar circuit on the arid desert planet of tatooine then head corsucant the gothic urban capital of the republic and home the galactic senate and the jedi council each location is elaborate and complex lucas never settles for vague ideas about the look of his settings he creates rich spectacular landscapes palaces and skylines most of the new special effects in his rereleased special edition trilogy in were changes that allowed him give the earlier movies the look and feel that just were not possible when the films were made more than ever in this new lucas universe is filled menagerie of creatures robots personalities and supporting cast of aliens who interact the main characters the best such character is watto greedy tatooine junk dealer who owns anakin and his mother as slaves watto has scratchy italian voice and short paunchy body oddly mismatched wings that flutter like hummingbird as he floats around the room of all the computergenerated characters in the watto is the best done and most enjoyable speaking of computergenerated characters no review of the phantom menace is complete without mentioning the most controversial figure in the jar jar binks more than minutes of screen time jar jar is the realization of george lucas dream include fully computergenerated character into the cast of the new trilogy jar jar clumsy amphibian and member of the gungan race literally stumbles his way into the path of the jedi knights early in the and becomes qui jons accidental sidekick jar jar usually performs comicrelief role in the lightening scenes his mishaps and inability stay out of trouble the animation of jar jar is nearly seamless and he interacts the characters throughout the as if he were really on the set the actors however despite the technological magic that makes his character possible jar jar is not completely convincing he still moves and sounds too much like cartoon blend into scene throughout the movie jar jar never transcends roger rabbit like presence you accept that he is there but you never lose sight of the fact that he is an animated character initially found jar jar annoying but grew enjoy the humor he added the on my second viewing of the jar jar was lot of fun and did not mind him at all second reason this continues the fine tradition of star wars movies is that the is replete humor and small details that flesh out the world lucas creates despite all the films struggles between good and evil and the sober musings about ones destiny and the force like all star wars films the phantom menace never takes itself too seriously fortunately lucas has not lost sight of the fact that his films are entertainment not high art from the bumbling jar jar oneman twoheaded announcer team calling the action at the films thrilling podrace sequence cameo appearance t in the the phantom menace is simply lot of fun lots of halfhidden jokes and humor that can easily be missed and finally the phantom menace works because as in all his films there is no shortage of speed and action from beginning end there are lightsaber battles hairraising chases and thrilling duels between good and evil the podrace sequence on tatooine is one of the most entertaining and exciting scenes in any star wars and the final showdown between obiwan quigon and darth maul is arguably the best choreographed most thrilling fight sequence lucas has filmed the phantom menace will not win any major oscars it probably will not beat titanics box office record and it is not even the best star wars would put it third after the original and the empire strikes back but it is an exciting and entertaining far better than your typical summer blockbuster the cannot live up it is hype no not even the original star wars could have done that but it is still worth seeing probably more than once

the premise is simple if not bizarre mad scientist trace beaulieu as dr clayton forrester launches an averagejoe michael nelson as mike nelson into space where he forces his subject watch the most horrendous movies ever made why it is torturous it is maniacal and it is just plain fun based on the cultfavorite cable television series mystery science theater the movie is not torturous but as for being maniacal and just plain fun it foots the bill quite nicely mike nelson on dogbone shaped spacecraft spends his days as any young man would dream indulging in sarcasm and horseplay and seeing quite few movies the catch is these movies are not the movies he chooses but retched examples of filmmaking chosen specifically dr forrester in an attempt break mikes will live dr forrester is convinced that one too many movies is all it will take ruin man but couple of wisecracking puppet buddies tom servo voiced kevin murphy and crow robot voiced beaulieu the torture becomes somewhat of honorary party for all that is wrong in the world of cheezy cinema the purpose behind mstk is exploit some of the worst films known even if very few of us man we watch as the silhouettes of mike tom and crow sit in darkened theater poking fun at the movie going on before them in this case it is the scifi this island earth we basically watch as our three leads watch only we get the pleasure of eavesdropping on their hilarious commentary the plots behind the movies ripped apart are really quite irrelevant but for the sake of those who might want know will explain this one this island earth is the tale of two scientists man and woman who wind up aboard spaceship whose crew intends destroy the earth together the two fight survive as well as save their home planet make mstk work the filmwithinthefilm naturally has be as horrible as possible and although the tvseries introduced us several worse films than this island earth it is bad enough flick bring about some hysterical cruelty mstk does not actually contain the complete this island earth is short minutes but this is step very wisely taken as funny as some of their observations are it can only go so long occasional breaks from this island earth also help the tremendously although it takes second get back into the right mode after this premise has been left for moment it is better than overkilling the whole concept post haste mstk lovers will likely hail the greatly but if you do not know what you are in for it could be jarring disappointment although thought the sharp wit of this was worth three stars it is movie be seen on home video late at night when your brain is not functioning full capacity anyway and large saracastic crowd new years at midnight for example is when saw it warning although mstk has more its end credits than most the three leads use the credits poke some more fun they are actually more annoying than most the name slandering and asinine oneliners were extremely unfunny and after laughing for about minutes straight it put heavy damper on the overall experience most people will likely stay see what the smartalecs have say but for me it almost ruined an otherwise good

any movie about the underground music scene is difficult beast master any meaning found in the underground is usually lost the dumbingdown of the experience make it more accessible the general public or the is produced and directed people that have about enough understanding of the subject matter that they ought work as production assistants for vh human traffic new exploring the british underground partyrave scene and the people immersed in the world of clubbing pubbing drugs sex and the beautiful beautiful music is an example of how it really ought be done the follows five brits in their young twenties during wild weekend of parties drugs dancing sex pop culture discussions relationships and wanking off in front of mirror while mum interrupts the cast of character consists of jip john simm our narrator who has bit of problem his willy known as mr floppy koop shaun parkes our black dj maestro who has insecurity issues afraid his girlfriend nina nicola reynolds is shagging other men nina herself cannot stand her mcjob and longs for the freedom of the weekends lulu lorraine pilkington jips best mate is tired of her cheating boyfriends and moff danny dyer cannot seem escape the black hole of his awful life the follows these five individuals during one weekend as each of them discovers love friendship and selffulfillment all against the raging party background human traffic is proof that cinema can still tell us deep stories while being visually alive as director justin kerrigans subtle use of the camera lets the audience become part of the action the use of direct communication the audience the collection of characters works well making the viewer the subconscious mind for the characters dialogue is crisp and moves an even pace and the acting is confident however the two females leads tend promote their relationships and dialogue bit of unneeded urgency that shows through when poignancy is needed human traffic does not try explain the rave scene instead it gives the audience the ability listen the people inside it letting you choose your own convictions about this powerful musical movement that brings together strangers friends and lovers for one blissful night of music and peace

steve martin took an extended vacation from all facets of moviemaking few years back he spent this time writing essays and short stories for the new yorker several of wound up in his hilarious hardback compilation pure drivel much of the book spares tinseltown from mockery although he does riff on the racist comments made marlon brando during larry king interview in fine chapter called in search of the wily filipino now as writer and star of bowfinger he offers the masses plenty of good reasons not pursue career in the cinema perhaps finally venting the frustrations everything being made now is crap that led his brief retirement from martin stars as bobby bowfinger roger cormanwannabe on the cusp of fifty and desperate for some success as producer quality of the projects be damned his accountant adam aleximalle proposes movie called chubby rain about aliens who travel earth in raindrops slightly fatter than regular raindrops bowfinger latches onto the idea immediately and convinces his troupe of actor friends appear in the based on the lie that americas top box office draw kit ramsey murphy has agreed star ramsey of course wants nothing do such lowgrade material so bowfinger on the thinking that action stars need run not speak decides photograph the superstar surreptitiously he sends his cast members who are not in on it either they are told ramsey hates the sight of cameras and fraternizing his costars ramseys table at restaurants asks them follow him in parking lots etc spouting script dialogue all the while shooting the outcome from great distance the paranoid ramsey flees the scene nearly every time ramsey is member of mind head cultish selfhelp organization apparently dedicated recruiting celebrities as if that is not familiar enough mind head guru terry stricter terence stamp has been dressed and combed resemble ron hubbard founder of scientology when he goes mind head tales of caucasian strangers appearing from nowhere babble white code in his face they fear the nervous breakdown of an important client and rush him off retreat requiring bowfinger find standin murphy will probably win more fans as jiff ramseys adorable ignoramus double than as kit but it is his portrayal of the latter that took courage always surrounded an entourage suffering from racial inferiority complex murphy plays right into the tabloid image of himself furthermore consider the enemies he will make of popular scientologists pacing stricters neutralcoloured office as if on an amphetamine binge and stripped of his bigshot veneer ramsey is asked shout inane personal affirmations repeatedly murphys scenes stamp are exactly what imagine of john travolta clearing not that murphy is entirely responsible for this schtick bowfinger is steve martins invention his script is surprisingly clever as satire given that the pseudoreligion is sitting duck as is the entire los angeles industry the griffin milltypes take quite beating in the form of robert downey jr as bigwig jerry renfro martins decision tell the story from bottom feeders point of view is what keeps it fresh and innovativenever have we seen on screen group of people struggle this hard complete motion picture as expected there are laughs only be had insiders or buffs such as martins crew of mexican borderjumpers who gain unexpected appreciation for the classics from reading cahiers du cinema or martins nonsensical explanation dave his loyal cinematographer jamie kennedy that every movie in the end has budget of twothousand dollars most of bowfinger is universally funny however defy any viewer keep straight face when christine baranski one of our brightest comediennes is on screen bowfingers main flaw is plot twist that has an insubstantial aftermath we are also asked believe that few simple closeups of kit ramsey would redeem chubby rain zgrade entertainment that would make ed wood blush this aspect of bowfinger has much in common the ludicrous oscar sequence in ozs last directorial effort the poorly conceived in out these are significant enough weaknesses that they distracted from my enjoyment of the piece as mentioned at the start of this review bowfinger offers solid reasons not do what heather grahams character daisy does hop bus in search of stardom that said it offers one fantastic reason get on that bus the sense of community between filmmakers who gel is awesome martin gets sentimental storys end as he did in a story and how could he not for those who can hack it the movies might be the greatest business in the world

from the man who presented us henry the portrait of serial killer comes wild tale set within the elite and white trash of floridas south coast plot guidance counselor dillon is accused of raping one of his students she happens be the daughter of one of the wealthiest women in florida the counselor is brought court on the charges as another white trash girl campbell also joins the rape fingerpointing club as the story unfolds we find that many things are not exactly as they seem that is as much as could say without ruining anything critique good little flick that slows down at certain points and runs tad long but generates enough twists and turns keep most people interested throughout mind you could see many people not liking it because it takes one too many twists and turns but hey happen like that kind of thing and besides the twists and turns in this movie managed remain within the realm of believability or scathingly close and even explained many of its turns showcase of missed scenes during the credit crawl at the end of the do not leave the theatre before you see the credits it really does clear up some stuff other than that the acting was good campbell transforming her good girl stereotypical role into potsmoking gothlooking white trash chick out for good time denise richards from starship troopers fame solidifies herself as hollywoods jellydonut pinup girl of the moment and proves that all breast implants need not lead lawsuits bacon is solid and so is dillon while continuing prove his inability age the whole wide wondering world sprinkle the story bunch shots of alligators peeking through the swamp waters bacon showing the world the size of his dingdong do we really need see this couple of lesbian kissing scenes and menageatrois and you have got yourself decent time at the movie theatre on the down side the soundtrack was not as prominent or slick as thought it would be and theresa russell real name theresa paup seems have lost her way in every way possible ooooh almost forgot bill murrays exquisite role as the downtrodden lawyer who agrees defend dillon in court murray actually added that extra little spice of humour that allowed this affirm its position as quirky little noirish tale of sex greed and mystery little known facts neve campbell specified nonnudity clause in her contract she is also born in guelph ontario go hoser director john mcnaughton says he deleted scene that would have shown matt dillon and kevin bacon showering together as it was gratuitous kevin bacon plays in band his brother called the bacon brothers is married actress kyra sedgwick and has game based on him called six degrees of kevin bacon

how many of us would become strippers for those of us who would not is it moral reason or purely lack of confidence that is probably not fair question and for lot of us it could very well be for neither of those reasons as you watch the full monty however you may begin asking yourself these kinds of questions would you be willing grin and bare it bring in some much needed dough in case you have not guessed the full monty is about stripping but striptease it as not it is actually quite charming comedy that uses its ideas great deal of tact and sophistication it is the story of six outofwork outofshape blue collar brits whose recent job losses have left the boys penniless but not without need what do it hits our main character gaz robert carlyle as he notices the large crowds of women who pour into local male strip club on regular basis it seems that simple take it off and bring in the cash eventually gaz is able convince his friends join him in starting their own exotic dance routine despite their initial reluctance these include the overweight confidencelacking dave mark addy the uptight overlyofficious gerald tom wilkinson the once suicidal lomper steve huison and two additional fellows who gain their place among the group audition horse paul barber an older gentlemen chock full of graceless energy and guy hugo speer young wellendowed looker who compares himself cary grant when the sextet is complete we are given hefty dose of physical comedy we watch the bumbling middleaged men choreograph pseudosexy dance numbers all the while proving why none of them were strippers in the first place as if there antiappeal was not enough they decide boost interest in the group promising the full monty on opening night for us americans means baring it all and mean all the movie actually ends on opening night hilarious applause worthy ending might add it is sure leave nothing short of big smile on your face as you leave the theater the subject matter you might not expect the fully monty be such feelgood almost inspiring but it surprisingly turns out that way the amount of light touching drama also comes as nice surprise never feeling offbalance from the otherwise highly upbeat moments of the there is lot more this movie than you might think in other words and the ensemble cast could not be better each character is completely individual interesting funny and most importantly real the full monty is never offensive very impressive attribute since its subject matter alone could have easily fallen prey tastelessness it is one of those movies that is best described as solid piece of entertainment perfect for great night on the town or as saturday night movie rental either way you see it it should not let you down in the slightest and pun heavily intended when it is all said and done you will be smiling from cheek cheek

director dominic sena who made the highly underrated kalifornia and producer jerry bruckheimer the rock armageddon bring us slick and entertaining remake of the of the same name that absolutely no one has ever seen nicolas cage plays memphis retired car thief who is pulled back in the business an evil car thief overlord christopher eccleston determined kill memphis kid brother giovanni ribisi memphis is ordered steal cars in four days time or his brother will meet an unfortunate demise all while having elude the detectives hot on his trail and rival car thief who feels the job should have been given him and his gang memphis sets out put his old crew back together but discovers that most of them have retired as well gone in sixty seconds does things right from the opening credits in that sequence we get rockin little tune from moby along some simple back story told only photographs and assorted objects filmmakers can sometimes make or break just from its opening title sequence and this one easily gets you in the mindset for an entertaining ride and what follows does not disappoint cage turns in one of his good performances here he can easily go either way good or bad do not know how he does that and his mannerisms and dialogue delivery carry the along nicely of the supporting cast members angelina jolie as memphis former love is in the just provide eye candy she is definitely the hottest looking grease monkey have ever seen and robert duvall as memphis former mentor is just around lend the some class also am big fan of will patton armageddon the postman and would love see him get huge role someday none of these three performers are given much do unfortunately some underrated performers however are given meaty supporting roles delroy lindo get shorty shines as the exasperated detective in pursuit of memphis as does timothy olyphant go as lindos partner just wish some of the other characters could have been as important the only real gripe have about the though is its conclusion mainly because you know how it will end before the opening credits even roll there is no doubt in anyones mind that the cars will be successfully stolen and the filmmakers blew perfectly good opportunity add some suspense the picture using the rival car thief plot line as it stands that story line is wrapped up about halfway through the in tidy little package but if was making this would have had the rival gang trying get the cars before memphis and his crew thereby making memphis have improvise thereby adding some meat the plot the finale is essentially just big car chase and there just are not ways make car chases interesting anymore it is all been done the chase is also shot and edited in that jerry bruckheimer action sequence kind of way that leaves the audience wondering what specifically is going on in the scene sure it is car chase but what exactly are the particulars of it it is very hard tell finally there is stunt during this scene that comes close challenging the bus jumping the ramp sequence from speed in the oh do not think so department despite those minor complaints gone in sixty seconds is pure summer movie entertainment it is not thought provoking but it is shiny loud and fun just what summer flick should be pg

books could be and indeed have been written about the star wars trilogy and rightfully so this is set of movies that shattered all expectations of what science fiction could be in the late searly inspiring literally dozens of clones from battlestar galactica all the way up stargate and independance day and one could argue revitalizing the whole science fiction genre the special effects were groundbreaking revolutionary for their day and still eminently watchable well into twenty years later literally millions of people have seen the star wars trilogy and been touched it and now george lucas brings it back for new audience enjoy much has been and is still being made of the fact that mr lucas has gone back and revised his trilogy for rerelease now some fans are angry that he has dared meddle what they consider perfection while others are thrilled the idea of seeing yesterdays star wars updated todays special effects wizardry either way the special edition release means that star wars is back on the big screen where it rightfully deserves be seen can there be anyone in the world who does not know what star wars is about in way star wars is so much part of our cultural heritage that it feels silly and almost artificial try summarize it it is story about young mans coming of age fight for freedom against an oppressive empire tale of swashbuckling and derringdo the likes of have not been seen on the silver screen in decades strange new worlds strange alien creatures and weird surprises around every turn and the yearning within each of us realize our dreams and make difference in the world it is high adventure incredible special effects and well it is just an _experience_ something about this movie sparked the imagination of generation and it is about do so again this new release of star wars comes as no surprise many of the films devoted fans who have been trading rumors and bits of information about it for quite some time now interviews trailers leaks from within lucasfilm all of these have been collected collated and placed on webpages for people see pages such as http www islandnet comcoronafilmsdetailssw html or my personal favorite http leopard cs latrobe edu aukoukoula pictures of before and after have been placed side side even months before the movies were released fans were making comparisons in some cases the changes were nothing less than phenomenal and this can be seen from the comparison shots even before you go into the movie theater the digital matte effects that were little more than toy in forrest gump are put excellent use here unnoticeably sprucing up scenes that that george lucas was unsatisfied in the original for instance in my personal favorite example the ancient temple on yavin that was formerly flat stone edifice now has deep mosscovered carvings and etchings and mos eisley spaceport is now bustling booming city more surprises and things going on in the background than you can notice on the first viewing all the starships and fighters are now computeranimated getting rid of glitches and artifacts of the special effects processes used when the was originally madeand they look _fantastic_ four and half minutes of new or missing footage have been added including scene jabba the hutt that had originally been shelved because the state of special effects in simply could not do it justice however much of the ten million dollars that was spent on the star wars special edition restoration went into restoring the quality of the itself the negatives badly damaged the ravages of time were brightened and returned their original splendor the audio tracks were remixed and reprocessed reworked sound effects effects maven ben burtt into glorious booming theatershaking fullthx dolby digital stereo and _that_ more than the added scenes or new special effects is where the real value of this new version lies it is really true what they say in the commercials star wars loses _so much_ on the small screen even letterboxing does not make up for the decrease in size and definition in regard the star wars special edition and the other two films of the trilogy have yet be released will make this final recommendation go and see it go and see it more than once it may be another twenty years before it comes back the big screen after it is gone this time take along the youngsters who have never had the bigscreen star wars experienceyou will enjoy seeing it through their eyes as much as they will enjoy it for the first time there is magic in this moviespecial edition or no there can be no denying that it is still star wars and still has the power thrill and enthrall children of all ages from four four hundred let us all return that time long ago and that galaxy far far away

eddie murphy has had his share of ups and downs during his career known for his notorious late slump murphy has still managed bounce back handful of hits in the past few years the exception of the dreadful holy man he appears be on pace for fullfledged comeback life was great move on the part of murphy and costar martin lawrence because it is great showcase for both actors that never resorts slapsticky drivel director ted demme is smart enough realize that the two comedians can generate enough genuine laughs on their own and does not insert distracting plot back them up life is in sense one great balancing act murphy on one end and lawrence on the other amazingly the scale never tips in eithers favor due the marvelous chemistry and wonderful contrast that each actor allows the other as the movie opens we are introduced ray gibson eddie murphy twotiming pickpocket who schmoozes his way into club there he meets successful businessman named claude banks martin lawrence somehow after multiple contrivances the mismatched pair find themselves on their way mississippi on moonshine run when all is said and done ray and claude have been framed for murder that was actually committed the town sheriff hence the setting of life mississippi state prison where the main characters come realize their unlikely friendship is important and become set on finding an foolproof escape plan the takes us from the all the way the presenting difficult task in showing how the aging process affects ray and claude luckily rick baker handles the makeup effects of the two actors in fantastic academy award caliber manner not only do we believe the characters look as if they are years old but they sound like it too murphy and lawrence are completely convincing in the lead roles even as crotchety old cons bickering over game of cards this is just one of the pleasant surprises that the has tucked up it is sleeve while the ads are marketing life as straight arrow comedy there is hefty amount of dramatic material hidden at it is core but the comedic aspects work wonderfully wisely drawing strength from the talents of the two stars the movie is more of comedy than it is drama but in both senses it is an overwhelming delight could say few bad things about the movie but do not want it is such nice surprise such great vehicle for eddie murphy and martin lawrence that it warrants huge smile as the credits begin roll

cinematically speaking gordon parks original _shaft_ is not great bit slow at times and more than little rough around the edges as it builds its climactic explosion of violent action this spirited but formulaic yarn that initially brought ernest tidymans black private dick that is sex machine all the chicks the big screen hardly qualifies as groundbreaking filmmaking yet nearly years after its original releaseand long after the genre it spawned blaxploitation died that decadethe _shaft_ remains an extremely entertaining watch never having completely escaped pop culture consciousness the reason for this is the same one that explains the films connection moviegoers far beyond the target africanamerican audience the title character of john shaft while the fact that the strong smart virile and superbly suave shaft is black is the primary factor for his historical and cultural significance his broadbased appeal stems from an idea that transcends race he is comfortable confident and proud about who he is and anyone who had problem that could simply kiss his ass this fact also explains why john singletons yg revival of john shaft is as enjoyable as it is much like the that started the franchise this _shaft_s plot does not score points in the originality department but the energy level and smooth attitude distinguishes it from standard crime thrillers contrary what has been reported over the past few months this _shaft_ is not remake of the original but more of sequelspinoff the star audiences know and love from the original and its first two sequels _shafts_big_score _ and _shaft_in_africa_ richard roundtree once again plays john shaft who still runs private investigation firm in new york city however the focus of the lies on his samenamed nephew samuel jackson who as the begins is cop whose takenocrap demeanor constantly leaves him at odds his superiors when privileged young man named walter wade jr christian bale accused of brutal raciallymotivated murder is allowed be released on bail disgusted shaft leaves the force and decides take matters into his own hands as p but that is easier said than done for also standing in the way of shaft and his way of justice is peoples hernandez jeffrey wright dominican gangster who is hired walter rub out waitress diane palmieri toni collette the only eyewitness his crime peoplesor rather wright is also the big obstacle in jacksons way toward commanding this peoples is more of an outrageous comic character for most of the running time and wright is insanely funny during these stages however he is not so funny as make the character come off as goofy and buffoonish and peoples eventual turn more serious villainy is seamless and believable probably would not have been the case had he been played original casting choice john leguizamo who bowed out before filming it is no easy task steal from the jackson who is his usual captivating charismatic self here but that is exactly what wright doesand makes it seem effortless then again such talented ensemble surrounding him it is not too surprising that jacksons impressive star turn does not quite tower over the rest he is strongly complemented not only wright but all his other costars bale has already proven his ability play an uppity killer in _american_psycho_ so it only follows that his performance as similar less exaggerated character would be spoton collette lends the some convincing and welcome dramatic weight as the frightened conflicted diane busta rhymes brings some good laughs as shafts sidekick rasaan registering not as stronglybut through no fault of their ownare vanessa williams as tough narcotics cop carmen vasquez and dismayingly underused roundtree they simply are given little do in the script credited richard price singleton and shane salerno jackson also has little do in sense some throwaway footage during the opening credits aside his shaft does not even have one sex scene that singleton once again proves his ability actors is an especially good thing since he is not really an action director this is not say that he does bad job the numerous gunfights and the requisite foot and car chases they move well as does the as whole and are reasonably exciting it is just that there is nothing terribly inventive about them these set pieces are functional in the way the script is they work well enough but they are unsurprising and conventional but if there is anything that _shaft_ movie does well it is make the familiar look cooland this _shaft_ keeps that tradition alive from the slick title sequencescored of course isaac hayes everinfectious oscarwinning theme song singleton wisely sprinkles throughout the filmon the looks great and easily sweeps the viewer into its world its energetic bravado even common visual trick such as employing fancy wipes for scene transitions not only feels unforced it feels necessary style does not exactly make for great but when it comes _shaft_ that is of little consequence what matters above all else is having good time and the latest _shaft_ should be just the first of many fun rides be had this bad muthashut your mouth

uncompromising french director robert bressons lancelot of the lake achieves the exact opposite effect of sir thomas malorys morte darthur instead of enshrining the legend of king arthur and his knights of the round table it dethrones them revealing arthur as weak ineffectual leader and the knights as group of jealous bickering men who failed live up the legends prescribed them chivalry has no place in lancelot of the lake except as that of dying ideal bresson begins his tale as the knights of the round table are returning decimated after failing merlins command retrieve the holy grail the mystical cup that was filled christs blood bresson immediately gives us his impression of the essential meaning of the grail quest bloodshed and failure the opening sequence is series of clumsy disjointed fights amongst anonymous knights head is hacked off stomach is impaled skull is split open skeletal remains hang from trees and burning bodies smolder in the ruins of flaming house since the starts camelot in nearruin and takes only an hour and half arrive at its inevitable conclusion it does not carry the grand tragic resonance of other arthurian films we never get see camelot at the peak of its power therefore there is no real downfall witness but then again it is not the name of camelot that is evoked in the title of the rather it is lancelot and bresson is more interested in the internal battle within his heart than the external downfall of kingdom lancelot has always been tragic figure in the arthurian tales and bresson uses him as the central figure explore the battle between the spirit and the flesh the greatest of all knights he was flawed only in his love for arthurs wife queen guinevere and it was that illicit affair that eventually caused the downfall of camelot even when lancelot attempts end the affair guinevere laura duke condominas he only finds himself falling back into her arms against his better judgment he knows it means the destruction of the idealized kingdom but he is powerless in his passion when sir mordred patrick bernhard accuses lancelot of the affair other knights including sir gawain humbert balsan spring lancelots defense it is this battle within the knights that is the eventual undoing of the round table the flesh wins out over the spirit and the consequences are dire bresson is an intensely personal filmmaker most interested in the interiors of mens hearts and minds lancelot of the lake is filled his particular trademarks strippeddown minimalist style flat expressionless dialogue and grand use of natural sounds in place of music he uses background music only twice in the during an opening narration segment and during the opening credits the music here is heavy drumbeat and accompanying bagpipes but the rest of the is scored natural sounds that punctuate the films thematic elements the incessant clanking and creaking of heavy armor the neighing of horses the rhythm of hooves beating down dirt roads and the natural chirping and whispering of the forest like most of his other films bresson employed nonprofessional actors who recite the dialogue in emotionless flat voices all the actors he used in lancelot of the lake had never acted before and the exception of patrick bernhard they never acted again never once do they raise their voices or put any emphasis on given word instead of using vocal inflection bresson strove create emotion through images in some ways this technique works in other ways it does not the final montage of arthurs men battling each other is quite marvelous and the final image of the knights in shining armor reduced literal scrappile sums up the entire in one moment however other times bressons uncompromising methods are distracting and questionable for instance during an important jousting contest bresson films the majority of the action so that the only things visible are the horses legs he does this repeatedly opening each shot the same few notes from bagpipe and the raising of different flag while there might be symbolic value in this the resulting experience of watching it can be bothersome nevertheless lancelot of the lake is fascinating cinematic experience boldly made master filmmaker bressons style may not be for everyone but one has respect his strength as an artist reevaluating the arthurian legends and making them his own he turns lancelot of the lake into something rare in modern cinema truly personal

capsule the best place start if you are jackie chan newcomer roars along never stops for breath and frequently hilarious talk about jackie chan as stuntman is miss million things jackie is not only one of the most accomplished and fearsomely unafraid physical adepts on the screen today but also very funny guy he reminds me of the way arnold schwartzenegger used make me laugh he is funny just standing there copping look supercop has jackie making us laugh scream duck root and gasp for breath often all in the same scene it is actually the third in loosely related series of movies each jackie playing kevin chan hong kong policeman who has knack for getting neckdeep into trouble and then karatekicking his way out of it the others are also worth seeing it is little slow start but once it gets moving it is field day the movie has fairly sophisticated plot for movies of this kind kevin is tapped for dangerous dea assignment be accomplished in mainland china requires him collaborate the attractive and asskicking chief fo chinese security played here the everenjoyable michelle yeoh there is fun chemistry between the two of them especially in an early scene where she tries brief him and he keeps making wondering comments about how great she looks in that uniform kevin is assigned help spring known gangster from jail all undercover of course and have him lead the two of them noted drug boss the drug boss however has problems of his own his wifes on trial for many of his own crimes and she is got the key an account all of his drug funds this means of course endless trouble not the least of is that kevin bumps into his girlfriend while he is out in the field and she sees him this other woman and but that is one of the movies unique pleasures the way it crosses from action comedy effortlessly action there is of course nonstop action in this movie everything from oneonone kung fu allout gun battles sppedboat eight engines outrunning the hong kong coast guard there
