is also virtuoso climax features among other things jackie danging from ladder tied helicopter wrongway freeway chase requires michelle do an awesomely difficult handstand stunt fight on top of moving train that also involves the copter as well as motorcycle you get the idea this is action movies what burger everything on it is fast food quick enjoyable filling watch it friends when they stop making movies like this the world will be tad greyer

the calendar year has not even reached its midway point but that has not prevented columbia pictures from trotting out lavish period drama more befitting of the winter oscarbait season bille augusts highprofile adaptation of victor hugos classic les miserables delivers everything one would expect from classy epichandsome production values strong performances topnotch cast literate screenplaywith one critically missing element emotional sweep for those not familiar hugos original novel or the hit stage musical it inspired the hook of les miserables essentially boils down something like thcentury frenchset version of the fugitive after serving years in prison work camp for stealing loaf of bread the brutish jean valjean liam neeson is paroled immediately upon release he steals valuable silverware from kindly bishop who takes him in for night he is caught authorities only be forgiven the bishop who lets valjean keep the silver start new life on the straight and narrow that he does and in doing so breaks his parole sets the obsessively determined inspector javert geoffrey rush who was one of the guards in valjeans prison camp on his trail thematically however les miserables is story about redemption valjean finds through his dealings two women the hardluck factoryworkerturnedprostitute fantine uma thurman and her illegitimate daughter cosette years after breaking parole valjean becomes mayor of the town of vigau where he forms warm friendship fantine after saving her from an unjust arrest javert valjean promises the gravely ill fantine he will rescue the young cosette mimi newman from her cruel caretakers the thenardiers and raise the child as his own the father and daughter eventually land in paris where the teenage cosette claire danes falls for dashing student revolutionary marius hans matheson the decadesspanning story is the stuff that cinematic epics are made of and the danish august turns in his most accomplished englishlanguage work following the underrated superstar soap the house of the spirits and last years stylish but highly preposterous mystery smillas sense of snow he and screenwriter rafael yglesias bring the sprawling tale into clear focus and keep the events moving at brisk pace production designer anna asp costume designer gabriella pescucci and cinematographer jorgen persson give les miserables sumptuous period look whose accomplishment is mostly matched the efforts of the cast neeson is commanding yet endearingly vulnerable rushs finely modulated menace is far more rewarding than his overrated oscarwinning theatrics in shine and thurman disappears nicely into her highly unglamorous role the younger members of the cast fare less well danes is convincing as cosette but her overdone lip quivering during her crying scenes becomes distraction and matheson while competent is less interesting robert sean leonard as technically adept and cerebrally engaging the is the time les miserables was over my emotions had only been superficially involved while was touched valjeans relationships fantine and cosette was not moved not even reaching the touching level is the cosettemarius pairing my only previous experience les miserables is the musical as am sure many others is and was dismayed see eponine friend of mariuss who selflessly dies in the name of her unspoken love for him almost completely jettisoned from this adaptation the daughter of the thenardiers here she is only briefly seen as child her presence would have added some muchneeded conflict and emotional heft the youthful romance but suppose august and yglesias felt one tragic heroine fantine was enough even so as creeps into summer blockbuster season les miserables is thoughtful wellmade entertaining one that will sate moviegoers hungry for dose of drama before popcorn nobrainers invade the multiplex

an entertaining hours awaits the audience in this set in the early sevigny and beckinsale play disco chicks alice and charlotte who are on the lookout for love alice is mousy shy intellectual charlotte is bitchy outgoing and fun we join their adventures as they go through variety of adventures and men all the background of the local disco whit stillman has both written and directed an interesting and believable story alice and charlotte are both well written characters and the actresses who play them are not bad aswell sevigny delivers an honest performance and makes the audience feel for her character beckinsale plays extreme bitch personified yet her character never becomes completely unlikeable the huge supporting cast also play part in making sure this movie is thoroughly entertaining the dialogue is sharp and well written many funny set pieces for example there is great discussion about lady the tramp the main characters the disco tunes playing in the background also make sure that this admittedly long is good fun the direction is good bringing out the drama and comedy in the scenes but their are slight flaws the movie firstly although it is supposedly set in the the characters are very very the way they dress and act have very feel them although the male hairstyles look slightly frankly the atmosphere just was not conveyed is shame also as mentioned above the is too long and some parts do lag the charm of the characters do help these moments but generally the editing could of been bit tighter the plot also sidetracks into silly cocaine dealing bust seemed out of place in this movie finally their are almost too many characters in the and despite the running time the never really spends enough time on them some of the characters are very slight is shame the conclusion while funny is also surprisingly weak and certainly not strong enough but despite these qualms the last days of disco is funny warm movie is certainly worth seeing and is fitting homage the disco era of the worth look overall rating review david wilcock you know for kids norville barnes

gordon fleming peter mullan is in bind he has new unexpected baby and his business hazardous material removal is in danger of going under when he and his crew get job opportunity at the longabandoned danvers state hospital he underbids the competition secure the contract and promises get the threeweek job done in one it will prove be fateful week for them all in session gordo gets the job remove asbestos and other hazardous materials from the spooky old mental hospital in preparation for relocating town offices there their guided tour of the facility local official bill giggs paul guilfoyle brings them through some of the creepier parts of the former asylum but job is job and if they finish in week as promised there is bonus in store as they get down their work things normal and not so normal begin happen gordon hears disembodied voice beckoning him phil david caruso is conflicted working guy hank josh lucas who is seeing his old girlfriend mike coscreenwriter steven gevedon has discovered cache of audiotapes and transcripts from old psychiatric sessions hence the title inmate mary hobbs multipersonality patient dark secret gordos nephew jeff brendan sexton iii suffers from night phobia and is afraid venture into the dark bowels of the hospital as the agreed upon week draws an end hank mysteriously disappears from the workplace after nocturnal confrontation someone something in the hospital tensions mount and distrust build among the rest as they watch their chance for the bonus start slip away but there is more much more at stake as the hospital and its history of insanity weigh on them all do not want give away too much of the story of session so will stop there what we have here is spooky horror flick that uses none of the jumpoutatyoufromthedark cheap shots that have become part and parcel horror films since the advent of halloween and friday the thirteenth there is no cat leaping out of the dark or the shock of suddenly seeing oneself in strategically placed mirror the exception of one shadowy and chilling image at one point spooky interlude in the there is little that you can get your arms around as far as what specifically is frightening as watched session became aware of the subtle things that built up during the story that make it true horror movie the striking highdefinition video camera work uta briesewitz who worked the director brad anderson on his next stop wonderland helps build up tension closeups fluid camera movement and odd angles in way that would make alfred hitchcock proud music too is used intense effect joining the camera make simple scenes frightening even horrifying couple these tech feats an intelligent story that uses elements of the shining the blair witch project and even the texas chainsaw massacre and you get decent intriguing horror flick additionally the brilliant decision shoot at danvers state hospital gives the another starring character the institution itself lends even more chills the equation acting is another factor that raises session above the usual dreck presented in recent horror hits like scream know what you did last summer and their sequels those films took goodlooking though generic young actors and actresses and put them use build up body count substituting mayhem for real horror anderson opted instead use mature experienced actors like peter mullan and david caruso fill his characters shoes and the difference in casting quality is notable mullan in particular puts an arc on his character gordon as the troubled guy who slowly and inexorably falls under the pressures of family job and finally danvers state hospital the rest of the small cast fit the bill as people not just fodder for the mayhem david caruso as gordos senior man and near equal in the business shows just how good an actor he is he made the jump from tvs nypd blue far too soon and his decisions in the roles he took will never forget the horrendous jade were less than star making he rolls his sleeves up and does the job well here gevedon lucas and sexton are more than fodder too the only problem session lay in the uninspired ending it takes on fairly conventional finale that covers old ground and is bit of disappointment after the terrific and inspired build up the pleasure is getting there and wish that anderson and gevedon had kept up the steam they had so ably built during the bulk of the session is an unusual feat it is scary does not use cheap tricks and raises goose bumps its intelligently rendered subtle horror because of the local interest of danvers it should do well the northeast crowd hope it gets the national distribution it deserves give it b

the latest epos from lars is blast although rather moody one this lovestory is situated in small town in the rough dreary cliffs in the vestern part of scotland in the something the church calvinistic is so strict that the church bells has been removed from the clocktower they are considered being too unrestrained in these surroundings we find the tobeweds jan and bess played stellan skarsgaard and the remarkable new movie actress emily watson jan is on leave from the oilrig and bess is just bess bit naive and innocent in every aspect of the word at first at the wedding party we are told an anecdote illustrating her infinite kindness she once lend bike an stranger her best friends bike however but bess is suffering in this scary religious society we soon take part in funeral where man fallen off the orthodox path is laid rest while doomed hell women are not allowed attend funerals or speak up in the church when the end of the honeymoon approaches we see bess idolizing jan in such an intend almost manic that her friends try calm her down bit the time has come when jan is return the rig bess is falling into the darkness of depression her yelling of grief and sorrow are heard above the breaking of the waves she cannot stand the thought of life without her husband we witness her dialogues god she speaks both parts paranoia convincing god return jan from the oilrig and her prayers are heard an accident on the rig bring him back paralysed from the neck and down now he cannot satisfy her need for physical love he try persuade her into finding lover the ulterior motive make her describe these affairs him in every detail at first she resist but her love for jan and his assurance that this will make him recover more rapidly make her comply imagine what this is doing the poor girl the story is cleverly divided into eight chapters parted beautiful pictures made danish artist per kirkeby accompanied music from the era procol harum deep purple trex and others the use of handheld camera and lack of any makeup make the characters solid and help separate this movie from others in the sentimental genre the incredible performance from the actors makes the movie brilliant though bit too gloomy for my taste would say that it is in the genre of betty blue le matin and bitter moon lunes de fiel emily watson as bess and katrin cartlidge as her best friend dodo deliver outstanding performances this must be the reason for giving it the grand prix du jury in cannes this year although we had hoped for the palme dor the screenplay is now available in print the transformation being made in the period from ultimo may july just in time for the danish premiere

anastasia contains something that has been lacking from all of the recent disney releases especially hercules emotion all the wacky characters voiced celebrities and fantastically animated adventure sequences are not going hold anyones interest unless there is an emotional core hold it all together not since disneys beauty the beast has there been such compelling animated interesting characters and drama that works the story of the romanov family the rulers of russia and their downfall begins the anastasia one of the daughters narrowly escapes the mad monk rasputin voiced christopher lloyd her grandmother voiced angela landsbury but anastasia gets lost and grows up no memory of her royal origins the grandmother lives in paris hoping someday find her beloved anastasia the only member of the family survive the russian revolution young woman named anya voiced meg ryan runs across dimitri john cusack and vlad kelsey grammar who are trying put together scheme create an anastasia fool the grandmother and get the reward money they pick anya pose as their princes and of course it is soon revealed that anya is in fact the lost anastasia dimitri realizes that he can never win her love as he is commoner and meanwhile rasputin is not dead and plots his revenge against the last romanov the plot is actually quite well structured there are lot of complexities that may have be explained the kids later but it moves along fast enough that they will never have time be bored what this really means is that the adults will not be bored it either there is great deal of banter between anya and dimitri that is very funny and their relationship develops quite naturally as the progresses there is of course lots of comedy for the kids including rasputins pet bat bartok hank azaria who is easily the funniest thing in the however the comical scenes never distract from the drama but are worked into the plot almost seamlessly the animation is gorgeous the characters seem come life through the talented animators not since beauty the beast have animated characters had so much life them even without the voices they act the musical number in paris is showstopper some of the backgrounds rendered in an impressionist painting style as all recent animated features there are songs however these songs do more than just provide fodder for top singers get on the radio although there are three of them during the end credits the songs are all very catchy and advance the plot instead of just being showpieces except for the paris number but that is so much fun it is okay cannot reccomend anastasia highly enough it is wonderful that ranks right up there other animated classics kids and adults alike will enjoy it and it is also nice have quality animated feature from another studio besides disney

i can hear the question already what on earth do these two movies have in common most people not lot except that both are renowned directors as saw them however both movies have flawed romantic scripts wrapped in distinctive packaging of lavish visuals musical numbers but oh how differently the packages affect their films while everyones production numbers make an otherwise ordinary woody tale something special jane campions imaginative visuals only serve emphasize how pompous and uninvolving laura jones script is left everyone says love you not remembering lot about who loved whom but its infectious happiness put grin on my face left the portrait of lady not remembering lot about who loved whom and could have cared less everyone features nothing allen has not done before storywise woody is again desperately in love beautiful woman roberts and against the odds they manage click for awhile before allen is left wondering what went wrongagain similar situations happen his family and friends some of the more outlandish comedy scenes even hark back his early funny films the scenes between tim roth and drew barrymore could have come out of take the money and run his directorial debut however nothing allen has ever done prepared me for this oneofakind display of sheer good spirits in fact in this movie the feeling itself is what is most important yes the movie would have been betteramong his very best thinkif it had meatier story but what it lacks in substance it makes up for in feeling and what better way express feeling than through music love is often best expressed in song and the numbers the cast break into here cut straight the heart some are tad too goofy such as the number where lot of ghosts prance around in funeral parlor but admired allen for even putting them in there it also helps that as usual allen has topflight cast working him their singing voices range from quite good goldie hawn not quite good allen literally unlistenable barrymore whose real voice was dubbed professional but while their vocal abilities differ all the actors do great job of putting joy up there on the screen and making it rub off on the audience granted some people will simply never accept characters singing in movies but for those attuned it this should work wonders jane campion too has topflight cast working for her in portrait of lady too but even their considerable skills can do nothing keep the from being stilted virtually lifeless mess albeit visually interesting one campion and her cinematographer stuart dryburgh come up great variety of eyefilling images that linger in the mind unfortunately what did not linger in the mind for me was the story the visuals were supposed be reflecting remember very well shots of train its light beaming and shots of men vanishing around nicole kidman but can remember very little of what happened between all these people even worse do not find myself feeling bad that have forgotten the problem think lies not the cast seemed be trying very hard for the material it was the script that could not convince me care about anyone the characters were putting out all kinds of emotion but found no reason connect any of them understood that the story was about cold emotionally vacant characters but for me care about them have identify them somehow and want them inject feeling into their lives jones script never simply gave me that opportunity in the end it almost seemed as if campion was trying inject some life of her own into the proceedings her visual flourishes unfortunately as she kept painting these dazzling pictures they only served push me further away from the material and remind me that there was no connection between me and the in the end the movies one strength ended up hurting it so here we have two films pretty uninteresting plots and yet was able truly enjoy one of them why both films my head cared about neither story but only everyone says love you was able make my heart sing

you have got think twice before you go see movie title like maximum risk the title is generic it is meaningless and cannot believe it is good business when you pick up the phone and dial how in the world are you supposed remember that the new jeanclaude van damme movie the one that looked kind of cool in the trailers and is directed some chinese hot shot is called geez maximum risk yuck the movie itself deserves your attention for sweet bloody thrills this one beats the summer blockbuster competition handsdown only mission impossible came close delivering as skillful thriller and will give maximum risk the edge simply because it is not as slick as the tom cruise picture and therefore more gratifying in its execution much my surprise van damme continues develop as pleasant unpretentious action hero his track record is not as solid as schwarzeneggers but he is hell of lot more adventurous than arnold in van damme worked hong kongs premier hardcore action director john woo on fairly lame movie called hard target if you can find bootleg copy woos radically different directors cut is much better than what was eventually released this followup is directed ringo lam city on fire full contact whose hong kong films are distinguished action pictures that have consistently played second fiddle woos more operatic offerings the surprise here is that maximum risk is more effective action flick than either hard target or woos subsequent broken arrow heres the rundown van damme plays french cop named alain moreau who is shaken when policeman friend jeanhugues anglade finds corpse that is alains exact double turns out alain was separated at birth from his twin brother michael who has been killed some russian heavies and some strangely american looking cops alain does some investigating he finds that michael had booked flight new york city and received message from someone there named alex bohemia assuming michaels identity alain flies new york and gets tangled up michaels girlfriend natasha henstridge the fbi and the russian mob in little odessa that is as much as you need know the story is adequate but not overly involving and the major plot points are basically explained you twice just in case you go out for popcorn at the wrong moment there is love story too but did not find it terribly convincing partly because exmodel henstridge is too highstrung in her highprofile debut she had precious few lines as the alien ice queen in species she is great look at and she can certainly read line but what she does here cannot really be described as acting of course acting is not really what she was hired for lost track of whether her shirt comes off more often than van dammes the movie is exceptionally violent bordering on gratuity keep that in mind when planning your date the stunts are spectacular and the fact that you can spot van dammes standin makes his work no less impressive there is only so much you can do car wreck but this movie makes crisp effective use of pileups in handful of frenzied destruction derbies and lam has surprising innovative sense of exactly where the camera should go catch any bit of action the main difference between lam and woo believe is that while woo relies on sheer spectacle gas up his action show pieces lam has figured out more about using cinematic space and doublebarreled points of view make things run do not get me wrong when chow yunfat soars through space pumping bullets out of two pistols and chewing on toothpick glass and confetti littering the air around him in woos hardboiled it is an amazing moment but it is moment that is hard reproduce in for one thing does not yet have chow yunfat while woos movies look like the work of talented upstart maximum risk is surprisingly confident picture the very first shot of the is an awkward overhead view of chase through the streets of european city but lams use of odd camera angles becomes more efficient later on the editing is particularly savvy complement lams shooting style accentuating rather than amplifying the action the performances could have used some fine tuning in particular there is an annoying overwritten manhattan cab driver in the early scenes who should have been toned down or jettisoned completely and the movie does not always overcome the limitations of its genre the story is little mundane although there are some effective moments involving van dammes unrequited feelings toward the brother he never knew he had but it is not often that cranks out truly satisfying action picture and it is doubly surprising that this one should come mere whisper of publicity van damme fans should treat themselves what may well be the mans best movie and international action buffs will no doubt savor this flavorful hong konghollywood hybrid

in many ways twotg does for toughguy movies what la confidential did for police stories there is savviness in its writing and mature patience in allowing the material unfold but suppose we would not expect less from christopher mcquarrie who was responsible for giving us the usual suspects his writing talents are still in tact as he brings us bloody yet intellectual tale of two unabashed but dimwitted thugs and plan gone awry the two goons are parker and longbaugh ryan phillipe and benicio del toro these two men show the hardened wear of those who have always had it tough their troubled youths have forged two nihilistic souls who use their amazing gunplay skills survive given the choice of minimum wage or petty crime they will always choose the latter yet they are incredibly foolish planners actually these two never really have plan they just improvise along the way hoping that their bravado and arsenal of guns will take care of anything that they might have overlooked their next scheme they cook up about as fast as mcdonalds burger is kidnap some surrogate mother named robin juliette lewis that was hired some welltodo family if all goes well they will receive nice bit of ransom money and life goes on what parker and longbaugh do not realize is that robin is carrying baby for the chidduck family whose patriarch is feared crime boss moreover two bodyguards nicky katt and taye diggs constantly escort her these two protectors find an eerie sense of pleasure when being confronted and tested in life and death situations they would rather die than fail thus their bravado level is equally high but it seems that the testosterone levels of parker and longbaugh are bit higher and they employ some unusual but funtowatch tactics pull off the kidnapping and outrun the pursuers in sort of slowmotion car chase down series of alleyways the next hour or so we watch the chidduck camp regroup and assess their situation during this time additional plot lines come into play and more and more details are revealed because the chidducks can not go the police and because of the special circumstances involving the kidnapping we are introduced more characters that will help influence the outcome we discover that not everyone in the chidduck camp is loyal the cause as result there are undercurrents of conspiracy and elements of betrayal and subterfuge the sepiatoned atmosphere is made all the more fascinating thanks terrific soundtrack emits velvet forebodings shrills of intrigue and crescendos that tell us of life and death situations that are about occur the momentum and the coolness of the however begins fizzle in the last minutes featured an overly extended shootout where our two desperados try make their way off the ransom money you can expect lots of bloodletting and an odd denouement in fact you may admire this more than you like it yet for the most part the way of the gun stays on target it feels cool its elements of conspiracy and gunplay and smart for its invective dialogue and tough guy poetry

marie charlotte rampling aberdeen and jean bruno cremet sorcerer are comfortable sixtyish married couple looking forward peaceful vacation at their second home in lit et mix on their first full day marie sunbathes as jean goes for swim hours later maries initiated full scale search when jean has not returned but no trace of him is found marie returns paris and resumes her life including chats jean at the end of each day in francois ozons under the sand maries expat british friend amanda alexandra stewart frantic and her french husband gerard pierre vernier try snap marie out of her denial dinner party where they introduce her the handsome vincent jacques nolot nenette et boni yet marie suggests that gerard accompany her and jean their gym the next morning eventually marie does begin dating vincent but she discusses him jean and even smiles at jean hidden behind bedroom curtain when she makes love vincent slowly though reality continues chip away at maries fantasy life her bank advises her that without access jeans account she needs reduce her spending one of her university students she is reading virginia woolfs the waves turns out be one of the young men who participated in the beach search then police arrive asking her identify the clothing of body they have found washed up from the ocean that night jeans not at home when she returns their apartment her motherinlaw andree tainsy cruelly insists that jean simply abandoned her out of boredom finally marie goes the police insisting on viewing the body horrified she is been warned it was in an advanced state of putrefaction she laughs when handed bagged watch insisting that this is not her husband under the sand is character study and melancholy portrait of aging have lost my youth marie declares and loss charlotte rampling given the chance portray an older yet still sexual woman runs it bringing us into the mind of the character her chemistry bruno cremet is startlingly natural as marie returns from her first date vincent she sits on the couch jean did he kiss you he asks the mood the two create is incredibly intimate and sad ozon water drops on burning rocks see the sea who cowrote the script emmanuelle bernheim marcia romano and marina de van has turned in more mature work than his previous creepy see the sea while he cleverly never lets us see jean enter the water that fateful day leaving number of possibilities accident suicide escape open he definitely tips his hand towards certain outcome cinematography antoine hiberli and jeanne lapoirie water drops on burning rocks glides around marie their shot as she initially searches the oceans horizon for sign of jean conveys her panic or captures ramplings exotic face in mood divining closeup in an inventive fantasy scene marie imagines jeans hands massaging her feet while in state of autoarousal his two hands become four then more combined her own becoming almost one person orgy and recalling roman polanskis repulsion original music philippe rombi quietly adds the overall melancholy under the sand is unique portrait of loss it would make an fascinating double bill liv ullmanns faithless from earlier this year another character study of woman facing loss for different reasons

is it just me or have disney films gradually lost their appeal was almost stunned the quality of who framed roger rabbit fun unique look at world where cartoons and people lived together the little mermaid harkened back and perhaps surpassed the classic disney animations from the first half of the century however the endless stream of the little mermaid wannabes is getting me you know the spiel lame plot recycled from some wellknown story colorful almost psychedelic animation the lead character who learns valuable moral lesson the comedic sidekicksidekicks the seemingly unattainable love interest few catchy songs few injokes for adults and the occasional out of place warnerbrotherscoyotefalloffthecliff type joke it is formula and like any formula it gets tiresome that is why am delighted hear that disney recently picked up the international distribution rights the works of ghibli japanese cartoon studio from what have seen of their movies kikis delivery service and the already englishdubbed and american distributed my neighbor totoro foreign audiences are in for treat these movies particularly kikis delivery service are wonderfully original and entertaining kikis delivery service starts an unusual premise kiki upon hearing forecasts of clear skies decides it is time for her leave home this is unusual because kiki is not college student or young adult making her start on the world but thirteen year old girl eager begin her training as witch her mother is also witch and as thirteen is the obligatory age for such training her parents treat her leaving understandingly and put up only token resistance just the idea of witch heroine may scare away some audiences but no mention is made of the occult and the subject is dealt harmlessly throughout the movie kikis mother acts as village doctor and kiki is able do no more than fly on broom kiki must choose city move and what she chooses is the costar of the movie german seaport town far removed from the country life she has been used initially lost in the impersonal hugeness of her surrounding she is discouraged and unable support herself though her rudimentary skills as witch on the verge of leaving for new town she uses her power of flight deliver pacifier baby who dropped it the favor eventually blossoms into her working as courier onepersons delivery service this is where the movie becomes shockingly good kikis job is catalyst for her realizing the beauty of the city and the world around her the townspeople she is put in contact possess an inner worth that does not seem forced or artificial but merely derived from looking at ordinary people in different light they are three dimensional impossible quickly evaluate possessing of faults and understandably reserving in kindness towards strange girl however each one has something about them some interest or trait that makes them interesting and unique the personal beauty of the citizens is complimented the beauty of the surroundings the seaport town genuinely looks impressive capturing the european charm of medieval city adapted the more modern needs of the this beauty is beauty depth for every detail left in dozens are only hinted at could probably go on all day but will not suffice it say that many of these minor details could have been the highlight of the movie some of my favorites are kikis relationship the bakers husband although he is quiet never shown speaking kiki throughout the movie and he initially scares her his kindness wins her friendship in the garage of deliverees house can be found vintage model two old ladies have relationship evolving from masterservant friendfriend such details gives the impression that the beauty shown in the movie is only the tip of the iceberg added on top of this is lesson on the importance of selfworth kiki initially seems derive much of her selfworth from the beauty of her surroundings and the people around her but an encounter rude girl crashes down her bewonderment making her question the importance of such beauty this causes kiki lose faith in herself however kiki comes realize not only the beauty of her surroundings but the innate beauty inside her seeing kiki regain faith in herself is marvelous and the principal device used do it is so sublime that do not even want hint at it the ending of the movie has subtle charm combined sense of awe and ironically the most disneyesque moment have ever seen if you do not hold your breath in wonder you might want get medical attention the movie steers free of many of the disney conventions there is no violence however cartoonish no songanddance number and kikis pet cat jiji is more friend than comedic sidekick although jiji is given many funny lines and scenes however would be surprised if disney does not give jiji more jokes or at least the voice of some comedian refreshingly enough the moral lesson of the movie is not selfcontradicted habit disney movies have gotten into beauty and the beast beautiful belle for instance learned that beauty was derived from persons inside and was then rewarded having the beast turn into handsome prince in snazzy clothing kiki on the other hand learns separate her wardrobe from her selfimage and nothing more is made of her early desires for better clothing than illustrating her increased maturity at the end of the another difference disney movies is in the style of animation for kikis delivery service not as colorful and dynamic as disney animation can be but greater attention realism and detail it fits the movie t this is particularly true scenes of kikis flights the extreme realism of the birds in flight near kiki is magnificent behold and helps these scenes capture the wonder of flight better than any other have ever seen am not sure when or how this movie will be released in the united states disney tentatively plans theater release of monoko hime shortly following the summer japanese release and should start releasing the other ghibli films after that would guess that some will be released on video and some will be theatrically released in peak seasons no competing disney release although the wait is unfortunate it is good know that it is being released at all for kikis delivery service is definitely movie worthy of widespread promotion and release watch this movie along man bites dog and perhaps something woody allen this is the best movie have ever seen

insane but inspired musical about alferd packer the first man ever tried for cannibalism in america as the story unfolds we learn what events led packer trey parker supposedly killing and eating the five men who got lost while accompanying him through the mountains of colorado in search of gold throughout packer must contend evil trappers bent on stealing his prized horse tribe of ute indians that does not seem quite on the mark and terrible winter storm that leads the eventual cannibalism parker obviously knows his musicals very well because the viewer is also treated some of the most maddeningly catchy songs appear in he would accomplish this again in his postcannibal musical motion picture south park bigger longer and uncut apart from the inherent interest of seeing pre south park parker and stone in their first effort cannibal also offers up some pretty decent laughs the aforementioned ute indian tribe that packers group encounters is definite highlight as are two rousing musical numbers about snowmen one of ends on comedically deadly note stones humphrey character steals the show especially when complaining about the prospect of having eat butt or revealing what is underneath his muff cap jason mchughs character of mr miller is the stand out performance though as he offers hilarious dissenting voice the proceedings as mentioned before parkers songs are very catchy you will be hard pressed get it is shpadoinkle day out of your head once you have heard it incidentally the braniff logo that appears at the end of every south park episode is scored few notes from this song other songs you will find yourself humming include when was on top of you love ballad the trappers song the villains leit motif and hang the bastard the rousing finale thankfully none of these songs are quite as embarrassing find yourself singing in public as south park bigger longer uncuts songs are released as pickup through troma studios the is available on videocassette and dvd the videocassette includes an intro the beautiful jane jensen and an interview segment lloyd kaufman discussing his admiration for parker and stone and the fact that they had been hired for zucker brothers turned out be the hilarious baseketball there are also multiple trailers for upcoming troma films as for the dvd well that is different story probably one of the best dvd packages of the year and potentially of all time cannibal the musical the dvd is massive achievement presented in full frame only the disc has the usual troma inclusions the tour of troma the troma intelligence test trailers for upcoming releases but where the disc truly shines is in its cannibal specific extras the first thing must note is the transfer is about as beautiful as any have ever seen on any disc the picture is crisp clear and free from any noticeable artifacts add that one of the funniest commentary tracks have ever heard featuring trey parker matt stone jason mchugh dian bachar and andy kemler getting drunker and drunker as the track continues and you still have not scratched the surface of the extras there is also behind the scenes footage of the shooting of the clip trey matt and lemmy of the band motorhead from the terror firmer an index for easy location of all of the songs in the and finally an index of all the songs as performed the cast of stage production of cannibal it is good see this finally get the treatment it deserves kudos the entire production staff at troma and aix for making one of the most entertaining dvds have seen in very long time

allen star of many brian depalma movie in the early eighties has brief throwaway part towards the end of out of sight as the maid of crooked financier in keeping her past performances allen wears little more than green velvet victorias secret ensemble begs the question did they really need costume designer for this out of sight is not likely secure ms allen the kind of plaudits bestowed upon pam grier who likewise returned from out of obscurity appear in another recent elmore leonard adaptation jackie brown but it is intriguing see her name kicking off the also starring credits given her limited screen time the real stars of out of sight are george clooney batman robin way of r and jennifer lopez selena whose winning chemistry coupled steven soderberghs freezeframe directorial technique help the retain the charismatic charm of leonards original work the success of get shorty three years ago filmmakers have realized that adapting an elmore leonard novel can be an easier proposition than trying dream up storyline from scratch in out of sight clooney stars as jack foley career criminal who specializes in unarmed robberyhe just waltzes into banks and politely makes withdrawal claiming that his partner just another customer it so happens will shoot the manager if the teller does not comply for all of jacks niceguy charm though he is not very lucky his latest scam lands him in floridas glades correctional facility federal marshal karen sisco lopez coincidentally arrives at the prison just as jack and his buddy ving rhames typically appealing are breaking out there is brief struggle and jack bundles himself and karen into the trunk of the getaway car it is in these cramped confines pressed intimately together that jack and karen start falling for one another the mutual attraction continues as the couple on opposite sides of the law slip in and out of one anothers grasp karen follows jack detroit where he is about pull off another heist this time cache of uncut diamonds from incarcerated businessman richard ripley played toupeesporting albert brooks almost unrecognizable in the prison scenes it is during this final capergoneawry that allen makes her scant appearance clooneys range as an actor is limited but he has undeniable charm lopez too is easy on the eyes but she demonstrates more depth in her portrayal of karen tough yet tender professional she dispenses hit men as easily as she outmaneuvers sleazy pickup artists in bar especially cute is sequence in karen fantasizes about jack in motel bathtub admirably supporting clooney and lopez are don cheadle as fellow felon maurice snoopy miller steve zahn as the perennially stoned glenn michaels and dennis farina as karens dad who affectionately buys her piece add couple of uncredited cameos from jackie brown cast members and out of sight proves be lot of fun not as hip and clever as shorty perhaps or as complex and colorful as brown but loads of fun nonetheless

synopsis in phantom menace the galaxy is divided into power groups whose interests will inevitably collide in later sequels there is an overarching galactic united nationstype organization called the senate presided weak chancellor within the senate two camps are at odds bickering isolationist alliance called the republic and their aggressive rival the trade federation preserving law and order are council of jedi knights who are meanwhile searching for prophesied chosen one of virgin birth manipulating events behind the scenes is dangerous reemerging clan called the dark lords of sith so shadowy and secretive that they comprise phantom menace jedi knight quigon jinn liam neeson and his apprentice obiwan kenobi ewan mcgregor witness an invasion of teenage queen amidalas home planet naboo and befriend gungan named jar jar ahmed best on the desert planet of tatooine the two jedi jar jar and amidala natalie portman attend lengthy drag race involving the young boy anakin skywalker jake lloyd the five protagonists try solicit help for freeing naboo visiting the city planet of coruscant where lot of debate and political maneuvering takes place can they free amidalas helpless planet opinion on tv last night watched young wannabe celebs pay ticket and come running out of theaters bask in front of news cameras gushing testimonials of the phantom menaces greatness in exchange for few seconds of being on national television given this kind of media mania wondered if phantom menace the most anticipated movie of could possibly live up the extraordinary hype that preceded it does phantom menace match the exaggerated hype director george lucas answers it is only movie me any movie russiansounding accents for bad guys jamaican accents for good guys and middle easternsounding accents for seedy gamblers accents can be expected be more tongue in cheek than profound visually star wars episode the phantom menace is kid show where parents can take their young ones marvel at childfriendly cgi characters and wondrous backdrops even if the character dialogue mostly geopolitics is beyond the level of children it is left parents patiently explain the conversation droid origins family lineage the definitions of terms like blockade appeasement federation alliance symbiosis satellitecontrolled robots et cetera at least this much is clear there is plenty of eye candy and in the last few minutes it is good guys and joe camel lookalikes versus caped horned red devil character and his mechanical hordes weaknesses weaknesses lie in the writing and in the performance at first it seems like the is be an invasion story but then phantom takes an hourlong detour cover one chariot race before returning the invasion theme this dilutes the central story additionally smaller scenes seem written self consciously as if they were added more fill us in on extraneous background information for other movies rather than form an integral part of the present movie veteran actors liam neeson and ewan mcgregor noticeably outperform the other acting leads better ensemble chemistry between the five leads and background information that is central tight story line could have made have given phantom stronger performances and storytelling punch strengths on the bright side phantom menace as bigbudget production is far ahead of the competition in terms of making whimsical creatures worlds and vehicles appear real the boasts sophisticated topoftheline visuals and quality exotic costumes musical score entertaining enough stand alone and three worthwhile sequences in the second half bottom line seeing the is entertaining and informative like visual theme park star wars filler information serving as dialogue between impressive money shots we are bound be completely inundated star wars publicity music and tieins for the next few months

at one point during brian de palmas crime epic scarface the radiant michelle pfeiffer turns ranting al pacino and pops question that the audience has no doubt been wanting ask for themselves cannot you stop saying fuck all the time fucking good question that it may not be an honour that instills the filmmakers pride but as far as can tell oliver stones script contains the said expletitive more times than any other in cinema history yet it would be shame if bad language is all de palmas scarface is remembered for because this is damn fine gangstar flick the overall structure is similar howard hawks original but this time the scene has switched miami florida and our antiheros chosen vice is cocaine traffiking pacino sporting thick cuban accent gives one the best performances of his career golden globe nominated as tony montana cuban refugee criminal past who flees castro and comes america live the american dream and live it out he does lashings of violence abuse murder and the funny white powder from his earliest jobs as drug runner for various middlemen tony montana makes it clear everyone he meets that he is not man be fucked sorry soon he is the king of the cocaine heap but his hot head and an increasingly out of control drug addiction prove his undoing never do your own stash warns one character early in the as sure as night follows day the emperor of miami eventually falls writer oliver stone and director brian de palma make an explosive combination here stones script offers solid storytelling and some fine character development montana is fascinating uneducated but calculating straight shooter who speaks from the heart an ambitious violent man yet one conscience man fiercely protective of his beautiful year old sister not wanting her be sucked into the glitzy dangerous world he inhabits pacino is dynamite taking the role brooding bristling energy in his more recent films has often degenerated into just simple overracting pfeiffer also registers strongly as the gangstar mole no inner life only once does tony express real affection for her and his desire have children and even then you sense all he really wants is regular screw and beautiful object show off his friends and she is happy oblige this is not as meaty role for pfieffer as sharon stones was in casino but its an effective one nonetheless and she aquits herself well as director de palma sets up number of dramatic scenes his typical stylistic brauva the escalating tension he creates in various mob situations drug deal gone wrong an assination attempt is often thrilling and in this respect he is every bit the equal of scorese and coppola where he differs from say coppolas godfather trilogy is in his overall treatment coppola gives his crime sagas an operatic sweep whereas in scarface de palma opts for grittier feel and it perfectly suits the material the only major botch is giorgio moroders mostly crap synthesier score it is just not right and unfortunately compromises the impact of some otherwise good scenes as expected scarface is very violent at times but you should not be watching gangster movies if that upsets you at over two and half hours in length it is true epic and if you are fan of the genre you will love kfilled minute of it

for any groom on the verge of proposing marriage his girlfriend there are certain rules that he needs follow firstly fill her life happiness and romance during the courtship secondly buy her beautiful ring that glitters as brightly as her eyes thirdly find the perfect moment and location propose finally the groomwannabe should probably get her parents blessing of these four the last one can be nightmare meeting parents is rite of passage fraught unexpected questions bouts of nervousness the reality of being disliked and the inability make positive impression if you are lucky things will go smoothly but if you are greg focker ben stiller everything will go wrong and name like that how could it not when greg first meets his fianc es father jack byrnes the grimacing robert deniro greg immediately feels overwhelmed and is put on the defensive when he tells jack that he is male nurse the incorrigible dad shoots back not many men in your profession huh greg it is definitely not good start but greg is determined win him over and it is this desire that fuels the movie he first takes small steps such as agreeing say grace before dinner it does not matter that he is jewish if daddy byrnes asks him say grace then that is what he is going gamely do oh god you are such good god he moons his discomfort at trying force out simple prayer will make you chuckle but when jack gives him the deniro squint that familiar unsettling gaze that gives deniro that aura of invincibility it is pretty hard not grin things get progressively worse for greg and that is too bad because he is genuinely likable guy romantic heart eventually he begins try so hard that he starts mess everything up committing host of gaffes that embarrass humiliate or injure other people it is neverending ordeal of missteps miscues and mistakes he buys some champagne but uncorking the bottle leads disastrous circumstances he tries find jacks missing cat but his method of solving the problem leads only more trouble and there are several other episodes each one trumping the next in outrageousness the more our wellmeaning beau screwed up the more the audience groaned in sympathy we liked greg and we liked this movie meet the parents is farcical comedy that certainly has its moments just sit back and watch greg get into trouble no matter what the situation whether its playing harmless game of water volleyball or sneaking smoke on the roof of the house things will horribly go wrong we laugh at gregs expense but love often makes person do dumb things and ben stiller has the knack of playing the romantic fool deniro is also affable tough on the outside yet sentimental on the inside their tugofwar is often funny the slapstick is elaborate and there are several topical throwaway gags mostly targeted at the airline industry make this an amusing yet smart lampoon about future inlaws from hell

i like movies albert brooks and really like movies directed and written albert brooks lost in america and defending your life are two of my favorite comedies his humor is of kind that is not very prevalent in movies today inundated as we are films revel in their aim toward the lowest common denominator you will rarely see any slapstick in an albert brooks while the dialog will not be as oppressive as in some of the independent talk films are finding their way into theaters the situations in his characters find themselves are ones we can often identify but even if we cannot brooks has the talent make them comfortable and therefore we laugh teenagers and jim carrey fans probably will not find an albert brooks movie very funny but people who look for more than what we could find on television probably will put simply brooks comedy is intelligent mother is albert brooks latest and it does not disappoint brooks plays john henderson middleaged science fiction writer just coming off his second divorce he makes an attempt at dating but fails miserably he then has dinner his brother jeff rob morrow successful sports agent who seems live the ideal life jeff has good job loving family and most of all warm relationship their mother beatrice debbie reynolds after dinner john witnesses telephone conversation between jeff and beatrice and is at the same time amazed and sickened how hunkydory the dialog is in comparison beatrice always hints at fault in john and his career every time she talks him and john gives it right back her at the end of one of their conversations where beatrice has just picked apart johns life she says love you and john replies know you think you do the thing is beatrice is not overt her criticisms but instead gives them in that mothering way is tantamount nitpicking and guilt loading it is the kind that goes something like yes dear think you do that wonderfully but it seems as though nothing he does makes her happy there is always the big but john believes that his mother is somehow connected his failed relationships women either because of his flawed selfesteem caused his need for validation or perhaps because he tends unconsciously seek out women who remind him of his mother in an oedipal manner he comes the conclusion that since his problems are rooted in his boyhood home he should move back in his mother for while just see what kinds of feelings come out and that be able sort out why his life is the way it is great experiment he calls it brooks own brand of humor really shines in this especially in the interaction john has his mother there is scene where john has just arrived at his mothers house and after having driven from los angeles sausalito and having explained his mother about the great experiment beatrice asks now explain me again why you do not want stay at hotel she still does not get it and it is absolutely hilarious in the same scene we get little glances at the life his mother leads when she tries feed him food that is no longer fresh she apparently buys in great quantities and refrigerates it until the lettuce is wilted and the sherbet is iced over when john points out the ice on the sherbet beatrice tells him not worry about the protective glaze you have named the ice asks john he is also surprised at the variety of items beatrice keeps in the refrigerator such as twentypound block of cheese the freezer was good invention says john but it is not supposed be used for everything that is why it is smaller than the refrigerator it is something most of us find strangely familiar brooks is also master at employing the non sequitur for example in defending your life his and meryl streeps characters are in comedy club having discussion when they are finished and walk out brooks cuts the comic on stage who is just at the point of delivering his punch line and so the moral is if you have fart go outside you do not know what the joke was because you could not hear him during the entire scene but must have laughed for the next five minutes it seemed so out of context in this brooks uses the same trick couple of times open or close scene do not want give them away but suffice it say they work just as well as they have in the past johns purpose for staying his mother is learn and we as the audience learn right along him his mother is not the fascinating type begin but as john spends more time her we learn things about her personality and her lifestyle that give her depth watching the character of beatrice unfold is every bit as enjoyable as the humor that accompanies it each step of the way on screen brooks does an excellent job playing this kind of character you get the feeling he often believes he is the only sane person in an insane world in way he is very much like yosarian of catch expect something of an attitude casting debbie reynolds as beatrice is perfect she assumes the part ease even moving and speaking little slowly and is just so adorable it is hard get mad at her character this only helps the audience share the frustration john feels when dealing her as his first choice brooks originally wanted lure nancy reagan out from her acting retirement play beatrice but the former actress and first lady could not leave her husband who was beginning show symptoms of alzheimers disease that may be just as well since reynolds lends softness the character enhances it immensely rob morrow also does good job at playing the younger brother who has always been mothers favorite and for all his success in his job and family is slowly exposed as mamas boy the only things that hold this movie back from being better are couple of plot holes solid connection is not really made between johns troubles and his reasons for living his mother additionally the end results of the experiment do not necessarily jibe the stated goals and although this may have been sloppy screenwriting how can you be mad at the guy who also wrote this beatrice you must think am some kind of moron john no think your someone who thinks am moron beatrice well it takes one know one

note there are spoilers regarding the films climax the election of course we see matthew broderick man torn primal state he is been unfaithful his wife lied and manipulated his students and the same token they have demeaned his masculinity his selfrespect his desperate attempt at changing the world and yet he equates the cause of his pain his torment tracy flick reese witherspoon no matter how many students have come and gone and disappointed him as an educator she is the real threat about give in and divulge that she is won only lone vote brodericks mccalister turns in defeat sees tracys euphoric celebration in the outside corridor and says no the fact that he simultaneously lusts after her ideologically further illustrates that freudian foundation of entitlement all men no matter how obscure have in their relationships traditional expectation of success usurp and surpass women as proverbial industry she cannot go higher than him he will not allow it and what is amazing about election is that every word of that criticism is drawn from rather opaque metaphor early in the we learn that tracy was romantically and then sexually involved now departed teacher it is like payne and taylor his coscreenwriter have taken tracy girl desperate for friendship loyalty and almost perversely drawn the mythological pattern of kids who were so utterly rejected their peers that they found sitting at the teachers lunch table more fitting an unlikely extreme her as the protagonist and it is amazing the compassion that we have it seems so real us and not merely because it is happened before splashed all over the front pages but because of the all around nice persona of these people we easily dismiss the truly wayward deeds of the characters it is mandy barnetts if you will be the teacher playing winsomely over the closing credits that payne skewers the tenets of his detractors most final viscous injection of bittersweet irony sexuality though is not the only basis for paynes satire or its success it also makes telling point about politics friendship and class boundaries satire is required or ought be anyway take itself seriously or act so while the audience does not it is fine line straddle but some films ignore it altogether drop dead gorgeous leaps infuriatingly mind payne and taylor hit the right chord their characters are real people neither is perfect but rather both of the leads are flawed misguided individuals who retain somewhat noble intentions at heart we sympathize them but still as satire their idiosyncratic behavior and their wrongdoing is taken an extreme for the audience knowingly chuckle but also reflect and meditate about minus half point though for payne admitting not having seen ferris buellers day off whatever

martin scorseses films used intimidate me because of his reputation felt obligated appreciate them as deep art rather than as great flicks as much as enjoyed them usually felt like missed something learned from scorseses casino that whatever techniques he uses are merely there enhance the story no mystical interpretation is required appreciate his movies for example in casino he uses subtitles when robert deniro and joe pesci are using code words each other there was no meaning more exotic than that subtitles were the most succinct way for him tell the audience what was really going on or toward the end when he uses three quick dissolves compress scene of car backing away from building again the simple mundane explanation is that it helped the pacing do not mean say that his techniques are not creative or goodlooking but he simply uses the best tool for the job it should not have surprised me then that kundun about mystical religion actually turned out be quite straightforward the movie follows the life of the th dalai lama the spiritual and political leader of tibet the movies title is another name for the dalai lama means ocean of wisdom his story is told in strict chronological order and there are only few cinematic visions embellish the literal story one of makes an interesting statement pay attention the films opening shot and watch where it is repeated we first glimpse the dalai lama when he is two years old his curiosity and selfassuredness capture the attention of monk wandering in search of the new lama test is arranged see if this boy really is the reincarnation of the dalai lamas who have gone before several items belonging the previous dalai lama are laid before the boy alongside some other items the child is asked if he recognizes any of the items as his own the boy picks correctly proving that he is the new and the old dalai lama scorsese and longtime editor thelma schoonmaker were kind enough allow the possibility that the child was taking his cues from the monk before selecting an item he would look at the monk perhaps for some sort of confirmation sometimes he picked right the first time and sometimes he made second choice either way whether through reincarnation or quick human perception the tibetans were assured of choosing boy who could be wise perceptive leader from this point on the boy is raised as the reincarnation of the lamas spirit and the future leader of nation it is great weight put on the mind of child in the s it might be grounds for call social services but the young lama accepts his destiny without any apparent emotional damage neither the great power nor the awesome responsibility keeps him from becoming genuinely likeable wellrounded person certain patterns take shape over the years for example the dalai lama is fascinated technology radios clocks and telescopes are some of his favorite toys when he is old enough accept his leadership he makes plans modernize isolated tibet he also has soft spot for creatures who are suffering or in pain including herd animals it is nearly running gag that he will buy sheep keep them from being herded slaughter but the most ominous constant throughout his life is the presence and threat of tibets gigantic neighbor china tibet and its leaders prove correct in fearing china as first the propaganda then the political pressure and finally the armies come across their common border the chinese invasion is so successful that the lamas life is in danger if he stays the movie ends when after much agonizing the dalai lama leaves tibet for india the story does not lead up cinematic climax as strongly as most feature films do it just does not fit that mold if it were forced into such shape it would have been completely different movie perhaps more like seven years in tibet is good in its own right the pacing of kundun is more calm and level than that the structure of the is made fit the characters and events not viceversa perhaps because the pace is slower we have more time notice the beautiful art vestments and architecture of tibet mandala tibetan sand painting beautiful vibrant colors is shown throughout the movie the robes and hats of state are bright red and gold the bricks are rich reddish brown not unlike the skin tone of the tibetans even the touchstone pictures logo before the movie is usually light blue is the red and gold of tibet philip glass composed the music for kundun and he was the perfect choice for those who do not know of glass his music is like tibetan mandala his building blocks are lots of small notes tiny grains of music are first grouped then repeated in patterns these patterns create interesting textures are themselves part of larger composition people will not be flocking kundun for it is great ending or talking about its outstanding plot but it does have lot offer an interesting lifetime exotic sights rich cinematography and innovative music it gives interesting insight into tibetan buddhism and takes warm look at the dalai lama as person on top of it all is the cinematic mastery of martin scorsese who gives the strong beautiful consistent look

robert redfords river runs through it is not watch often it is masterpiece one of the better films of recent years until it was my second favorite of all time the acting and direction is topnotch never sappy always touching friend of mine once reported that he avoided it because was afraid it would just be really politically correct and tick me off all could do was tell him go in unbiased and enjoy it is one of the few movies that has completely reduced me tears but certain memories should not often be rereleased in the last few shots you have cry upon my first viewing left bawling it is not flawless but it is so very good that you cannot help but be effected the opening is dangerously nolstalgic and sentimental watching these shots of people who have been dead so long gives you feeling of perspective and history observation that you will find in very few other films martin scorsese once described the movies as dream state like taking dope and immersing yourself in an alternative world that is what river runs through it does it exploits the unique power of cinema engross you and help forget your real self both times have seen it its been hard again quote scorsese waking up but the dream is lovely

richard gere is not one of my favorite actors however like courtroom dramas and this looked good enough take chance on was not disappointed it was not great but it was interesting and took several unexpected turns one thing what is the title not only is it extremely forgettable it does not really have much do the as far as could determine in the long run it will probably hurt the as people will not be able think of or remember it martin vail richard gere is grandiose defense attorney he loves the money and the fame that go along defending successfully rich scum such as mafia men and drugdealers once he sees that the accused killer of prominent chicago archbishop is babyfaced alter boy he wants in on the case presumably for the press he will get we soon find out that the prosecutor assigned is former lover janet venable laura linney vail himself is former prosecutor and quit because of tensions between himself and the district attorney played very well john mahoney frasiers father on the tv series there is an underlying theme of dichotomy in the movie people have public faces and private faces we see this in the murdered archbishop in the accused and most strongly defense attorney martin vail richard gere does fairly good job at first he appears be money and attentiongrabbing lawyer no consideration of the truth but we see another side as he becomes seeker of justice and comes believe in his client alfre woodard as the judge is capable though somewhat wasted in standard role laura linney also does journeyman work nothing spectacular but acceptable her relationship vail is believable their verbal fencing adds the the actor who playes vails investigator unfortunately do not remember his name is quite good his female assistant she looked very familiar but cannot remember where have seen her was also capable but unspectacular the best performance in the was edward norton he was excellent as the timid altarboy turned alleged butcher boy of st mikes was impressed the depth of the plot there are redherrings and deadends that in lesser would lead predictable ending liked the plot twists the took and most of the supporting characters thus give primal fear respectable rating

when you get out of jail you can kill him starring ashley judd tommy lee jones bruce greenwood rated double jeopardy is lurid prepostrous thriller that is also one of the years most enjoyable it is an uncompromisingly brutal cheerfully anarchic hyperactive actioner that has mission and never diverts from it there is not moment here when the events on screen do not have direct bearing on the plot once the gets going it never stops it has been branded as the female version of the fugitive and that is probably correct assessment of the plot but the itself has little in common the andrew davisharrison ford collaboration besides the presence of star tommy lee jones not even bothering character introduction director bruce beresford floors the gas pedal from the getgo and never finds the brake we meet rather hastily libby and nick parsons ashley judd and bruce greenwood respectively seemingly happy married couple son matty age they go out on sailboat one night and after period of some rockin sex they go sleep libby hears strange noise wakes up and discovers that she is covered blood she follows red trail the upper deck where she finds knife and out of astonishment picks it up at that convenient moment the coast guard shows up and libby is arrested her lawyer friend puts up defense in court but though we know she is innocent the evidence against her is too compelling her friend adopts her son and she goes prison once in prison she makes phone call her friend her friend gives her son the phone nick walks in the room little matty screams daddy the phone goes dead libby realizes that the man she is imprisoned for killing is not even dead she gets some advice from prisonerformer lawyer who tells her that since the state already convicted her of killing her husband they cannot convict her of the same crime again meaning that when she gets paroled she can kill him and they cannot touch her after weirdly short amount of time she gets out of parole she is sent live at house other recent parolees under the command of parole officer travis lehman tommy lee jones she sets out on mission find her husband and get her son back turns out be much more difficult than anticipated she winds up tracking him all the way new orleans where she finds out that he has long killed his girlfriend and her sons adopter double jeopardy is based on an assumption that is legally false the law stating that nobody can be convicted twice for the same crime assumes that it is the same crime same time same place same circumstances it is not like it matters this is rollickingly good thriller intense exciting fast and furious it is silly alright but this is the kind of you just do not question in some films plausibility is everything double jeopardy however is not concerned making sense its sole purpose is entertain and it does judd helps the tremendously in difficult role this is her breakout boxoffice performance and she is terrific she brings some emotion what could have been onedimensional role giving the movie little soul go along its effective chase scenes and action set pieces tommy lee jones basically just reprises the role for he won an oscar in the fugitive but the movie makes good use of his stonefaced wit thankfully too double jeopardy refrains from developing romance between libby and travis subplot doubtlessly would have interfered the films story this is one of those movies where cops are the bad guys and took sort of sick pleasure in that the sheer anarchy of the proceedings was nothing short of wonderful as ashley judd kicks the crap out of every authority figure in the book after all the idealistic features featuring hero cops deft fbi agents and the virtues of the american legal system it is great see movie that does not so much demonstrate their fallacy as it delights in their failure double jeopardy is really good but it is not the kind of good that is remembered or recognized awards it is one of those movies better viewed the brain turned off otherwise your brain will be busy ruining your experience this is thriller that is not concerned being smart or plausible instead it diverts all attention the action this year is second none

let us say you live at the end of an airport runway large jetliners continuously pass over your house rattling your windows and allowing few moments of peace let us say the ground beneath your feet is also contaminated toxic substances and high voltage power lines run across steel towers only yards from your home now let us say an airport conglomerate wants buy your property in order lengthen the runway and offers you more than it is worth would not you jump in the air and have your bags packed before you landed of course you would but what if this bit of land was your idea of paradise and the house your castle that is what they are darryl kerrigan michael caton and although he is happy that multinational corporation would like buy his home sorry it is not for sale unfortunately the corporation wields quite bit of influence over the australian government serves darryl and his family what amounts an eviction notice not about take this lying down darryl enlists the help of his inept attorney friend dennis denuto tiriel mora and makes determined albeit pathetic attempt fight back the castle an australian comedy rob sitch is perhaps one of the simplest movies have seen in recent memory yet also one of the funniest in fact it is this films reliance on simplicity makes it so successful the good guys and the bad guys are clear the humor is straightforward and the storyline is as uncomplicated as it gets it is the perfect setup for relaxing hilarious good time and as much as hate admit it liked the fact that did not have think all that much while watching this just sat back and enjoyed myself the situation is one we have seen before regular joe fights back against the government or big business or whatever what makes this different is its characters darryl thinks he is got the best life in the world he tells his family that living next power lines is constant reminder of the success of mankind he asks who would ever want go out and eat in fancy restaurant when he is got the meat loaf feast prepared his wife sal anne tenny and he swells pride when his son dale stephen curry digs hole in the yard steve kerrigan anthony simcoe constantly combs the buy and sell ads looking for investments like jousting sticks and overhead projectors while wayne kerrigan is in jail as result of dennis denutos incompetent courtroom maneuvers the great thing about the kerrigans is that they are not so stupid that they get annoying they are just group of simpletons whose naive nature is perfectly harmless and even endearing we look upon them little bit of pity but whole lot of affection screenwriters sitch santo cilauro tom gleisner and jane kennedy pit this lovable bunch of unlikely crusaders against stoic court system and condescending business conglomerate further polarizing the extremes and deepening our feelings for the kerrigans sympathy for their situation the laughter they bring us and the familys wonderful characterization simple as it may be leaves us degree of emotional investment that causes us actually care about what happens them suppose one might wonder how deep characterization can go when your characters are as inane as the kerrigans but trust me it works particularly noted that the writers did not have use slapstick in order get laughs do not get me wrong slapstick when executed well can be genius it is just that too often will resort it is use as shortcut amusing the audience not always successfully instead the jokes in the castle are all hinged upon the dialog uttered these people who have no idea that they are totally skewed the rest of the world when they are themselves the are funny and when they are normal people they are hilarious one of the few problems saw this was detour taken about midway though the kerrigans go out vacation spot for seemingly no reason other than pack in few more jokes and increase the films running time luckily it is funny little detour that while slightly distracting from
